loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr: Mariée, Lucienne a à charge 4 enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle vit en location avec sa petite famille. Les charges du ménage son supportées par son mari, avec une contribution de sa part. Lucienne mène son activité depuis 15 ans qu'elle maîtrise parfaitement et en a une notoriété. Elle vend des charbons et des bois de chauffage aux abords de la gare ferroviaire sise à Vodjè. Ses clients sont constitués des ménages de sa zone environs. Elle fait ses achats au moins 3 fois dans le mois à Cotonou chez les fournisseurs qui viennent faire des livraison sur place. Pour mieux répondre aux attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et obtenu un renouvellement de son crédit à FINADEV. Une partie du revenu supplémentaires généré par le micro crédit sera réinvestie dan son activité et le reste servira à la survie de toute la famille. Son objectif est de voir son commerce évoluer.
texts.en:
Lucienne is a married woman who supports four children, all in school. She rents a place to live with her small family. Household expenses are covered by her husband with contributions from her. Lucienne has had her business for fifteen years. She has mastered it completely and gained a degree of fame from it. She sells charcoal and firewood along side the train station located in Vodjè. Her customers are made up of households in her area. She makes her purchases at least three times a month in Cotonou from suppliers who come make deliveries locally. 

To respond better to customer expectations, Lucienne has requested and obtained a renewal of her FINADEV loan. Part of the extra revenues generated by this micro-loan will be reinvested in her business, and the rest will serve the entire family to live on. Her goal is to see her business advance.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of of charcoal and a truck load of firewood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay for urea, groundnut seeds, and male manual labour for physical activities and weeding.

loans.name: Kasatua

texts.en:
Kasatua, aged 48 years, is married and supports 10 people in the family. He has been in farming for the past four years.

He learned about KADET through other clients registered in his area. This will be his second loan from KADET and he intends to spend the loan to prepare the land for farming and purchase maize seeds and fertilizers.

With his anticipated profit, he wants to expand the farm and he dreams of being a big farmer.

loans.use: to purchase maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with two children. Both of the children graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is clothing for the children.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of low demand for clothing during the dry hot seasons. She dreams of purchasing another tailoring machine in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and establish a dressmaking school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and establish a dressmaking school.

loans.name: Rubare

texts.en:
Rubare, 47 years old, is married with seven children. Two of his children are in school. He has been practicing mixed farming. He has been doing this for the past 17 years.

He learned about KADET through a staff member. This is his second loan. He plans to spend part of the loan in farming and the remainder to purchase more animals.

He hopes to make a profit and use the anticipated profits to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, groundnut seeds, and male manual labour for physical activities and weeding.

loans.name: The Grace Of God Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “The Grace Of God” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mayalie is the leader of this group. The 28-year-old is married with one child. Mayalie has been a businesswoman for three years now. She sells margarine, cotton cloths and body spray. With help of this loan, Mayalie is going to use her share to buy two pieces of cotton cloths and two cartons of margarine.

loans.use: to buy cotton cloths and margarine

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 25-year-old businessman. He is married with one child. He has been offering mobile-phone service and selling mobile phones for the past one year with a monthly income of 10,200 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Samson will use the loan to buy mobile phones for selling. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child and expand the business. His hopes are to open a big mobile-phone shop.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones for selling

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 28-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one young child. He has more than 10 years of experience working as an aluminum laborer. And in 2007, he opened his own shop. He cooperates financially with his wife who works as a teacher in a local school to satisfy the family needs. Today, he is asking to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase aluminum needed for his business. Earning a higher income is a must for Abdallah at this stage, since his daughter will enter school in about a year. He should make the needed savings to be able to pay his child's education fees to avoid having any financial problems with the school management.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum needed for his business

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed is a 29-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and three daughters. Nahed lives in Rafah city in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Nahed has a shop where she works with her husband. The shop is for fixing and mending electronic devices and machines.

Nahed receives customers during the day and her husband fixes the machines after his work. Nahed's husband needs a new maintenance and fixing kit. Therefore, she took out a loan of $3,000 from FATEN to pay for the new kit.

Nahed is a conservative woman. Her husband is photographed instead in the project.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Nayfeh

texts.en: Nayfeh is a 35-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and five siblings. She has almost five years of experience selling accessories and jewelry to local customers. She has decided to start her own business in 2006 to help her father pay the household expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory of accessories and jewels. She is very optimistic and looks forward to continuing to expand her business in the coming year.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory of accessories and jewels

loans.name: Kieru

texts.en:
Kieru, aged 25, is single and support his parents. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years and earns a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings.

He knew KADET through a registered client. He has applied for his second loan, which he plans to use to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to purchase sheep for fattening. He dreams that at his age of 35, he will be successful in all he does.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds.

loans.name: Madilo

texts.en:
Madilo is a married man with two children; one attends school while the other one is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, he has operated a carpentry business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge in the lack of availability of materials for the carpentry business. He dreams of expanding and purchasing more equipment in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase raw materials for his carpentry business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase seed and recruit workforce

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transporting fish to her place of operation. Her major dream is to improve her living standards in the future.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks to raise.

loans.name: Raja

texts.en: Raja is a 22-year-old single man who lives in Dier Al-Ghsoon village near Tulkarem in Palestine. Raja is a construction worker in addition to having a store selling clothes. Raja wants to buy a new collection of summer season clothes, but the income he earns isn't enough to pay in cash. Raja has some of the amount but lacks the $3,000 he borrowed  from FATEN. When Raja gets the FATEN loan, he will have a diversity of summer clothes in the store, so he can compete with others, increase customer demand and therefore, increase his income and have better living conditions. Raja is photographed in the picture here.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of summer clothes

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is an ambitious and dedicated 26-year-old businessman. He is married and expecting a baby. He has been operating a general shop to meet the needs of his family. He wants, in the next five years, to have grown his business into a wholesale one so he is able to realize his dream of being financially independent. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, salt and soap. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to make wise investments and plan for his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, salt and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers (complex and urea)

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a vegetable business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of establishing a grocery business in the future.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and bananas. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and bananas.

loans.name: Parsaon

texts.en:
Parsaon has been a farmer for the last three years. He is 33 years old and married. His wife is a housewife and they are blessed with four children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staffs in his area of abode. Since this is his third loan, he plans to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dreams are to be the best and well-known farmer in the area.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a hardworking and visionary 49-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with four children. She has been retailing in a grocery shop to make a living for her family. She wants in the next five years to have expanded and stabilized her business so that she becomes financially stable and able to provide a decent life for her family. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy beans, kale, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy beans, kale, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Festus

texts.en: Festus is an ambitious 30-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with a one-year-old child. To make a living, for the last two years he has been engaged in the transportation industry using a motorcycle. Previously, he was an employee. He wants in the next five years to be able to build rental houses. His dream is to build residential flats. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a motorbike. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to serve his customers satisfactorily and maintain good customer relations.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children. Two of her children attend school and the other one is still too young for school. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and clothing.

For the past year, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passerby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the hot dry season, the availability of fruit for sale is minimal. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groundnut seeds and fertilizer and to recruit men to plow their plots of land.

loans.name: Katambo

texts.en:
Katambo is a married man with five children:  two sons and three girls. He owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years, he has operated a workshop business, selling furniture to his neighbors and passersby. Katambo also operates a retail shop, which contributes to his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. His dream is to establish a real estate houses in the future.

With the KSHS 100,000, he wants to purchase a power saw, timber and diesel. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a power saw, timber and diesel fuel

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 26 years old, married and has two children. He has been a potato farmer for the past five years. He learned about KADET through advertisement done by KADET. 

He has applied for his second loan from KADET, which he plans to use to buy potatoes to plant and chemicals to spray. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to plow back into the farm.

loans.use: to buy potatoes to plant and chemicals to spray

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groundnut seeds and complex fertilizer as well as recruit workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and bread to sell

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.ru:
Хидоят умная и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и мать 3 детей. Более 10 лет она занимается куплей продажей детской обуви, и она набрала богатый опыт данному бизнесу. Хидоят занимается в данном бизнесе с удовольствием и любит свое дело.  Она всегда встречает своих клиентов с улыбкою, и обслуживает их с удовольствием. Она хочет, чтобы её клиенты всегда уходили с довольными лицами и приходили еще. Хидоят всегда старается, привозит качественные товары для своих клиентов. Она хотела бы получить  кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки новой ассортимент обуви. Она заранее хочет поблагодарить всех кредиторов за их поддержку и поощрение.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Hidoyat is an intelligent and ambitious woman. She is married and the mother of three children. For more than ten years, she is involved in buying and selling children's shoes, and she gained valuable experience in this business. Hidoyat engages in this work with pleasure and loves her job. She always greets her customers with a smile and serves them with pleasure. She wants her customers to always leave with happy faces and more to come.Hidoyat always tries to bring quality products to her customers. She would like to receive a loan in the sum of US $3,000 to purchase a new assortment of shoes. She wants to thank in advance all the lenders for their support and encouragement.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of shoes

loans.name: Faithful Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Faithful” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Ramatu is the leader of this group. Ramatu is 37 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in primary school and two are in secondary school. Ramatu sells market food like salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc. With the help of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy salt, margi, palm oil, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with two children. One of her children attends school and one has graduated from school. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling dried fish at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting fish to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of dried fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs like wheat seeds and pay for land preparation

loans.name: Egna

texts.es:
Egna (35 años) está casada y es madre de 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 ya son mayores y tienen su propia familia mientras que  2 aun son menores y viven con ella y su esposo en su casa propia que pudo comprar con arduo trabajo.Egna tiene lleva ya un año en la actividad de la venta de periódicos, trabaja también en un canal en el sector de servicio pero ese trabajo solo lo hace por tres horas mientras el resto del día se dedica a la venta de periódicos por las calles de la ciudad. Esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo con quien le gusta trabajar ya que se complementan bien y además les agrada pasar tiempo juntos.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que no tiene que depender de nadie para poder ponerse un horario de trabajo ya que la otra actividad solo lo hace en tres horas, lo que no le gusta es que tiene que caminar mucho para poder vender todos los ejemplares que tiene ya que no le gusta volver con diarios en las manos porque lo considera una pérdida. Ella espera poder más adelante empezar a vender frutas y bebidas en su casa esta ubicada en una zona estratégica porque está al frente de un parque el cual es visitado frecuentemente  durante las tardes por muchas personas en busca de bebidas para saciar su sed. Este es el tercer préstamo entre Egna y la institución MFP, Le gusta trabajar con este grupo y se siente cómoda ya que todos son responsables y sobre todo son unidos.Con el préstamo solicitado 1300 soles, espera poder implementar algunos artículos y materiales para empezar con la venta en su casa.
texts.en:
Egna, 35, is married and the mother of four children: two adults that have their own families and two minors still living with her and her husband in her own house that she was able to buy thanks to arduous work.

Egna has been selling newspapers for a year.  She also works as a cleaning lady but that’s only for three hours while the rest of the day she spends selling newspapers throughout the city streets.  She does this activity alongside her husband.  She enjoys working with him because they complement each other well and they enjoy spending time together.

What she likes about her work is that she doesn’t have to depend on anyone to set her work schedule since her other job is only for three hours.  What she doesn’t like so much is having to walk so much to sell all the issues she has because she doesn’t like to return with unsold issues since that represents a loss.  

She hopes later on to start selling fruit and soft-drinks at home which is located in a strategic spot across from a park and during the afternoons it’s quite crowded with people looking for beverages to slack their thirst.

This is the third loan between Egna and MFP.  She likes working with this group and feels comfortable because everyone is responsible and, above all, very united.  She will use the requested 1300 soles to buy a few items and materials to start the home-based sales business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and other items necessary to start a home-based business.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is a 23-year-old married woman from Lebanon living with her husband and one young child. In 2009, she started to work as a tailor from her home. She produces clothes upon the requests of the clients and she also makes repairs on smashed ones. She works hard to provide the family with extra financial support. With her requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she will purchase a new tailoring machine to increase her business productivity and her sales and income. In the future, she is hoping to open her own tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine

loans.name: The Truth Group

texts.en:
Meet members of “The Truth” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 1,400,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Anjay A. is the leader of this group. The 45-year-old is married and has six children. Three of the children are in primary school and three are in secondary school. Anjay sells CDs, VCDs, DVDs and audio cassettes. He has been running this type of business for many years now. With his share of this loan, Anjay will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy CDs, VCDs, DVDs and audio cassettes at wholesale

loans.name: Hayriye

texts.en: Hayriye

loans.use: to pay for opening her canteen and buying necessary materials

loans.name: Darine

texts.en: Darine is a 21-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child. Despite her young age, she has been working for several years as a beautician. Her business is based at her home and she also works as a freelance beauty specialist. She provides her customers with manicure, pedicure and wax services. In parallel, she has newly started to work in a local supermarket. Her income is very important because she helps her husband with the family expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a laser machine in order to satisfy her customer’s demands. In the future, she is planning to open a formal beauty salon to expand her business level.

loans.use: to purchase a laser machine

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen is a 27-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and one sibling. He has 10 years of experience working as a car mechanic. In 2007, this man opened his own car repair shop. Today, he is asking to borrow $1,700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a scanner machine. He has stated that this machine will reinforce his business operation and further develop his work.  He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming year will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to purchase a scanner

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 63-year-old married man living with his wife and one child. He is from Lebanon. He has 10 years of experience working in repairing ovens and heaters. 

Five years ago, this man was able to open his own shop where he started to receive clients asking for his repair services. He is the main income source for his family. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his business tools to better serve his clients and gain superior income. Regardless of his old age, Elias is still an active man with high hopes for the future of his business.

loans.use: to renew his business tools to better serve his clients and gain superior income

loans.name: Rakita

texts.en:
Rakita is 42 years old, married and supports seven people in the family. He has been practicing farming for the past six years.

He has been a good client and he repaid his previous loan well; he is applying for his second loan. He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

In the future, he hopes to see his children achieve prosperity.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Koken

texts.en:
Koken is 51 years old and a married  woman. She has eight children who depend on her. She has been a farmer for six years.

She heard about KADET from other women registered in her area. This is her second loan from KADET LTD, and she wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 28 years old, single and supports his parents. He has been practicing farming for seven years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer and hire temporary field workers

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 37-year-old rice-growing farmer, she is a widow with three children. She has been growing rice for three years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 

She will use the anticipated profit from the business as working capital. Her hopes and dream are to educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 46 years old. He is married and he and his wife have five children. He has been farming  for the past 15 years.

He has applied for his second loan with KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm. He also hopes to invest part of his profit in other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Mlaa

texts.en:
Mlaa is a single mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop, selling household consumables such as maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with six children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop selling to her neighbors and passers-by. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. Leah dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of sugar, beans and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of sugar, beans and maize flour.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 29 years old and married with two children. He is a maize farmer, something he has been doing for the past eight years. He found out about KADET from a registered client. This is his third loan, which he will use to prepare land for farming and buy farm inputs.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to invest in other businesses.

loans.use: to prepare the land for farming and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman with five children; three have graduated from school, while two still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop selling to her neighbors and passers-by. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop and slaughter house in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase goats for slaughter for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for slaughter for resale

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past six years, she has operated a vegetable stall, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan she wants to do irrigation in her vegetable farm and plant more vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To do irrigation in her vegetable farm and plant more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes:D. 52 años ella se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales,nos cuenta que esta contenta porque le ha ido bien en su negocio,y le gusta muchos su negocio porque le gustan los animales,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. animales para crianza como cerdos,ganados.etc el sueño D. ella es agrandar mas su venta y tener una cantidad mas granD. D. animales para la venta y D. la misma manera aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Mercedes:D. 52 años ella se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales,nos cuenta que esta contenta porque le ha ido bien en su negocio,y le gusta muchos su negocio porque le gustan los animales,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. animales para crianza como cerdos,ganados.etc el sueño D. ella es agrandar mas su venta y tener una cantidad mas granD. D. animales para la venta y D. la misma manera aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Compra de Animales Para Crianza.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of selling at wholesale in the future. 

With the 25,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan she wants to establish a charcoal selling stall and purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To establish a charcoal selling stall and purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past year, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan she wants to purchase charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Xavier Judicael

texts.fr:
Client de 31 ans, marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 2 ans et 8 ans. A l’arrêt  de ses études en classe de troisième faute de moyens  et vu sa charge, il se lance dans  la fabrication des balais.
Il achète des tas de manches a balais, des brindilles de palmiers chez ses livreurs,  des boites de conserves vides et des pointes pour faire ses balais  qu’il vend en gros.

Son atelier est situe chez lui a domicile, il a des recettes de 45.000 a 100.000frs par jour.
Vu que sa capacité de production est très faible à l’octroi de son prêt il va acheter des tas de brindilles, 10kg de pointes, des tas de bois et autres accessoires pour fabriquer ses balais
Il a une forte demande, a l’avenir il veut confectionner au moins 100 balais par mois, agrandir sa capacité de production  et aussi réduire ses prix de vente.

Avec les bénéfices, il pourra beaucoup épargner pour financer les études de ses enfants et construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
This client is 31, married and the father of two children aged two and eight years old. At the end of his middle school studies, lacking  means and saddled with responsibilities, he got into making brooms. He buys broom handles and palm straw from his suppliers, empty food tins and tacks to make brooms that he sells wholesale. 

His workshop is in his home and he takes in from 45,000 to 100,000 francs per day. Since his production capacity is low, on receiving his loan he is going to buy bundles of straw, 10 kilos of tacks, wood and other accessories to make his brooms. He has a lot of demand and in future he would like to be able to make at least 100 brooms per month, raise his production capacity and also lower his sales prices. 

With the profit he will be able to save to pay for his children's schooling and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of palm straw, broom handles, and tacks.

loans.name: Myanzi Tukolerewamu Women's Development Group

texts.en:
So the tale goes that every entrepreneur has their own watershed moment. Fifty-five-year-old Kaloli says his moment was 26 years ago when his current business, clothes sales, in Mityana took root. 
From the threshold, he was hard pressed in the fast-track pace of his enterprise. Nothing, especially from a business point of view, can grow by leaps and bounds unless it’s under the auspices of some pillar of support. Kaloli faced considerable odds in obtaining a firm footing for his business. 
What was of overriding importance, notwithstanding the odds, was the fact that his business had indeed taken root. 
Kaloli explored all avenues to find success. He met with checkered success; it has been a long drawn out road for Kaloli. What has made his business secure is the fact that he has been able to restock his boutique when he runs short of clothes.  On the side, Kaloli also ekes out side income from his farming business. He says his clothes sales enterprise generates him weekly sales revenues totaling Uganda shillings 100,000.
He has banked on invaluable winning calling cards, by being assiduous and determined.  
Kaloli says he intends to utilize this Kiva loan to purchase more bales of clothing to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married man with twenty-seven children. Fifteen of his children attend school, and twelve are adults. He owns a house that has neither  electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 30 years, he has operated a charcoal selling business, reared livestock, and also owns residential real estate. His potential customers are charcoal dealers in the area who purchase in wholesale, and sell as retail. He faces the major challenge of seasonality due to disease outbreak in the area. Salim dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 100,000, he wants to start a motorcycle business; purchasing one motorcycle for transport. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To start a motorcycle business and purchase one motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Yunus

texts.en:
Yunus is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. In addition he also operates a motorcycle business, which contributes another source of income. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es: Aura Leticia. de 37 años  tiene 4 hijos, ella se dedica a la elavoracion y venta de  muñecos tipicos,desde hace 2 años ella es la leder de este duo,le da gracias a Dios porque le a hido bien en su negocio y sus ventas han aumentado,por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elavoracion de muñecos tipicos al igual que la siguiente socia tambien se dedica a la elavoracion de muñecos tipicos,y nececita capital para trabajar.
texts.en: Aura Leticia is 37 years old and has 4 children. She has been making and selling traditional dolls for the last 2 years. She is the leader of this group of two and thanks God that her business has done well and her sales have increased. Due to this success, she is asking for a loan in order to buy the raw materials necessary to make traditional dolls, as does her fellow group member. She needs the capital in order to work.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials necessary to make traditional dolls

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with two children. She runs a small business selling wallpaper. Her store is located at the central market and attracts many people every day.

Oksana started this business 10 years ago. Hard work and persistence helped her to develop this business well. Today she has many repeat clients. Oksana's business goals are to start another location and increase turnover.

Oksana would like to borrow 20,000 UAH to increase the assortment of wallpaper. Summer time is a high season for remodeling, so there is a high demand for items like wallpaper. Oksana is hoping to increase her sales and spend additional income for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of wallpaper.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Lourdes; La socia tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es casada y  tiene 2 hijos de 4,6 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la carpintería, ella ayuda a su conyugue en los oficios simples dentro de su taller de carpintería, la socia da los acabados, ve las contratas, las entregas, los pagos y también colabora con los últimos detalles de los diferentes muebles y trabajos pequeños simples por realizarse, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de madera para apoyar en la carpintería y traer más beneficio monetario, la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor en medidas de pies. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de madera.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastián” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.

Lourdes, the member, is 32 years old, married and has two children who are 4 and 6 years of age.  She is in carpentry.  She helps her spouse with simple tasks in his carpentry shop.  She does the finishing touches, sees to contracts, deliveries and payments and also collaborates with final details of the furniture and small jobs to be done to support the carpentry shop and produce more monetary benefits.  She is asking for the loan to buy lumber.

She is grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to pay her installments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Ysaias

texts.es:
Ysaias es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Ysaias desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (tiene 30 ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtiene buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado, con los ingresos que obtenega puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Ysaias es un hombre trabajador y responsable que lo único que quiere es que su hijo se supere y  mejorar económicamente para brindarles estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Ysaias is 29 years old and a husband and father. He lives with his wife and son in his own house, which has electricity only, in the rural district of Tambogrande, Piura. This area is known for its farming, livestock and handicrafts. 

Ysaias has been raising and selling sheep for several years (he has 30 sheep). His corral is located at the back of his house and is both suitable and large enough. He feeds the sheep nutrtionally balanced food and fresh fodder. Once they have reached an optimum weight, he sells them at various local markets. He makes a good profit and uses this to pay for the familiy's daily living expenses.

He has requested a loan of 500 Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy nutritionally balanced food. The income will be sufficient to cover the loan and improve his family's standard of living. Ysaias is a hardworking and responsible man. His only wish is to better his economic situation in order to afford a higher education for his son so that he does better for himself.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced food for his animals

loans.name: Mruri

texts.en:
Mruri is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, he has operated a meat goat sales business, selling at the market to his neighbours. In addition he has also operated a motorcycle business, his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of disease outbreak in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 he wants to purchase more goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Santos Manuel

texts.es:
Santos de 53 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Santos es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y mango, frutas que no necesitan mucho tiempo para ser cosechadas, su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así mejorar económicamente.  Santos es un padre que se preocupa por que su familia mejore y tenga algunas comodidades.
texts.en:
Santos, 53, lives with his family in a house that he owns--a house that just has electricity--in a rural part of Tambogrande, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Piura.  The local people make a living from farming, livestock-rearing and traditional crafts.

Santos is a farmer.  He grows lemons and mangoes, fruits that can be harvested quickly.  He sells what he grows in the markets around Piura and uses what he makes to support his family.  

Santos is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new soles loan that he will use to buy fertilizers for preparing his land for planting.  The better the land, the better the crop and the more he will make when he sells it at market.  Santos wants to make a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Monica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mónica de 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en casa de sus suegros, cuenta con todoslos servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace 2 años Mónica se dedica a la preparación y venta de salchipollo, salchipapas y gaseosas por las noches diariamente, su negocio loa instalado en las afueras de la casa donde vive,cuenta con su carrito sanguchero donde prepara estos alimentos para el consumo de sus clientes, cuenta con su clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para la compra de un refrigerador para que pueda contar también con bebidas heladas, para satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes y con esas ganacias podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Mónica trabaja con mucha dedicación para que poco a poco su familia se supere y logre sus metas.
texts.en:
Monica, 28, lives with her husband and children in her husband's parents' house.  The house has basic services and is located in Tambogrande, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Piura.  The local people make their living from farming, livestock-rearing and traditional crafts.

Monica has operated a catering business for 2 years, selling prepared food and cold drinks.  She works in the evening, every day, at a spot in front of her house.  She has a stand with a grill where she makes the food she sells.  She has many regular customers and the income from the business helps to support her family.

Monica is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 2500 new soles loan that she will use to buy a refrigerator for keeping cold drinks, something that her customers always want.  She will repay the loan from the extra income she expects to make.  She wants her family to have a better quality of life and she works hard to meet her goals.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her catering business.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is a married man with four children; two attend school while two have graduated from school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, he has operated a farming business, planting vegetables and selling them at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of crop pest infections in vegetables. He dreams of irrigating his farm and employing workers in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase seedlings to grow vegetables and purchase a Money Maker (KickStart irrigation pump). He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings to grow vegetables and purchase a money maker (KickStart irrigation pump).

loans.name: Anatoliy

texts.en:
Anatoliy is married with two daughters. He runs a business that specializes in vegetable seeds, light-shade clear film for greenhouses, crop protection supplies and simple farming machinery. Some of the attractions of his business are convenient location, a big assortment of inventory, consistency in working with clients and affordable prices. 

Anatoliy has been in this business for seven years. During this time he was able to open two more locations. Anatoliy is always looking to grow and develop his business and improve his entrepreneurial skills. He is very ambitious, determined and is a leader in his community. 

Anatoliy is requesting a loan of 20,000 hryvnas to  help him purchase machinery - cultivators and tillers -for retail sale. He believes that offering high quality products in combination with the best customer service is a win-win strategy for both his customers and himself as a businessman.

loans.use: to purchase machinery - cultivators and tillers

loans.name: Henrry Martin

texts.es:
Henrry de 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona desarrolla  la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

El servicio que brinda Henrry es el alquiler de equipos de sonido para todo tipo de eventos, además es dueño de una orquesta conocida en la zona, cuenta con su propia clientela, por ser conocido y brindar un buen servicio, sus contratos para alquiler de música han aumentado, por eso a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de más equipos para implementar su negocio y seguir brindando un buen servicio, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá cubrir su crédito y solventar sus gastos familiares.

Henrry es una persona muy responsable, de confianza y trabajadora por eso su negocio a crecido y su anhelo es que más adelante pueda tener un servicio más completo para organizar eventos y seguir ayudando a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Henrry, 40, lives with his wife and children in a house that he owns.  The house has basic services and is located in Olmos, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Lambayeque.  The local people make their living from farming and raising livestock.

Henrry operates an audio equipment rental business.  He supplies equipment for all kinds of events.  He also leads a band that is well-known in the area.  He has a regular set of customers who know they can depend on him to provide a good service and his leasings have increased as a result.  He is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new soles loan that he will use to buy equipment for the business.  The investment will increase his income enough to allow him to both repay the loan and better provide for his family.  

Henrry is a responsible, hard-working man.  In the future, he wants to expand his services by organizing events, something that would provide M. income for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for entertainment business.

loans.name: Lordina Group

texts.en:
Petty trading like the sale of used clothing is widespread in Ghana because it is an easy business to start up. A good number of  Ghanaian low-income earners buy used clothing because it is relatively affordable, making the sale of used clothes a lucrative jobs for many women.  Salina is one of such entrepreneurs. She has been selling used clothes for the past five years. She is excited to be taking out the loan which she plans to invest in purchasing assorted used clothes in bulk to serve her customers. Salina anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market.

Apart from being a vibrant businesswoman, Salina is also married to a commercial driver and she is the mother of three children. She hopes for a bright future for her kids through quality education. Salina is currently the group leader of Lordina Trust Bank Group, which is made up of six members. As the leader of the group, she ensures that all members attend meetings and submit their repayments.

loans.use: to purchase assorted used clothing.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola,ganadera y artesana.

Magaly se dedica desde algunos años a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral y ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo los puede ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y mejorar sus corrales, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más dinero para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Magaly es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
Magaly, 22, lives with her husband and children in a house that she owns.  The house lacks basic services.  It's located in Tambogrande, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Piura.  The local people make their living from farming, raising livestock and making and selling traditional crafts.

Magaly operates a business, raising and selling pigs and poultry.  She raises the animals in a yard behind her house and feeds them a balanced diet, complete with natural grains.  When the animals are ready for market, she sells them and uses the income to support her family.  

Magaly is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new soles loan that she will use to buy feed and pay for improvements to the pens where she keeps the animals.  Once the animals have been fattened for market, she will sell them to local buyers.  She will work to get the best price for the animals so that she can use the income to improve her family's quality of life.  Magaly is a responsible, hard-working woman whose only goal is to see her famiily get ahead in the world.

loans.use: to pay for feed and miscellanous improvements for her poultry and pig business.

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo is a married man with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. He lives in a house that he owns; it neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, he has operated a carving business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. He dreams of establishing a carving school in future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase two bulls to use in farming. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase two bulls to use in farming.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man with seven children, all of whom graduated from school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling retail to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. Stephen dreams of improving his living standards in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente de 20 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola,ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Vicente es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de la zona donde vive  y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales.  También cría y comercializa cabras y cerdos, esto le  permite tener otro ingreso económico.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y de alimento balanceado para sus animales, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.  Vicente es una persona que se preocupa por que su cosecha sea buena para que tenga algunas comodidades y seguir apoyando a sus padres en los gastos diarios.
texts.en:
Vicente, 20, lives with his parents. The house where he lives lacks basic services. It's located in Tambogrande, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Piura. The local people make their living from farming, raising livestock and making and selling traditional crafts.
 
Vicente is a farmer.  He grows maize on land that he owns.  He sells what he grows at various markets in the area and uses the income to support himself.  He also raises and sells goats and pigs, another source of revenue for him.  

Vicente is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new soles loan, partly for buying fertilizer for preparing his land for the next planting and partly for animal feed.  His goal is to improve his quality of life by generating more revenue from his businesses.  Vicente is working hard to make sure his next crop is a good one.  He wants to continue helping his parents with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is from the village of Zeda Simoneti, West Georgia. She is 48 years old, married and lives with her husband Mamuka, their 17-year-old daughter and 15-year-old son. Naira works as a cleaner in local school. Mamuka works in a stone workshop, as a laborer. The children go to school. Along with their jobs Naira and Mamuka head up the family agricultural business – they have two milk cows and one calf. Naira produces cheese and sells approximately 10 kg of cheese each Friday in Kutaisi (nearby town) open market. Also, the family has a vineyard with 700 grape vines. Mamuka produces wine and sells it in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 650 Laris. 

Naira requested a loan to change the roof of the house. It is already old and needs to be changed, because it can’t keep out the rain and snow. Naira will use the materials from the old roof for covering the cattle-shed. 

The credit will help the family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Mercedes Solandi

texts.es:
Mercedes  de 26 años de edad, vive con su familia en casa de sus padres, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Motupe que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace algunos años Mercedes se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, desde hace 3 años, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías con la intensión de surtir su tienda, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga los productos necesarios para ofrecer a sus clientes.  Mercedes es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles más comodidades a sus hijos y otras oportunidades en un futuro.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 26, lives with her family in her parents’ home, which has all of the basic amenities and is located in Motupe district in Lambayeque department. This area is characterized by agriculture and cattle raising.

For several years Mercedes has sold basic supplies (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, etc.) and beverages. For the past three years, she has operated her business from her own home for her convenience and security. She tries, with the profits obtained from store sales, to meet all of her household expenses as well as raise her family’s standard of living.

In order to expand her business she has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which she will use to buy more merchandise to stock her store. Her goal is to see her business grow and to have the necessary items to offer her customers.  

Mercedes is a responsible, dedicated and hardworking person who is dedicated to providing more advantages and future opportunities to her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Goga

texts.en:
Goga is from the village of Siktarva, West Georgia. He is 23 years old and lives with his parents and elder sister Tamar.

All members of the family are involved in the family agricultural business. They have 20 cows and sell approximately 40 kg of cheese per month. Also, the family has one hectare of land, where maize, watermelon, cucumbers and potatoes are grown. Goga takes the harvested products to the nearby villages in his own car and sells them. The total average monthly income of the family is 550 Laris. 

With the requested credit, Goga plans to expand the existing storehouse for proper storing of harvested produce. He will be able to store more produce in the storehouse and sell it later, when the prices of these goods go up. Also, part of the credit will be used for renovation of one part of their house. 

As a result of the storehouse expansion the income of the family will increase. Goga plans to use the increase for purchasing new household goods.

loans.use: to purchase materials for expansion of the storehouse and do some renovation on their house.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Elena; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella vende en forma ambulatoria diferentes tipos de comida como sopas y menus,la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de muebles, ella vende muebles los días sabados y domingos en la feria de Tupac Amaru como sillas,mesas,camas y roperos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de comida y ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras y también para comprar muebles como sillas, mesas, roperos y muebles.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Manos Juntas’ (Hands Together) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

María Elena, 33, has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with a food selling business.  She’s a street vendor of various types of food like soups and daily meals.  She also sells furniture, like chairs, tables, beds and armoires, on Saturday and Sunday at the Tupac Amaru street market.  

She wants to expand the food selling and the furniture selling businesses and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to cook, like meat, chicken and vegetables, and also to buy furniture like tables, chairs, armoires and furniture.

She is happy about the loan and pledges to make all her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her meal preparations and also to buy furniture.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata est une femme mariée de 53 ans qui gère 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 17 et 33 ans. Elle exerce une activité diversifiée de commerce et  s’active dans la vente de pain, de glace et en même temps pratique l’activité de couture chez elle depuis plusieurs années.  C’est son souci de ne pas rester oisive qui l’a poussé à épouser l’activité de commerce. C’est pendant la période de l’année scolaire que la vente de pain et de petit déjeuner marche le plus tandis que pendant la période de chaleur la vente de glace connait une bonne évolution.  Aminata est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2002. Elle  a déjà remboursé 5 prêts antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat en grande quantité des denrées comme le haricot  et autres ingrédients qui lui permettent de préparer ses repas  et  bénéficier de  prix compétitifs. Les bénéfices que lui génèrent  son activité lui permettent de supporter les frais de paiement de loyer et aussi d’assurer quelques dépenses  liées aux besoins familiaux.
-
texts.en:
Aminata is a 53-year-old married woman with five children ranging from 17 to 33 years old. She runs a diversified trade activity selling bread and ice, and has also worked from her home as a seamstress for several years. She started her trade activities for fear of remaining idle. The sale of bread and breakfast items hits its peak during the school year, whereas the hotter days see a rise in the sale of ice. 

Aminata became a member of the U-IMCEC branch in November 2002. She has already obtained and repaid five previous loans with the institution. She is now seeking a loan of 300,000 francs to stock up on food items such as beans and other ingredients necessary to prepare her meals, and take advantage of competitive pricing. The profits earned through her business allow her to pay her rent and various other family expenses.

loans.use: to stock up on food items needed for her business activities

loans.name: Frederic

texts.fr:
Client de 32 ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge, ayant deja beneficie d'un pret au premier cycle, il a rembourse avec succes et a eu a faire des epargnes considerables.
Pour ce second  pret qu'il va beneficier , il veut elargir sa boucherie en achetant des denrees qu'il ne pouvait acheter avant comme , les queue de boeufs,viande arriere, cotes de porcs, poules a bouillir et de la charcuterie.
Tres ambitieux, il veut aller loin dans son activite, ouvrir a la longue une chambre froide et avec les benefices continuer a epargner et prendre soin de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This client is 32, single and responsible for two children. He has already received one loan which he reimbursed successfully. He managed to put aside considerable savings. 

For his second loan, he wants to expand his meat shop by buying meats he was not able to afford earlier on such as ox tails, roasts, pork ribs, stewing hens, and cold cuts.

Very ambitious, he wants to go far in his business, in the long run opening a cold storage room and with his profits continuing to save to care for his children.

loans.use: to buy cartons of chicken thighs, stewing hens, ox tails, and chicken wings.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 52 years old. She lives in the village of Chkhari, West Georgia. Marine is married and lives with her husband Zurab, two adult sons (28 and 25 years old), her daughter-in-law and 4-year-old granddaughter. 

Marine heads up the agricultural activities of the family. They have three cows and sell on average 60 kg of cheese per month on the local open market. Also they have 0.75 hectares of land, where maize and grapes are grown. Harvested maize is used in the farm for feeding the cows; grapes, harvested from 1000 grape vines are sold locally. Marine’s sons assist her in the farm. Zurab has a truck and provides transportation services to the local population and businesses. He earns approximately 500 Laris per month. Total average monthly income of the family is 1300 Laris. 

With the requested credit Marine’s family will purchase a mini-bus. It will be equipped with liquid gas tanks and used as mobile gas station – filling the empty gas tanks of the villagers in the district. The new business initiative will be led by Marine’s sons. It will significantly increase the income of the family. Increased income will allow them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus for their business selling liquid gas from tanks.

loans.name: Duo Monte Hermon Group

texts.es:
DUO MONTE HERMON
Este grupo esta formado por doña Blanca , quien es casada, tiene 6 hijos,es la lider del grupo y  nos cuenta que es dueña de un Molino y tienda que esta ubicada en el caserío los C., desde hace mas de 30 años, esta muy contenta porque solicita este crédito y esta confiada en que fape ha si como la vez anterior le tendió la mano en esta ocasión no la va a dejar sola,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles, también esta don Carlos Humberto de 35 años de edad, casado y tiene 5 hijos, nos cuenta que tiene una tiendecita ubicada en el caserío los C., desde hace mas de 2 años, y solicita este crédito porque necesita que ayuden a surtir su tienda, para poder obtener mas ganancias necesita comprar,productos comestibles.para surtir su tienda
texts.en:
DUO MONTE HERMON
This group consists of Blanca and Carlos Humberto.  Blanca, who is married and has 6 children, is the leader of the group.  She tells us that for more than 30 years she has been the owner of a mill and store located in the Los C. neighborhood.  She is very happy because she is requesting this loan, and she is confident that FAPE, just as it gave her a hand previously, is not going to let her down this time.  She is requesting this loan to buy food products.  

Carlos Humberto, 35, is married and has 5 children.  He tells us that he has had a little store in the Los C. neighborhood for more than 2 years.  He is requesting this loan because he needs help stocking his store.  To be able to get more earnings he needs to buy food products to stock his store.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Ghislain

texts.fr:
Client de 35 ans, marie et père de 3 enfants dont l’age varie entre 5 et 12 ans,ayant debuté avec la vente des filets d’oignons en 2005, ce client est a son troisieme cycle de prêt aupres de Hope Congo, il a rembourse sans difficultes et a fait des epargnes considerables .
Il s’approvisionne a Kinshasa  deux fois par semaine ,il va renforcer son stock en achetant des filets d’oignons  qu’i vend en gros et detail.
Ses ventes sont de 30000 a 60000 frs par jour,ces clients sont les vendeuses du marché, les restaurateurs et les menageres.
Avec ce nouveau prêt il va renforcer son stock en achetant 15 filets de 25 kg d’oignons et chaque semaine , il traversera pour Kinshasa pour faire ses provisions .
Tres ambitieux, il a l’intention de devenir un grossiste des produits vivriers comme le mais, l’oignon, l’arachide,et avec ses benefices il est entrain d’economiser pour acheter un camion qui lui permettra de voyager de village en village pour faire ses provisions.
texts.en:
This client is 35 years old, married and the father of three children who vary in age from five to 12 years old. Having begun to sell nets of onions in 2005, The client is on his third loan with Hope Congo. He reimbursed the first two without difficulty and has put aside considerable savings. 

He buys his goods in Kinshasa two times a week. He wants to expand his stock by buying net bags of onions that he sells wholesale and retail. His sales amount to between 30,000 and 60,000 francs a day. His customers are market vendors, restaurant owners, and housewives. 

With this new loan, he is going to expand his stock by buying 15 net sacks of 25 kilos of onions, and each week, he will go over to Kinshasa to stock up. 

Very ambitious, he intends to be a wholesaler of foodstuffs such as maize, onions, peanuts. With his profit, he is saving to buy a truck which will permit him to travel from village to village to buy his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy 15 net sacks of  onions.

loans.name: Andrey

texts.ru:
Андрей имеет свой бизнес – торгует бытовой и компьютерной техникой. Занимается он этим уже 7 лет. Вначале ремонтировал технику, а затем по совету друзей занялся продажей. Андрей хорошо знает свой товар и имеет постоянных клиентов. Это положительно сказывается на его бизнесе.

Андрей просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 20,000 гривен на приобретение товара. В данном регионе лето – время сезонных заработков, поэтому люди могут позволить себе приобретать необходимую бытовую и компьютерную технику.
Данный бизнес – единственный источник дохода Андрея, поэтому он планирует развивать его дальше, увеличивая оборот и помогая большему количеству людей приобрести технику.
texts.en:
Andrey has his own business – he sells household and computer appliances. He has been in this business for seven years. In the beginning he was repairing the equipment and then later took advice of his friends and started selling it. Andrey knows his products very well and has regular customers. This has a positive effect on the business.

Andrey is asking to provide him with a loan in the amount of 20,000 hrivnas to purchase necessary household and computer appliances. This business is the only source of income for Andrey and this is why he plans to grow it further by increasing sales and helping a large number of people to purchase appliances.

loans.use: to increase the variety of applicances

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school and one who is still too young. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past year, Mary has operated a business trading cows at the market to cow brokers. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. Mary decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mary is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to purchase four cows. In the future, she dreams of establishing a butcher shop.

loans.use: to purchase four cows

loans.name: German

texts.es: El señor German es chofer; tiene su camioneta propia y trabaja en transporte pesado (transporte de carga) en el sindicato Usimacon en la parada de Rio Seco.
