Her sales improved during the month of July as a result of promotion ceremonies, communions, and baptisms.

Patricia is a hardworking woman who does other things besides sell jewelry. She also does very well selling meals near a school. The children and teachers buy from her when they want something to eat.

She is requesting a loan to buy jewelry to sell so that she can obtain good earnings. One of her dreams is to see her children finish their studies, find a good job, and establish their own large businesses that they manage themselves. Patricia thanks Fundación Realidad for the support it has provided so that she can move forward and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for her business.

loans.name: Tabara

texts.fr: Madame Tabara  est une commerçante  de 32 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Elle exerce la vente d’huile de palme et de poissons séchés. C’est une activité très favorable  à toutes les périodes de l’année. C’est une dame qui a choisi son activité par nécessité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2 ans. Elle emprunte un montant de 200 000 frs prévu pour le financement de son voyage vers la sous région, un marché hebdomadaire  où  les commerçants  s’approvisionnent en produits locaux. Ce financement lui permettra de renforcer son stock, d’augmenter ses bénéfices et de subvenir a ses  besoins quotidiens et a soutenir ses parents dans leurs charges familiales.
texts.en:
Madame Tabara is a small-scale retailer of 32 who lives in Sénégal. She sells palm oil and dried fish. This is a business that does very well throughout the year. This is a lady who chose her business out of necessity. She has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches for two years. 

She is borrowing 200,000 francs with the intention of financing her trip upcountry to a weekly market where retailers stock up on local products. This loan will allow her to expand her stock, increase her profit, and support herself from day to day and help her parents to cover their family expenses.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Luciana  Flora

texts.es:
La  señora  Luciana   tiene  veinticuatro años de edad , se dedica  a la  elaboración  de antojitos mexicanos  desde  hace dos años atrás.
Es una señora muy trabajadora  a parte de vender antojitos mexicanos también   se dedica a la calzado  venta de calzado ya que  obtiene  muy buenas ganancias .
Tiene la cantidad de  dos hijas  las cuales son gemelas , cada semana  va realizar sus pagos  a la microfinanciera , le gusta mucho trabajo  ya que a sus  clientes le gusta  como los atiende y la mercancía que les ofrece.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar mas ingredientes,   para la elaboración de antojitos mexicanos.
Uno de sus sueños  es  tener un restaurante  donde pueda hacer diferentes platillos para sorprender a sus clientes. 
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños y por ser parte de ellos .
texts.en:
Sra. Luciana is 24 years old and has been making Mexican street food for two years. She is a very hardworking woman and sells Mexican street food part-time. In addition, she sells shoes in order to obtain a very good income. Luciana has twin daughters. Each week she submits her payments to the microfinance institute. She enjoys working with her customers and serving them the food that they enjoy.

Luciana is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients for preparing Mexican street food. One of her dreams is to have a restaurant where she can offer different dishes to surprise her customers. She expresses her thanks to Fundación Realidad for the support that has been given to her so that she can move forward and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing street food.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora  Margarita se dedica a la venta de  abarrotes desde hace cinco años  es una señora muy trabajadora, también se dedica a la  venta  de comida  ya que le deja  muy buenas ganancias.
Tiene  cuarenta y dos  años de edad  es una persona muy reconocida   ya que  atiende muy bien a  sus clientes.
La señora Margarita  tiene la cantidad  de  dos hijos  Fernando de  diez años de edad y  Gustavo de  veinte  dos años de edad.
Esta muy contenta  por que sus sueños  se están haciendo realidad  gracias a su esfuerzo y  trabajo.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  para  la compra de mas mercancía para que cuando sus clientes vayan a comprar vean que  su tienda esta bien surtida.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que le ha dado para  salir adelante  y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking woman who has been selling groceries for the past five years. She also sells prepared foods, especially because she is able to earn good profits. She is forty-two years old and she is a very well-known person, given that she attends her clients so well.

Margarita has two children: Fernando is ten years old, and Gustavo is twenty-two years old. 

She is very happy because she is attaining her dreams, thanks to her efforts and handwork. She requested a loan to purchase more merchandise so that when her clients come to shop they will find the store well-stocked.

She is thankful to Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for the support given to her to move forward and to attain her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase grocery store merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr: Oumy est une jeune femme de 32 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le commerce et  la vente de crème, de glace, de savons et d’autres produits divers. Elle a choisi son  activité par nécessité car elle veut se procurer des revenus  de revenus qui lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins sociaux car c’est elle meme qui doit se prendre en charge. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 3 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour renforcer son fond de roulement et développer son activité. Le financement lui permettra d’acheter du savon et des produits qui sont utilisés pour faire les crèmes qu’elle commercialise. Oumy est une femme mariée et veut soutenir son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales.
texts.en:
Oumy, 32, lives in Sénégal. She sells cremes, ice, soap, and various other products. She chose her business by necessity since she wants to make income which will allow her to support herself, since she has to be responsible for her own livelihood. She has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's branch offices for three years. 

She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs that she will use to grow her working capital and develop her business. The loan will allow her to buy soap and products that are used to make the cremes she sells. Oumy is a married woman and wants to help her husband manage the family expenditures.

loans.use: to buy soap and various other products for resale.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es: Mabel de 42 años vive con su hijo de 12 años en el municipio de Soledad donde se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir en todas las líneas. Su principal mercado son los grandes confeccionistas a quienes les ofrece el servicio de maquila, mujeres a quienes les confecciona sobre sus medidas y almacenes y misceláneas. Mabel inició su negocio desde el año 2005, cuando después de haber trabajado en una confección, se retiró para emprender su propia aventura de negocios en un taller de confecciones, que ubicó en el sitio de su vivienda. Ella compró mediante 2 créditos las maquinarias de segunda mano, que pagó fabricando jeans, a quien se las vendió. Su negocio ha ido creciendo en su infraestructura y hoy tiene 7 máquinas, cuenta con 3 empleados y en temporadas en las que aumentan las ventas contrata dos más. Su sueño es independizar su espacio familiar del espacio productivo, para tener el tan anhelado sosiego, por eso su meta más adelante es tener un local con un punto comercial, donde pueda exhibir y vender los diseños que produce. Su mayor desafío es la selección de clientes que solicitan créditos a largo plazo y ella no tiene las condiciones de capital para financiar totalmente su cartera. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos de confección, para producir ropa a clientes que requieren plazos mayores, pues viven las ciudades de Barranquilla y Montería y necesita sostener este mercado, conocido y muy rentable. Mientras Mabel trabaja para cumplir su sueño se esmera en manejar su negocio sosteniendo un margen de contribución no menor del 27% y una rentabilidad no inferior al 19%, que aspira a incrementar con su nueva inyección de capital de trabajo, porque sus compras la hará de contado y en mayor volumen que el  ya acostumbrado
texts.en: Mabel is 42 years old and she lives with her 12-year old son in the municipality of Soledad. She crafts all styles of clothing. Her primary market is the large wholesalers, offering them manufacturing services. A group of women who produce according to specifications and the products are destined for clothing, and general stores. Mabel started out her business in 2005 after having retired from her employment as a seamstress. She decided to take up her own business venture with a tailoring shop, set up in her house. With the help of 2 loans she bought second-hand sewing machines. She repaid the loans by producing jeans for those who sold her the machines. Her business has been increasing in infrastructure and today she has 7 sewing machines and 3 employees. During those seasons when there is an increase in sales she hires two other employees. Her dream is to separate her family living space from her business and production space in order to enjoy the peace she has wanted for so long. For this reason her long-term goal is to have a commercial store space where she will be able to exhibit and sell her designs. Her greatest challenge is approving clients who request long-term credit plans, as well as not having the capital funds hat she needs to complete finance her business. This is the reason why she requests a Kiva loan. It is the first loan she requests through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With her loan she will purchase materials and sewing products to produce articles of clothing for clients who require longer term credit plans. Her clients live in the city of Barranquilla and Monteria and she needs to sustain this market, as it is already well-known to her and it is very profitable. As Mabel works to accomplish her dreams she strives to maintain a contribution margin of no less than 27% and a profit margin no less than 19%. She aspires to increase her profit margin with this new injection of funds to her working capital. She will be able to make her purchases in cash and in larger quantities than usual.

loans.use: to purchase products and sewing materials to craft articles of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase health products, including biotherapies, and natural and aromatherapy treatments for hair, body, and feet.

loans.name: Elicia Esther

texts.es: Elicia  es una mujer brillante, que siempre permanece trabajando en todo lo que sabe hacer:  elL. es confeccionista, y ofrece servicio D. reparación y costura D. ropa, es  manicurista y ofrece este servicio a domicilio o en su casa, y es una gran comerciante a L. vez pues tiene un mercado a quienes venD. mercancías como ropa, accesorios femeninos masculinos, perfumes, cosméticos, mediante crédito y planeado en cuotas pactadas con sus clientes. Elicia en condición D. mujer jefe D. hogar y con dos hijos en las edades D. 1 y 19 años, se las ha arreglado para tomar las riendas D. su hogar y genera ingresos y oportunidades D. estudios para su hija que ya está en L. universidad y estudia una carrera. DesD. hace 8 años está ejerciendo sus actividades desD. que se capacitó en una corporación para desempeñarse mejor. Hoy tiene un gran sueño y es el D. tener un salón D. belleza en un centro comercial concurrido, con toda L. infraestructura para que sus clientes se sientan confortables. Su capital D. trabajo no es suficiente para lograr sus metas y ahora inicia su camino a través D. su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará telas, hilos, botones, e insumos para su negocio D. donD. ofrece servicios para embellecer a sus clientes, como, esmaltes, tintes, lijas y aliseres. Mientras Elicia trabaja para alcanzar su sueño, adquiere con su negocio un margen D. utilidad D. 38%, que le permite seguir creciendo y reinvirtiendo parte D. este en su negocio y con el ha logrado hacer mejoras a su vivienda. Su Mayor desafío es lograr el máximo bienestar para sus hijos, porque ellos son justamente el motor que L. impulsa diariamente a continuar en L. búsqueda del éxito.
texts.en: Elicia is a brilliant woman who has always worked in her field of expertise. She is a seamstress and she offers repair and tailoring services. She is also a manicurist, offering her services in her clients' homes or in her house. She is a great business person who also has a store from where she sells merchandise such as clothing, accessories for men and women, perfumes, and cosmetics. She completes her sales on credit, detailing payment schedules with her clients. Elicia is the woman leader of the household. She has two children, 1 and 19 years old and she has always managed to take the reins of the household, earning an income and providing her daughter with educational opportunities. She is already in university and she is studying a career. For the past 8 years she has been carrying out her activities, ever since was trained by a corporation to improve her work. She has a great dream to have a beauty shop in a well-traveled shopping center, equipped with the entire infrastructure necessary to make her clients feel more comfortable. Her working capital is not enough to achieve her goals but now she has taken the first step by requesting a Kiva loan. It is the first loan she accesses through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and she will purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, and products she needs to offer beauty services to her clients, including nail polish, hair dye, nail files, and irons. As Elicia works to achieve her dream she acquires a profit margin of 38%. It permits her to keep expanding and reinvesting into her business, and she has also been able to carry out some home improvements. Her greatest challenge is to proviD. her children with the best possible well-being. They are precisely the motor that drives her each day to continue her daily quest for success.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, and other products she needs for her business.

loans.name: Luis Anibal

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 52 años casado y actualmente vive con su esposa y 5 hijos. El reside en la parroquia  “Pastocalle” de la provincia de "Latacunga" que se encuentra en la sierra norte del Ecuador a 2850 metros a nivel del mar. Luis vive en este lugar desde hace 40 años junto a su familia, su esposa María de 51 años quien es comerciante desde hace 32 años.

El ha estudiado únicamente la primaria pero esto no ha sido un impedimento para que Luis se convierta en un microempresario ya que  desde hace 20 años el aprendió de un primo a fabricar escobas. El trabaja de 8 a 9 horas al día en esta actividad y desea poder invertir en materia prima  para incrementar su negocio y así tener mayores ingresos. Acudió a Fundación Alternativa por un crédito para poder financiar su inversión, el es un cliente nuevo. Con esto él espera poder vender a más personas su producto.

El espera aumentar el precio del producto y así poder enfrentar a sus competidores.
texts.en:
Luis is a 52 year old man who is married and who lives with his wife and their 5 children. He lives in the Parish of "Pastocalle" in the province of "Latacunga". It is located in the northern mountain range of Ecuador, at 2850 meters above sea level. Luis has been living here for 40 years together with his family. His wife Maria, 51 years old, has been a merchant for 32 years.

He only has a primary school education but this has not been an impediment for Luis. He became a small business owner 20 years ago when he learned how to make brooms from a cousin. He works 8 or 9 hours every day in his business and he wants to be able to invest in materials to increase his business and to earn more income. He approached Fundacion Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan to be able to finance his investment. He is a new client. He will be able to sell his products to more people.

He hopes to increase the price of his products in order to face his competition.

loans.use: to purchase materials required to make brooms.

loans.name: Esperanza Divina 4 Group

texts.en:
Dorka is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza Divina 3 & 4 (Divine Hope).  Her group is located in the rural, agricultural area surrounding Hato Mayor.   She lives in a simple structure with her three-year-old child. Dorka says that building her house is her biggest challenge.  However, in the meantime, she enjoys to work.

Dorka is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Kiva partner Esperanza after successfully repaying the previous loans and growing her business. She has had her business for over two years, which she started with some of her own savings and a business plan. She joined Esperanza because she was looking for development and with these loans she has found a way to expand her business.  She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying blouses, skirt, pants, shirts, and shoes. She will invest the profits in her business and save some of the profits to start building her house in the near future. She has been able to save to see her dream come to fruition.

Since her first loan, she has been able to grow as a person. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes, such as blouses, skirt, pants, shirts, and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Donnys

texts.es: Donnys de 49 años, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 3 a 7 años en el municipio de Soledad, donde se dedica a la producción de alimentos, negocio con el cual genera los principales ingresos a su hogar. Donnys antes de iniciar su negocio trabajaba en las minas de carbón, pero su compañero falleció y lo impactó tanto esta situación, que abandonó el riesgoso oficio que desempeñaba. Así fue como inició  su negocio de vender peto (bebida a base de maíz pilado, canela y leche), patacones y chorizos. Con su negocio ha tenido un cambio favorable pues ha construido una clientela y se ha acreditado en el sitio en el cual se encuentra ubicado. Su mayor desafío es su capital de trabajo que se torna insuficiente para lograr aumentar su mercado, sus ventas son de contado y manja pocos inventarios, porque compra diariamente en los graneros del barrio y esto no le permite acceder a buenos descuentos, por volumen. Su crédito es el primer financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará   materias primas para la preparación de sus productos, como maíz pilado, canela, leche, plátanos, aceite y chorizo para aumentar sus ventas y también comprar sillas y mesas para lograr un más confortable ambiente para sus clientes. Su sueño es adecuar su vivienda con mejores condiciones habitacionales, para todos los días continuar contribuyendo a un mejor estar de sus hijos y su cónyuge.
texts.en: Donnys is 49 years old. He lives with his partner and their three children who are from 3 to 7 years old in the town of Soledad, where he is dedicated to the production of food, a business with which he generates the main income for his home. Donnys, before he began his business, worked in the coal mines but his friend was killed and this situation impacted him so much that he abandoned the risky job that he performed. This is how he started his business selling peto (a drink based on cracked corn, cinnamon and milk), plaintains and chorizo. With his business, he has had a favorable change since he's built a customer base and has proven himself in the spot where he is located. His greatest disadvantage is his working capital which becomes insufficient to expand his market. His sales are cash sales and he manages little inventory because he buys from the neighborhood graneries on a daily basis and this does not allow him to give good discounts, by volume. His loan is the first loan that he's made with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With it, he will buy raw materials for the preparation of his products, such as cracked corn, cinnamon, milk, bananas, oil and chorizo to expand his sales and also buy chairs and table to achieve a more comfortable atmosphere for his customers. His dream is to adapt his home with better living conditions so every day he can continue contributing to the wellbeing of his children and partner.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the preparation of his products, such as cracked corn, cinnamon, milk, bananas, oil and chorizo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase glasses, glasses cases, and cellphone accessories in larger volumes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater volume of ingredients such as sugar, powdered milk and a table with a metallic coating.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make artisanal crafts and snacks.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es: Maria Soledad, D. 44 años es una mujer casada que vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades D. 12 a 17 años en el barrio Altos D. Riomar al norte D. la ciudad. Allí tiene un  taller D. artesanías, donD. elabora con sus propias manos, bolsos , correas, zapatos, collares, pulseras, y también decora blusas y ropas en general. En su profesión D. administradora,  D. empresas, trabajó durante 12 años en el sistema financiero, y posteriormente cuando dejó D. hacerlo se dedicó a lo que mas le gusta y con ello ha perfeccionado su arte y aplicado su potencial financiero a su propio negocio. Con sus manualidades ha participado en ferias nacionales e internacionales y en la actualidad exporta a los Estados Unidos y a Puerto Rico. Su sueño es ampliar las exportaciones y continuar fortaleciendo su marca “Marisol Fashion” para lograr el posicionamiento en estos mercados. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas para fabricar sus artesanías como palma D. iraca, telas, cuero, pedrería y demás accesorios, para ampliarse en su mercado local potencial e iniciar la fabricación D. sus productos D. mayor rotación solicitado por sus clientes. Mientras María Soledad cumple su sueño D. lograr al lado D. su esposo, generar ingresos suficientes, para que sus 3 hijos se fundamenten a nivel educativo con un potencial D. éxito, continua esmerándose en su negocio por sostener un margen D. utilidad no menor del 45 % y una rotación e inventarios D. 45 días.
texts.en: Maria Soledad is 44 years old and she is a married woman. She lives with her husband and their 3 children, aged between 12 and 17 years old. They live in the district of Altos D. Riomar, in the city's north end. She has a craft shop there where she makes hand-maD. purses, bands, shoes, necklaces, bracelets, and she also decorates blouses and clothing in general. She was employed for 12 years as a professional business administrator, specializing in the financial sector. When she left her employment she decided to do what she loves most and since then she has perfected her art form and she has applied her financial knowledge to her own business. She has participated in national and international fairs with her crafts and today she exports to the United States and to Puerto Rico. Her dream is to expand her export business and to continue strengthening her brand name "Marisol Fashion" to secure a niche in these markets. Her Kiva loan is the first loan that she accesses through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With her loan she will purchase products she requires to make her crafts such as straw, fabrics, leather, stone beads, and other craft accessories. Her goal is to expand to reach the local market potential and to start producing those crafts which sell the best to her clients. Maria Soledad wants to accomplish her dream of attaining success comparable to her husband's and to earn sufficient income so that her children can attain their level of schooling successfully. She continues to work on her business to maintain a profit margin of 45% and an inventory rotation of 45 days.

loans.use: to purchase products she requires for her crafts, such as straw, fabrics, leather, stone beads, and other crafting accessories.

loans.name: "ni Un Paso Atrás" Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Ni un paso atrás" está conformado por 4 mujeres luchadoras quienes residen en el cantón Santo Domingo, el cual es uno de los de mayor densidad poblacional del Ecuador y cuyo clima es cálido y húmedo ya que pertenece a la región costa del país. 

Fátima es la presidenta de este grupo, ella es madre de 4 hijos y su esposo Carlos quien es albañil. Ella en su tiempo libre comparte con sus hijos quienes tienen 7, 13, 15 y 17 años. Uno de los mayores obstáculos en su vida ha sido el rompimiento que tuvo con su primera pareja.

Ella se dedica a vender ropa de puerta en puerta, oficio que aprendió de sus amistades. No cuenta con un local propio y trabaja 9 horas al día, en ocasiones es ayudada por su esposo. Ella quiere invertir en mercadería para vender y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos y así poder seguir dándoles educación a sus hijos y anhela tener una casa bien arreglada.

Neris es una mujer soltera que también vende ropa como Fátima, ella nos cuenta que tiene una buena clientela por lo que mantiene pocas cuentas por cobrar. Ella tiene dos pedidos de ropa por lo que necesita el capital para poder comprarla y así poder seguir con el negocio que es su único sustento.

Ofelia es una mujer soltera, tiene un negocio de venta de comida cerca de una parada de buses. Ella desea poder arreglar su local comprando enceres que le permitan que el local se vea mejor y las ventas puedan aumentar. De esta manera ella puede tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.

Adelaida es una mujer soltera, tiene dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de jugos y batidos, actividad que le permite mantener a sus hijos. Ella desea invertir comprando dos licuadoras y aumentar su stock de snacks para así ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a su clientela. Aunque su negocio es pequeño ella cree que sus ventas podrán aumentar luego de la inversión.
texts.en:
The “Ni Un Paso Atrás” (Not Even One Step Backwards) Communal Bank is comprised of four tenacious women who live in the Santo Domingo Canton.  This is one of the most heavily populated cantons in Ecuador.  Its climate is warm and humid because it is in the coastal region of the country.

Fátima is the president of this group.  She has four children.  Her husband, Carlos, is a bricklayer.  She spends her free time with her children; ages 7, 13, 15, and 17.  One of the greatest obstacles in her life has been the breakup with her first life partner.

She sells clothes door to door.  She learned this occupation from her friends.  She does not have her own place.  She works nine hours a day, and sometimes her husband helps her.  She wants to invest in merchandise to sell.  This way she will have greater income, and she will be able to continue giving her children an education.  She is also eager to have a well-furnished house. 

Neris is a single woman who also sells clothes like Fátima.  She tells us that she has good customers, and she therefore has few outstanding accounts.  She has two clothing orders, and she needs the money to be able to make those purchases.  That way she will be able to continue in the business, which is her only support.

Ofelia is a single woman, and she has a business selling food close to a bus stop.  She wishes to be able to fix up her place by purchasing items that will make her local look better and to be able to increase sales.  This way she will be able to have improved income and a better quality of life.

Adelaida is a single woman with two children.  She sells juices and shakes.  She wishes to buy two blenders and increase her stock of snacks.  This way she will offer her customers a greater variety of products.  Even though her business is small, she believes that her sales will be able to increase after this investment.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Digna Esmerita

texts.es:
Digna  es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un pequeño negocio en L. parte delantera D. su casa. Comenzó hace 10 años con su negocio  para mejorar L. economía D. su familia. Poco a poco fue incrementando su pequeña tienda. 

En L. actualidad tiene una pequeña tienda donD. venD. víveres D. primera necesidad como arroz, granos, enlatados, bebidas, lácteos etc.  Poco a poco a incrementado su mercadería por eso también venD. cosméticos a sus vecinos o amigos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando por lo que con el préstamo desea comprar bebidas, lácteos, arroz, dulces etc. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local granD. para cubrir las necesidades D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Digna is a hard-working woman who has a small business in the front part of her house.  She started her business ten years ago in order to improve her family’s finances.  Little by little she was expanding her small store.

She now has a small store where she sells basic needs foods like rice, grains, canned goods, drinks, and dairy products, etc.  Little by little she has increased her merchandise, so she also sells cosmetics to her neighbors or friends.  

She has a lot of aspirations for her business.  Therefore, she wants to continue working.  She wants to use the loan to buy drinks, dairy products, rice, and sweets, etc.

In the future she wants to have a big place in order to meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, rice, and sweets.

loans.name: Albeiro De Jesus

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad Albeiro es un luchador quien toda su vida ha vivido en el campo y allí se ha desempeñado como agricultor, en su vereda cultiva productos como plátano, yuca, café fríjol y adicional a esto tiene un galpón y cría de peces, se levanta día a día con la motivación de salir adelante y poderle brindar a su familia un mejor futuro. Albeiro es padre de 5 hijos a quienes pretende dejarle su negocio como un legado que pase de generación en generación pues es conciente que ser microempresario es de gran ayuda para llegar a tener una estabilidad económica, y más si este negocio le permite estar pendiente de su familia.

Actualmente Albeiro presenta dificultades con la máquina para moler el café ya que presenta fallas técnicas y él no cuenta con el capital para repararla, por lo que hoy solicita un crédito con el cual hacer los arreglos necesarios antes de que comience la cosecha de café y así poder agilizar todo el proceso que requiere la producción de café. Albeiro sueña con ver crecer la producción, generar mas ganancias y poderle brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
At 63 years of age, Albeiro is a fighter who has lived all his live in the country where he has worked as an agriculturalist. In his district, he cultivates products such as banana, yucca, coffee, beans and in addition to this he has a large shed where he raises fish. He gets up every day motivated to get ahead and provide his family a better future. Albeiro is the father of 5 children to whom he intends to leave his business as an inheritance that will pass down from one generation to another. He is aware that being a small business person is a great help in developing economic stability and even more if the business permits him to keep an eye on his family.  

At present, Albeiro is having problems with his coffee mill since it exhibits technical failures and he does not have the capital to repair it. Consequently today he is requesting a loan which he will use to make necessary repairs before the coffee harvest and thus he will be able to streamline the entire process required in coffee production. Albeiro’s dream is to see his production grow, to generate more profits and to be able to provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his coffee mill.

loans.name: Elsa Elena

texts.es:
Para Elena de 38 años de edad fué una Bendicíon de Dios quedarse con el negocio que le dejó su padre, por ello el nombre del mismo "Bendición de Dios", como no tenía ahorros empezó con poco capital. 

Su trabajo lo empieza desde las 8h00am a 20h00pm sola ya que considera que sus hijos ( 2 y 11 años) tiene que estudiar y están pequeños aun.

Ser madre soltera y vivir en una zona periurbana le dificulta comprar los productos para abastecer su tienda, su casa es mixta y por ello desea un préstamo para terminarla de cemento totalmente y compar arroz, azucar, frejoles, aceite y obtener mas ganancias ahorrar y tener una vida digna junto a su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
To Elena, age 38, it was a blessing from God to stay in the business her father left her.  That is why the name of the business is “Bendición de Dios” (God's Blessing).  As she did not have savings, she started with little capital.

She only works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 pm. considering that her children (ages 2 and 11) have to study, and they are still little.

Being a single mother and living in a peri-urban zone makes it difficult for her to buy products to stock her store.  

Her house is made of mixed materials.  Therefore, she wants the loan to finish it completely with cement.  She will also buy rice, sugar, beans, and oil in order to get more earnings, to save, and to have a decent life together with her small family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, and juice.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Renacer es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está integrado por amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Está integrado por 13 miembros, todas ellas trabajan de forma solidaria y dentro de un ambiente de respeto y cooperación.
Todas ellas se definen como mujeres jefas de familia que día a día luchan para conseguir el progreso de cada una, no solo en el ámbito económico, sino también personal.
Una de las integrantes, Fabiana tiene 31 años, esta casada con el Señor Reinaldo que es un funcionario de la municipalidad, tienen 3 hijos todos viven bajo el mismo techo. Fabiana se dedica a la venta de especias(Remedios medicinales) y con los ingresos que ella tiene ayuda a su marido en los gastos de su hogar. Ella está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que su trabajo es digno y muy honesto.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de más hierbas medicinales, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
The group called Renacer is from the city of Encarnación. It is made up of friends and neighbors in that city.  It is composed of 13 members, all of whom work together in an atmosphere of respect and mutual cooperation. All define themselves as women who are
heads of their families and who fight day by day to help one another progress, not only economically but also personally.

One of the members, Fabiana, is 31 years old and is married to Señor Reinaldo, who is a municipal official.  They have 3 children and all live under the same roof. Fabiana sells herbs (medicinal remedies) and uses her income to help her husband with household expenses. She is very proud of what she does since her work is worthwhile and honest.

She requests the loan to buy more medicinal herbs so that she can meet the demands of her customers. She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity it is is providing her.

loans.use: to buy medicinal herbs for later sale.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos de 33 años de edad pensó en tener un negocio propio, analizó la situación de su barrio y se dió cuenta que no habían tiendas por el sector, y es ahí donde decidió administrar su propia negocio de abarrotes y papeleria. 

Es soltero por eso quien lo ayuda en la atención del mismo es su madre, la dificultad para conseguir los viveres y papeleria es la inseguridad que tiene el sector. Ahora está aplicando para un préstamo el cual espera le sirva para la comprar de viveres, papeleria y para la construccion de su propia casa y asi darle una mejor vida a su mama.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 33 years old.  He thought about having his own business, analyzed his neighborhood’s situation and realized that there were no stores in the area.  So, he decided to run his own grocery store.

He is single, which is why his mother helps him tend to the store.  The area’s lack of security makes it difficult to obtain the supplies.  He is now requesting a loan which he hopes will help him to increase his earnings, save, and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy rice, cold cuts, canned goods and soda.

loans.name: Cecilia Holanda

texts.es:
Cecilia inició su negocio hace 11 años, arrancó con algo muy pequeño por lo que solo vendía utiles escolares.Poco a poco fué creciendo y fué adquiriendo  cosas de bazar, con lo que le ha ido mejor ha aumentado sus ingresos. 

Pero como todo encarece no le alcanza para mantener a sus tres hijos los cuales tienen 21,11 y 2 años respectivamente.

Como es madre soltera le  ha costado salir adelante pero no se da por vencida ya que como dice ella sus hijos son su razón y su fuerza de seguir luchando. Para surtir su negocio está decidida a hacer un préstamo, el cual lo utilizará para comprar perfumes, cuadernos, lapices, ropa de AVON, YANBAL que son las marcas que ella vende.
texts.en:
Cecilia’s business started small 11 years ago, as she only sold school supplies. Little by little, her business grew and she obtained stationery supplies which sold better and have increased her earnings.

However, as everything has become more expensive, it is not enough to support her three children who are 21, 11 and 2 years old.

Since she is a single mother, it has been difficult for her to get ahead but she has not given up. She says that her children are her motivation and strength to continue pushing forward. She decided to take out a loan in order to stock her business and buy perfumes, notebooks, pencils and clothing from Avon and Yanbal, the brands she sells.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, notebooks, pencils, clothing and costume jewelry.

loans.name: El Carrizo Group

texts.en: The El Carrizo Solidarity Group is made up of Ana, Vilma, Kenia, and Yessica, all of whom live in Choluteca, Honudras. The group leader, Ana, makes a living by running a small convenience shop where she sells basic groceries. Ana wakes at 6:00 each morning to open the store and attend to customers. She is currently raising two children, and hopes to help them get ahead. Ana is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, bread, soft drinks, juices, milk, eggs, cornmeal, cooking oil, lard, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies, chicken, meat and fish.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de Guadalupe se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del grupo desarrollan actividades de forma conjunta y dentro de un ambiente de solidaridad y respeto mutuo. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar actividades que fortalecen y fomentan su compañerismo.
Se definen como mujeres jefas de familia, que luchan día a día por obtener mayores ingresos, para que de esa forma puedan brindarles a sus hijos y familiares una vida mejor.
La Señora Lidia es comerciante, es decir se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de artículos, como ser frazadas, sabanas y demás, a lo que se dedica hace ya unos años. Ella gracias a esto ha logrado mantener a sus familiares. Sueña con algún día poder tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer los productos que vende, ya que sus ventas las realiza de forma ambulante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frazadas, artículos de mercería, y demás para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Guadalupe Group was formed by several neighbors in the city of Santaní.  All of the group members work together in solidarity and mutual respect.  They are a very close group capable of working together to strengthen their camaraderie.

They are defined as female heads of household and work daily to make higher earnings in order to provide their families with a better life.

Lidia is a merchant who has been in this business for several years now.  Thanks to this job, she has been able to support her family members.  She dreams of one day having a store from which to sell her products, as she currently makes her sales on foot.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of blankets, notions and other items to later sell.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they have given her.

loans.use: to buy blankets, notions and other items to sell.

loans.name: Lo Confianza Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group Lo Confianza 1, 2 & 3 (Truth).  Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo and is composed of fifteen businesspeople.  Ana lives in a simple structure with her husband and their three children.  She says that her biggest challenges are overcoming the economic crisis, growing her business and supporting her family. This is her second loan with Kiva partner Esperanza.

Ana has had her business for more than five years.  She bought a sewing machine with her own savings and started sewing clothes and curtains.  Ana now produces quilts, blankets, and other items.  She loves to sew; it is her favorite activity.  Ana will uses this loan to buy fabrics and other accessories, which she will use to produce about twenty quilts. She will save some of her profits and reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her sewing business

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está integrado por 10 mujeres, todas ellas son vecinas de esa ciudad. Se definen como mujeres muy emprendedoras, creativas y luchadoras, que día a día salen de sus casas con el objetivo de obtener mayores ingresos para sus familias. Todas ellas sueñan con un futuro mejor para sus hijos.
Una de las integrantes, La señora Damasia tiene 29 años, esta casada con el Señor Emilio, cuya actividad es pasero, tienen 4 hijos todos viven en su casa propia. La Señora Damasia se dedica a la elaboración de bordados, profesión que aprendió de su madre, pero su mayor deseo es poder tener un local donde pueda exponer sus trabajos para así poder ayudarle a su marido a generar ingresos para su hogar ya que el es el único que genera ingresos en su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos y agujas para la realización de sus bordados. Sabe que si obtiene el crédito, este le será de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encarnación and it is comprised of 10 women, all of whom are neighbors within the city. They are defined as very enterprising, creative and hardworking women who leave their houses every day in order to earn more income for their families. All of the women dream of a better future for their children.

One of the group members is Damasia. She is 29 years old and is married to Emilio, who is a fisherman. They have four children and they all live in a house they own. Damasia works in embroidery, a trade she learned from her mother. However, her greatest wish is to be able to have a store to display her pieces and be able to help her husband with the household finances, as he is the only breadwinner in the family.

She is requesting the loan to purchase thread and needles for her embroidery. She knows that if she is granted the loan, it will be of great use.

loans.use: to buy thread and needles for embroidery.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Hace algunos años Luz de 53 años de edad empezó a ahorrar dinero para iniciar sus negocio de venta de ropa, como tiene el ingreso del alquiler de una casa vió que era bueno invertir. Es así como compró mercadería camisas, blusas.
Al divorciarse de su esposo pudo continuar adelante con sus 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad. 

Donde ella vive existe la inseguridad y es lo que le preocupa por eso necesita poner puertas mas fuertes para evitar que los ladrones la vayan a asaltar.

Con un préstamo ella podría comprar pantalones, blusas, shorts, zapatos. El sueño que ella tiene es que su negocio sea el mas grande de la zona.
texts.en:
Several years ago, Luz (who is 53 years old) began to save money in order to start her clothing sales business.  Since she had income from renting out a house, she saw that it would be a good idea to invest it.  That is how she was able to buy merchandise, shirts, and blouses.

When she and her husband divorced, she was able to move on with her two adult children.

Where she lives isn't very secure and that worries her.  For this reason, she needs to install stronger doors to avoid possible assault from thieves.

With a loan, she could purchase pants, blouses, shorts, and shoes.  Her dream is that her business becomes the largest in the area.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, and paint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, and jewelry.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

Maribel nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 31 años de edad y un tiene un hijo. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Ella trabaja en una agencia de viajes en el terminal terrestre del distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco, ella está encargada de la venta de boletos de viajes desde las seis de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde. En esta oportunidad Maribel requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea para la educación de su hijo. El sueño de Maribel es abrir una empresa de transportes terrestre.
texts.en:
The “El Molinito II” (The Little Mill II) communal bank meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is known for its tourism, commerce and for its traditional, Inti Raymi, festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is found there.

Maribel was born in Cusco.  She’s 31 years old and has a son.  At present, she lives in the same city where she was born and that’s where she carries out her economic activities.  She’s employed at a travel agency in Cusco’s Santiago district’s ground transportation terminal.  She sells tickets from 6am until 1pm.  

On this occasion, Maribel needs the loan for personal use, that is, for her son’s education.  Maribel’s dream is to open a ground transportation firm.

loans.use: to pay for her child's education.

loans.name: Santos Florentin

texts.es:
Santos  es un señor de 47 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa e hijos en una comunidad llamada las Nubes localizada en los chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Esta empresa de las Nubes se fundó en el año 2007 y se constituyo con el fin de obtener fondos patrimoniales y propiedad de los socios y socias. 

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Santos es un micro crédito de ¢400,000.00 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para comprar una computadora portátil e impresora multifuncional, y para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible en la empresa.

Don Santos es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Las Nubes, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico; y fomentar el ahorro en los niños. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Santos is a 47-year-old man living with his wife and children in the community of Las Nubes (The Clouds), located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community is known for being mountainous and very close to the country's  northern border. The principal local economic activities are cattle raising and agriculture, especially sowing basic grains, sugar cane and oranges.

The Las Nubes enterprise was founded in 2007 for the purpose of obtaining patrimonial funds and property for its members. Santos belongs to this “Empresa de Credito Comunal Las Nubes,” (The Clouds Communal Credit Enterprise), one of the 110 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica. 

At present, Santos is requesting a micro-loan of 400,000 colons to buy a portable computer and multi-functional printer, and to provide the best possible maintenance and assistance to the enterprise.  With this loan, he hopes to grow at a personal and economic level and promote savings among his children. Also, it's clear that thanks to this type of organization and the means of credit it facilitates, he will be able to dedicate more time to productive activities.

loans.use: buy a laptop computer and versatile printer for his personal advancement.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

Janet nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Ella vende camote, oca, plátano y yuca al horno por las calles de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Janet requiere el préstamo para comprar camote y yuca por kilos aproximadamente comprará 78 kilos por producto que le valen unos S/. 360.00 nuevos soles. El sueño de Maribel es abrir un depósito de venta de cerveza.
texts.en:
The “El Molinito II” (The Little Mill II) communal bank meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is known for its tourism, commerce and for its traditional, Inti Raymi, festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located there.

Janet was born in Cusco and is 38 years old.  She’s married and has four children.  She currently lives in the same city where she was born and where she carries out her economic activities.  She sells roasted sweet potatoes, oca, banana and manioc along Cusco’s streets.  She’s been in business seven years now and does very well.

On this occasion, Janet needs the loan to buy sweet potatoes and manioc by the kilo.  She will buy approximately 78 kilos of product that cost about 360 new soles.  Maribel’s dream is to open a beer supply center.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes and manioc.

loans.name: Doris Ynes

texts.es: La Sra. Doris, es madre soltera, tiene 02 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y viven independientemente de ella,  la Sra.  Doris tiene  un auto  el cual lo alquila desde  hace 03 años, percibiendo una rentabilidad diaria de 35 soles; su  desafío  es que a  las personas  que lo alquila no cuidan el vehículo  como debería ser; su sueño es comprar  un nuevo carro para alquilarlo también; el crédito lo va a invertir en reparar el motor y para la compra de repuestos. La Sra. Doris está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Doris is a single mother.  She has two children who are already adults and live independently from her.  Doris has a car that she’s leased out for the last three years earning a daily rental of 35 soles.  Her challenge is that the people she leases the car to don’t take care of it like they should.  Her dream is to buy a new car and to lease it out too.  She will use the loan to repair the car’s engine and to buy replacement parts.  Doris is very grateful for the loan she was granted.

loans.use: to repair her car's engine and to buy replacement parts.

loans.name: Hernan Wilfredo

texts.es: El Sr. Hernán tiene 33 años de edad, es separado, vive en casa alquilada, se dedica hace 3 años a la venta de frutas, eligió este negocio porque también se dedica a la siembra de sandia; este negocio al Sr. Hernán le da una ganancia de 250 soles semanal. El crédito otorgado al Sr. Hernán lo va a invertir en el arreglo y compra de mercadería para su frutería. Su Sueño de Hernán es poder más adelante construir su propia casa y poder tener su propio local para poder seguir el negocio. Hernán está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Hernán, 33, is separated.  He lives in a rented house.  For the last three years he’s been selling fruit.  He chose this business because he also grows watermelons.  This business earns Hernán a weekly profit of 250 soles.  Hernán will use the loan he was granted to repair his fruit stand and to buy fruit.  His dream is to be able to build a house of his own later on and to be able to have his own locale to continue with his business.  Hernán is very grateful for the loan he was granted.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Rosa De Saron Group

texts.es: Este banco comunal se llama "Rosa De Saron". El banco está conformado por 11 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo. La señora Emperatriz es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 45 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos omnilife que inicio hace 1 año. Solicita el préstamo para comprar materia como suplementos nutricionales, malteadas con proteínas, limpiadores, energéticos y regeneradores y así ofrecer a sus clientes. Además sus otros compañero que también necesitan financiamiento para sus productos como venta de tortillas, crianza de gallinas, venta de ornado, crianza de gallinas, venta de ropa nueva, venta de helados, venta de ornados,  pulpería, crianza de gallina y pulpería. Todos tienen el mismo empeño y ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Rosa de Saron” (Rose of Sharon) and it has 11 members.  This is their first loan request.  

Emperatriz, 45, is the group President.  She sells Omnilife products; she started a year ago.  She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise like nutritional supplements, protein shakes, cleansers, energizers and regenerators to have available for her customers.

Besides, her other group companions  also need financing for their products like tortilla sales, raising chickens, roasted pork sales, chicken raising, new clothing sales, ice-cream sales, roasted pork sales, grocery store, chicken sales and grocery store.  They all have the same dedication and will to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy Omnilife brand health products.

loans.name: Agripina Maritza

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

Maritza nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Ella tiene un  pequeño taller en su domicilio donde se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía de tipo bisutería y en otras ocasiones compra productos ya fabricados para poder así abastecer a sus clientes y no dejarlos sin mercadería. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Maritza requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales y herramientas. El sueño de Maritza es abrir una empresa de elaboración de artesanía.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Molinito II" meets monthly in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is known for its tourism and commercial industry, for its traditional festival Inti Raymi, and because it is home to one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu.  

Maritza was born in the city of Cusco.  She is 25 years old and single.  She currently lives in the same city where she was born and where she works.  She has a small workshop in her home where she makes jewelry.  Occasionally she buys products that are already made so that she is able to supply her customers and stock her shop.  She has been running this business for two years and things are going well for her.  At the moment Maritza is requesting a loan to buy materials and tools.  

Maritza's dream is to open her own handicraft business.

loans.use: purchase materials and tools.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.es: Jefferson de 22 años, vive en el barrio Los Almendros, con sus padres en el municipio de Soledad, donde tiene una miscelánea y ofrece los servicios de internet, donde  vende mercancía variada, como  blusas, cosméticos, perfumería y pedrería en general. A sus clientes ofrece crédito y sus ventas corresponden a un 80% financiadas, mientras y el 20 restante, de contado; sus compras las realiza en el centro de Barranquilla, donde están sus proveedores y las hace de contado y semanalmente de acuerdo a la recuperación de su capital. Jefferson se preocupa con avanzar en su vida, estudia tecnología de la informática y en su negocio de mercancía es apoyado por su madre, quien se encuentra muy satisfecha por su grado de responsabilidad, mientras ejerce las dos actividades pues  maneja muy bien su servicio de internet, que es su gran pasión. Su meta más adelante, es dividir el espacio familiar del espacio productivo, pero su mayor desafío es su capital de trabajo que no es consecuente con su sueño de invertir oportunamente en sus negocios, donde tiene una creciente clientela donde día a día, nuevos clientes hacen pedidos. Esto es justamente lo que facilitará su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, a través del cual comprará ropa, cosméticos y accesorios que tiene encargado y menos aún puede  atender las ofertas de descuentos especiales de sus proveedores, por compras en volúmenes y de contado, para generar mayores ingresos y lograr que poco a poco su negocio proyecte mayor crecimiento.
texts.en: Jefferson is 22 years old. He lives in the Los Almendros neighborhood with his parents in the town of Soledad. He has a variety store where he offers internet service and varied merchandise such as blouses, cosmetics, perfume and jewelry. He offers credit to his customers and 80% of his sales are financed, while 20% are up front. He makes his purchases in downtown Barranquilla where his suppliers are. He pays upfront every week according to how much capital he collects. Jefferson is worried about getting ahead in life. He studies information technology and his merchandise business is supported by his mother, who is very satisfied with how responsible he is while doing his activities. He manages his internet service very well, which is his great passion. His goal for the future is to divide the family space from the work space, but his greatest challenge is his working capital, which isn't enough for his dream of investing in his businesses in a timely manner. He has a growing clientele, with orders from new customers every day. This is exactly what will facilitate his Kiva loan, the first loan he has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy clothes, cosmetics and accessories that he has on order. He will be able to take advantage of special discounts from his suppliers for buying in volume and paying upfront. In this way, he will generate more income and be able to grow his business little by little.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and accessories that he has on order.

loans.name: Angel Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Ángel es soltero, tiene 42 años y vive con su madre; es una persona trabajadora y de buenas referencias personales testigo de ello son todos los vecinos de él,  su casa familiar está destruida por el terremoto del 2007, su principal negocio es la venta de pescado en su triciclo, vendiendo todas las mañanas por todas las calles de la zona sur de la ciudad de Ica. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más pescado para la venta del mismo.  Su principal sueño es poder reconstruir su casa y poner un puesto de venta en un mercado central. El Sr Ángel esta muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Angel is single, 42-years-old, and lives with his mother. He is a hard-working person with good personal references. Witness for that comes from all his neighbors. Angel's family home was destroyed by the 2007 earthquake. 

His principal business is selling fish from his 'tricycle' every morning in all the streets of Ica city's southern zone. The loan angel requests will allow him to buy more fish to sell.

Angel's principal dream is to be able to reconstruct his house and open a sales stall in the central market. Angel is very grateful for this offer of a loan.

loans.use: increase the fish he can buy and enhance sales.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
Carlos  de 28 años, se dedica  en la ciudad de Barranquilla a una actividad comercial mediante la cual vende ranchos, víveres, bebidas y en general productos de la canasta familiar entre los habitantes del barrio donde habita con su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en las edades de 1 s 9 años. Su meta personal es seguirse superando permanentemente y lograr bienestar para su familia, mediante la adquisición de su vivienda. 
Carlos muchos años atrás se había dedicado a la albañilería e  la ciudad de Bogotá, pero en el año 2009 regresó a Barranquilla motivado por la enfermedad de su madre, quien tenía su negocio Minitienda Daniela  a la que hoy Carlos se dedica.  Sus principales clientes están ubicados en el barrio donde vie y en los alrededores de él, realiza sus compras  de contado y en pequeña cantidades,  así como sus ventas son la mayor parte de contado y una porción a crédito.   Sus inventaros rotan cada 18 días y  sus cuentas por cobrar cada 2.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen productos como arroz, aceite, azúcar y bebidas, con ello ganará descuentos por la compra de contado y en un mayor volumen que el usualmente acostumbrado.
texts.en:
Carlos is 28 years old. He works in the city of Barranquilla as a merchant. He sells groceries, beverages and general products for the family basket to the inhabitants of the neighborhood where he lives with his family. He is married and has 5 children, aged 1 to 9 years old. His personal goal is to keep getting ahead and achieve his family's wellbeing through getting a house. 
 
Carlos worked as a bricklayer many years ago in the city of Bogotá. In 2009 he returned to  Barranquilla because his mother was ill. She had the Mini-Store  Daniela where Carlos works now. His main customers are located in the neighborhood where he lives and nearby. He makes his purchases upfront and in small quantities and he makes his sales mostly upfront and some on credit. His inventory turns over every 18 days and his accounts payable are every 2 days. His Kiva loan is the first loan he has made with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it he will buy products in in greater volume such as rice, oil, sugar and beverages. With it he will get discounts for paying up front and in a larger quantity than he usually does.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, oil, sugar and beverages in greater quantities.

loans.name: Palomino De Martinez

texts.es: La Sra. L. tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, la Sra. L. tiene su tienda – librería en donde se dedica a la venta de artículos de escritorio, útiles escolares, golosinas, gaseosas y cerveza, lleva trabajando 5 años en el negocio; el crédito lo va a invertir para el mejoramiento de su casa, va a construir un cerco-muro de ladrillos y concreto. El principal desafío que enfrenta la Sra. es la inseguridad de su casa por la falta de un muro por la parte trasera de su vivienda; su sueño de la Sra. L. es tener algún día un minimarket en su casa y distrito en donde mejorara su condición laboral.
texts.en: Señora L. is 46  years old, married, and has a 12 year old son.  Señora L. has a store - bookstore where she sells stationary, school supplies, candy, sodas, and beer.  She has been running this business for 5 years.  She will use the loan to make improvements to her house.  She is going to build an outdoor enclosure made of bricks and concrete because her main challenge is the lack of security in the back of her house.  Señora L.'s dream is to some day have her own mini-market in her house and district so that she can improve her working conditions.

loans.use: make improvements to her house where her business is located.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

Yolanda nació en la ciudad de Huyro de la provincia de la Convención (Cusco, Perú), tiene 37 años de edad y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en un local alquilado y donde atiende a sus clientes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta  las 10 de la noche de lunes a viernes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Yolanda requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de azúcar, fideos, arroz, etc. El sueño de Yolanda es abrir otra tienda de abarrotes pero que un local se ha propio.
texts.en:
The “El Molinito II” (The Little Mill II) communal bank meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is known for its tourism, commerce and for its traditional, Inti Raymi, festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located there.

Yolanda was born in the city of Huyro in La Convención Province, (Cusco, Perú).  She is 37 years old and has two children.  She currently lives in the city of Cusco where she carries out her economic activities.  

She has a grocery store in a rented space where she tends to her customers Monday through Friday from 6am until 10pm.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well.  On this occasion, Yolanda needs the loan to buy sacks of sugar, noodles, rice, etc.  Yolanda’s dream is to open another grocery store but in a locale of her own.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, noodles, rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renew his driver's license.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa nació en la ciudad de Chinchero de la provincia de Urubamba (Cusco, Perú), tiene 48 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas.  Ella se dedica a la elaboración de lácteos como por ejemplo yogurt, ella también trabaja en una empresa de transportes que cubre la ruta a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, ella está encargada del área de encomiendas. Ya son varios meses que se dedica a este negocio de lácteos y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Teresa requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo leche, frutas frescas, azúcar y muchas cosas más que se necesitan. Su sueño de Teresa es convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y ser proveedora de yogurt de la ciudad de Quillabamba.  

El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Teresa was born in the city of Chinchero in the Province of Urubamba (Department of Cusco in Peru). She is 48 years old and has four children. Teresa currently lives in the city of Cusco, where she has developed her business activities. She makes dairy products, such as yogurt. Teresa also works for a delivery company that covers the route to the city of Puerto Maldonado. She is in charge of the shipping department. Teresa has been in the dairy business for several months and has done very well. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy supplies such as milk, fresh fruit, sugar, and other items that she needs. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman and a yogurt supplier in the city of Quillabamba.

The Communal Bank “El Molinito II” meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco in Peru. This city is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy milk, fresh fruit, sugar, and other items for making yogurt.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama la amistad, decidieron ponerle este nombre ya que los integrantes son puros amigos, que ya llevan tiempo de conocerse, la historia es acerca de señora Adalberta, cuenta con 55 años de edad, está casado quien tiene 6 hijos de los cuales ya todos están casados, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos mexicanos, desde hacen 5 años.

Dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, porque quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mejor solvencia económica, también, para asegurar su futuro y el de su esposo, además de que le deja buenas ganancias, el crédito que pidió lo va usar para invertirlo en la compra de mas insumos como son: aceite, sal, jitomates, chiles, papas, cebollas, carne, pollos, maíz, para continuar con la elaboración de sus deliciosos antojitos mexicanos.

La meta que se ha puesto doña Ada (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad), es hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, ya que quiere construir un local, para poner un restaurante, y así pueda hacerse de un mejor futuro, para que pueda tenerlo muy bien surtido y así mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos.

Nos cuenta que todos sus compañeros del grupo, son personas responsables, que cumplen con sus obligaciones, les gusta mucho el trabajo, para superarse y sobresalir ante cualquier dificultad, ya que ellos se conocen de hace tiempo dice que son personas pagadoras, no les gusta defraudar a quienes confianza en ellos.

Doña Ada le da las gracias a nombre de ella y su familia a FRAC y a kiva  por que gracias a ellos va a poder cambiar su vida, puesto que a hora tendrán una mejor calidad de vida.

Otros de los compañeros de doña Adalberto son: Víctor, Santa C., Santa C.,(hay 2 señoras con el mismo nombre) María, Magali, rubicela, ubalda e ivett,  quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: venta de ropa, abarrotes, venta de comida, maíz, carne, tamales, pescados, antojitos mexicanos y frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Amistad” (Friendship).  The members selected this name because they are purely friends since they have known one another for some time.  This profile will focus on Sra. Adalberta.  She is 55 years old, married, and six children, all of whom are married.  Adalberta has been preparing and selling Mexican street food for five years.

She decided to start this business because she needed to find a way to help her husband with the household expenses, improving their quality of life, and establishing a better financial situation.  In addition, she wanted to secure the future for herself and her husband by generating a good income.  The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more supplies such as oil, salt, tomatoes, chili peppers, potatoes, onions, meat, chicken, and corn so that she can continue preparing her delicious street food.  

Doña Ada (as she is better known in her community) says her goal is to grow her business even more.  She wants to build an establishment where she can open a restaurant and work toward a better future.  Ada wants to be well-stocked so that she can improve and increase her revenue.  

She says that all of her fellow group members are responsible people who fulfill their obligations.  They enjoy working so that they can move forward and overcome any difficulty.  For some time, they have been known for being consistent with their payments since they do not want to betray the trust that has been shown to them.  

On behalf of herself and her family, Doña Ada would like to thank Fundación Realidad and Kiva for changing her life.  She is now able to achieve a better lifestyle.  

In addition to Doña Adalberta, the other members are as follows:  Victor, Santa C., Santa C. (there are two women with the same name), María, Magali, Rubicela, Ubalda, and Ivett.  They engage in different retail businesses selling clothes, groceries, food, corn, meat, tamales, fish, Mexican street food, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy oil, salt, tomatoes, chili peppers, potatoes, onions, meat, chicken, and corn.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 55 years old and is married with seven children. She lives in Dipolog City. For the past three years, Julieta has run a general store where she sells variety of goods. She joined PMPC this year.

Julieta is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan to purchase a variety of goods for her general store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 51 years old and is married with five children. She lives in Poblacion, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Rosalina has a business selling snacks in the community such as hotcakes, banana cue (fried caramelized banana) and other items. She earns about 2,500 PHP each month. Rosalina has been a PMPC member for a month.

Rosalina is requesting a loan to purchase additional raw ingredients, such as flour, sugar, and oil, to use to cook snacks. In the future, she would like to have better living conditions and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare and sell snacks

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie is 34 and is married with six children. She lives in Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past 10 years, she has been selling grilled and fried banana snacks to earn a living. Genie has been a member of PMPC for one month.

Genie is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan to purchase bananas to cook. In the future, she hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and see her children finish their studies through college.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to cook

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 59 years old and is married with nine children. She lives in Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past two months, Estrella has operated a business where she buys food such as bread and takes it to the market to barter. She also sells bread to earn a living.  Estrella has been a member of PMPC for three years.

Estrella is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan to purchase bread, soft drinks, and other food products to take to market to barter for corn or exchange for other items. In the future, she hopes that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase bread, soft drinks, and other food products to take to market and barter

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak is 29 years old and is a housewife. Her husband is a village clerk who earns a daily income of 10 USD. The couple has two children who are five and three; the eldest is in school. Each month, Vannak spends 50 USD on food, 15 USD on electricity, 15 USD on school fees, and 10 USD on other expenses. 

Vannak is requesting a 650 USD loan to buy construction materials to repair her house. In the future, she wants to have small shop to sell drinks so that she can help earn money to support her family. Vannak hopes to send her children to study at the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house

loans.name: Saron

texts.en: Saron is 25 years old and earns a living as a garment factory worker. Her husband is a farmer and their combined income is $7 a day. The couple has two children who are four and two years old. Saron is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer so that she can begin doing some farming. In the future, she also plans to raise livestock as a way to further increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for a farm.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en: Sarun is 63 years old and earns about $7 a day by selling vegetables. She is a single mother with two children who are 26 and 23 years old. Each of her children works in a garment factory and earns about $3 a day. Every month, the family has to spend $100 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. Sarun is applying for a loan for $700 to buy a motorbike for her daughters to use when traveling to work. In the future, she would like to help one of her daughters go into business for herself by opening a small tailoring shop.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike her family can use when commuting to work.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
La Joven Rosalba tiene la edad de 19 años, solo estudio la prepararia y es soltera.
Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de un año asistio a un curso en su comunidad en el cual le enseñaron a elaborar manualidades con papel crepe y como aprendio bien a decidido iniciar a vender recuerdos para fiestas, XV años, bautizos, bodas y cumpleaños, ella nos dice que trabajara sobre pedidios y que necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de listones, papel crepe, hilos, pegamento, palillos, silicon, papel mache, unicel u hojas blancas para la elaboracion de sus manualidades y posteriormente venderlas.
Ella nos dice que espera tener mucho exito con su negocio ya que hasta el dia de hoy no existe nadie que venda este tipo de articulos en su comunidad, tambien nos dice que espera que sus productos pronto agarre popularidad para asi poder tener mas clientes y hacer crecer su  negocio.
Rosalba esta contenta ya que con este credito inicara a trabajar con su propio negocio y envia un saludo a la fundacion y mucho agradecimiento por el apoyo que le han dado.
texts.en:
Rosalba is a young woman who is 19 years of age. She is single and only has a preparatory school education.

Rosalba says that a little more than a year ago, she took a course that was offered in her community in which she learned how to make handicrafts out of crepe paper. She learned this craft so well that she started selling souvenirs for parties, quinceañeras, baptisms, weddings, and birthdays. Rosalba says that she works according to orders that she receives. She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of ribbons, crepe paper, yarn, glue, sticks, silicon, paper-mache, styrofoam, and butcher paper for making handicrafts that she can sell later.

Rosalba says that she hopes to have great success with her business. To this day, there is no one else who sells these types of items in her community. In addition, she hopes that her products gain popularity so that she can attract more customers and grow her business.
