Rosalba is pleased with this loan so that she can start these orders for her business. She sends her greetings to Fundación Realidad and expresses great appreciation for the support that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy materials for making and selling handicrafts.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is 57 years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamis City with her husband and three children. She earns about PHP 10,000 a month by making and selling clothing, and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional cloth to use to make items for her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for the last year.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth for a clothing-making business.

loans.name: Bul

texts.en: Bul, 40 year old, is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a construction worker and their income is $10 per day. She has five children, four of them are studying and one is too young for school. Every month, Bui has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $50 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She is requesting a loan of $600 to buy construction materials for her husband doing construction. In the future, she wants to repair her house to be better than now.  Bui will work hard to support her children to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy construction material for her husband doing construction

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda, age 37, is married with 4 children. She lives in Poblacion, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rosalinda sells canned goods and other daily use items such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, oil, soy sauce, etc. to earn a living. She has had this business for 8 months. Each month, she earns 1,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase goods to sell in her sari-sari (general) store.

Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC for 3 months. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to make her sari-sari store bigger and make her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase more stock  for her general store

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha, 49 year old, is a vegetable seller. Her husband is a policeman. Their income is $5 per day. They have three children who are 24, 21 and 18 years old. One is studying and another is a teacher who earns $2.50 per day. Every month, Chantha has to spend $77 on food, $15 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She is requesting a loan of $600 to buy vegetables to sell. Chantha would like to have a store for selling vegetables so that she doesn’t have to sell on the ground. She wants to support her children to continue their education..

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en: Sreypov, 40 year old, is housewife. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $5 per day. They have two children who they are working in the factory earning $4 per day  each. Every month, Sreypov has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She is requesting  a loan of $200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motor taxi service. He can can make more income  doing this than working as a construction worker. In the future, Sreypov wants to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to have a motor taxi service

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is 33 years old, married with one child. She lives in Ozamis City. Anelyn sells copra (dried coconut) to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month she earns PHP 15000 the business. She has requested a loan for 50,000 to purchase more coconut fruits for her copra business .

Anelyn has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: To purchase more coconut fruits for her copra business

loans.name: 10.2 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en: For the last five years, Mrs Hằng has made a living by running an office supplies store in Thanh Hoa city, which is in Thanh Hoa province. She is seeking a loan to buy more office supplies to sell to her customers. She is 27 years old, married and has one child. This is her first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women and she is applying for it to address her main problem, a shortage of capital. Her goal is to do well so that her family will be healthy and happy, and her children will do well in school.

loans.use: to buy office supplies to resell.

loans.name: Kimyet

texts.en:
Kimyet, 32 years old, is a worker. Her husband is construction worker, and their income is $10 per day. She has two children who are 11 and four; one is studying. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work with her husband. Her husband has been doing construction for about five year and all of villagers accept his work because he does it with all his attention. Because of his hard work, he has a lot of customers, so he hopes to extend his career bigger than before when he has enough money to manage that.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Chandy

texts.en:
Chandy, 51 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a soldier with $3 per day as his income. She has four children; one is studying and the other three are working. Their income is $4 per day, each. Every month, she has to spend $100 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fee, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to travel to work. Before, she used to sell groceries at home but she quit, and now she wants to start this business up again when she has enough money to open her shop. As for her children, she will support them to study at least to finish high school

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use to travel to work.

loans.name: 11.4 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. An has a manufacturing business making wine. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

An is 54 years old and she is married with one child. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 11.4 Đông Vệ solidarity group. An lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is An's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. An has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that An faces in her business is the lack of capital.

An hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her child to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make wine to sell.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha, 46 years old, is a banana seller. Her husband is a motorbike repairman, and their income is $2 per day. She has five children; three are studying, and the other two are working in a factory. Every month, she has to spend $88 on food, $15 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $200 to buy materials for repairing her house because it is not in good condition. In the future, she expects to send her children to study at least to finish high school.

loans.use: To buy materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with two children. Veronica is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Veronica is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 25,000 to purchase materials needed in her farm:  inputs or fertilizers.
 
Veronica has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in her farm: inputs or fertilizers.

loans.name: 9.4 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Ngần, a 59-year-old married mother of two, is the group leader of the 9.4 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of five members. Ngần supports one dependent with her vegetable-selling business, which she has been operating for three years in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province. Lack of capital is her biggest business hardship.

This will be Ngần's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women with which she will purchase more vegetables to resell. In the future, she hopes to build a new house, wants her business to do well, and desires her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Theng

texts.en: Theng is 47 years old and makes a living selling bananas. Her husband is a construction worker and their combined income is $6 per day. She has six children, four of whom are in school while the other two work and earn a combined income of $6.50 a day. Every month, the family has to spend $99 on food, $15 on electricity, $25 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She is applying for a loan of $200 to repair her house. Her goal in life is to ensure that her children get at least a high school education.

loans.use: to repair a house.

loans.name: 9.3 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Ms. Toàn is applying for a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. She works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Toàn is 65 years old and she is married with four children. Toàn is the group leader of the 9.3 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of six members. Toàn supports no dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Toàn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Toàn has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Toàn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Using her business profit, Toàn hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Fransmar

texts.en:
Fransmar is 48 years old and married, having two children. She is engaged in water refilling, and is a soya milk vendor and representative of organic fertilizer. She has managed her milk sales for two years and three years for her water refilling business. She is grateful because she is able to earn about P10,000 monthly in her water refilling business and P15,000 a month in her milk sales.She uses her profit for the payment of electric bills and some amounts go to their daily needs.

She would like to purchase a bigger machine for alkaline water refilling and a soya maker someday but due to insufficient funds she can not afford it. In this regard, she would like to ask for additional capital amounting to P25,000. That will be used to buy bottles of soya milk, gallons of alkaline water and organic fertilizer for her  retailing business. Through improving her soya milk production, water refilling and organic fertilizer sales her dreams will be fulfilled.

loans.use: to buy bottles of soya milk, gallons of alkaline water, and organic fertilizer for  retailing business

loans.name: 9.5 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa operates a food stall selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Hoa is 40 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 9.5 Đông Vệ solidarity group. Hoa lives with her two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for six years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes to maintain her business, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina, 53 years old, feeds chickens and ducks to sell. Her husband is an English teacher, and their income is $4 per day. She has three children; all of them are working at $4 per day for each. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy clothes and other things for her son-in-law so he can travel to work in Korea where he can make better income than here.

loans.use: To buy  clothes, etc., for her son-in-law.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman having two children, located in the village of Victoria San Mateo. She is 42 years old and engaged in a spare parts business.

She sells spare parts for motorcycles and other spare parts for vehicles while her husband serves as a mechanic. She has been managing her business for  five years and she is thankful because she earns about P21,380 monthly.

Teresita is requesting a loan in the amount of P30,000 to buy chains, sprockets, interiors for wheels and tyre tubes for her spare parts business. She hopes that she will be able to maintain her business through continuing support of her financial needs.

loans.use: to buy chains, sprockets, interiors for wheels and tyre tubes for her spare parts business.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Thai, 43 years old, has four children. Two of them are at school, while the other two are working in Thailand, making a total of $15 a day.

Thai is a farmer, and her husband sells palm sugar. Their income amounts to $8 a day. Every month Thai must spend $50 on food, $20 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $20 on other expenses.

Thai is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy rice to sell when prices are up. She has been in this business for about ten years and has many customers. She hopes to grow her business by buying more rice to sell when prices are up.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell when prices are up.

loans.name: Nai

texts.en:
Nai, 58 years old, has five children. Two are in school while the other three are working, making $10 a day in all. Every month Nai has to spend $70 on food, $20 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses.

Nai is a housewife while her husband is a fisherman who makes $5 a day. She is requesting a loan of $250 to buy a motorbike for her children to use to travel to work. In the future she wants to raise livestock at home so that she can make some money to help support the family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to use to travel to work.

loans.name: Pet

texts.en:
Pet, 62 years old, is a grocer. Her husband is a carpenter, and together their income is $15 a day. She has one child who is a construction worker. Every month, she has to spend $79 on food and $20 on other expenses.

Pet is requesting a loan of $700 to buy additional groceries to sell. In the future, she wants to sell gasoline and sugarcane juice in front of her house, so she can make income from three different sources at the same time.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey, 46 year old, is a housewife. Her husband is a construction worker with an income of $5 per day. She has three children. Two of her children are studying ,and one is working in the factory with an income of $2.5 per day. Every month, she has to spend $100 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy grocery goods to sell at a primary school. This loan will help her to get a career that can help her husband to make income for supporting the family.

loans.use: To buy grocerty goods to sell

loans.name: Eangleng

texts.en: Eangleng, 55 years old, is a food seller with $8 per day for her income. She is a single mother with five children. All of her children are working in the garment factory and they can each earn $5 per day. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $9 on electricity, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy material and equipment for making food to sell in Phnom Penh city. In the future, she hopes to expand her business when she can make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy material and equipment for making food to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: At the age of 33, Marcelina is still single. She is the breadwinner of the family because her mother is too old and has been ill. To sustain the needs of the family members and the medication of her mother, Marcelina went to Manila and worked as a sewer. She went back to the province to take care of her mother and made a decision to put up a business for a source of income. Nowadays, Marcelina has been managing her business raising hogs for over eight years. She desires to increase her income by buying additional piglets to raise. Marcelina is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional piglets to raise. She hopes that this loan will help her expand her business and increase her income to sustain her mother’s medication.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Pean

texts.en: Pean, 48 years old, is a farmer and potato planter. Her husband is a construction worker. They can earn $5 per day for their income. She has five children. Three of her children are studying and the other two are working. Their income is $10 for all. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $3 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy fertilize to put on her farm and her potato plantation. In the future, she wants to get a small grocery shop for a new career when she gets older. For her children, she wants to support them to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy fertilize

loans.name: Marfe

texts.en:
Marfe is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family and has run her business for the past three years.

Marfe is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment to maintain her motorcycle. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for her motorcycle

loans.name: Judicar

texts.en:
Judicar is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Judicar has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages, noodles & snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Judicar is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Judicar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Kimhay

texts.en: Kimhay is a farmer. Her husband repairs electronics. They can earn $15 per day for their income. She has one kid. He is three years old. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $3 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy material for repairing electronic goods. Her husband wants to buy more electronic stuff to sell in the shop when his career can make more profit and hopes to extend his career to fix more kinds of electronic.

loans.use: To buy material for repairing electronic goods

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio, a 46-year-old married father of six school-aged children, has been a farmer for 21 years, primarily growing rice crops to sell. He earns about 10000 PHP per month from his business and is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs to help improve his business.

Herminio hopes for his children to finish their studies and become successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Sokheeang

texts.en: Sokheeang, 39 years old, is a worker with her husband. Their income is $8 per day. She has no children to stay with.  Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to travel to work with her husband. She wants to sell grocery goods at home instead of working as a worker when she gets older and can make a better income than her current job.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work with her husband

loans.name: Hartford

texts.en: Hartford is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. Hartford has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish for sell. Hartford is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Hartford hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 25 years old and is married with one child who is in school. She raises livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past year and has sustained it with two previous loans from NWTF.

Vivian is requesting a 10,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy livestock to sell

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina, 36 years old, owns a small café. Her husband is working in his rubber plantation. Their income is $18 per day. She has two children. Both of them are studying. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $10 on electricity, $30 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a plot of land to expand her rubber plantation. In the future, she hopes to buy the land near by her rubber plantation to expand her business so that she is able to send her children to study to become a doctor after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to expand her rubber plantation

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 34 years old and single. For five years she has had a food shop where she sells homemade sausage and longganisa.

Lily is a new member of HSPFI. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy the ingredients to make more sausage to sell. In the future, Lily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to make more sausage to sell.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a soft drink retail business in the Philippines.

Paulita has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Paulita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 54 years old and a widow with 5 children.

Jeana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jeana has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from fish and vegetable vending, frozen foods, and raising pigs.

Jeana aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sokunhea

texts.en:
Sokunthea, 41 years old, sells fish, while her husband grows potatoes. Together their income is $13 a day. The couple has four children, all of whom are studying. Every month Sokunthea has to spend $99 on food, $5 on electricity, $104 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses.

In the past Sokunthea’s husband was a construction worker, but he has left this business because he is getting too old to carry heavy materials anymore. So Sokunthea is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to rent a plot of land for farming more potatoes.

In the future, Sokunthea wants to get a stall in the market where she can sell more fish. She also wants her children to graduate from the university.

loans.use: to rent a plot of land for farming more potatoes.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 56 years old, married and has five children. For five years she has sold green and yellow bananas.

Tessie is a new member of HSPFI. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more green and yellow bananas to sell. In the future Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more green and yellow bananas to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with eight children ranging in age from 20 to 6 years old. A farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato, Janet has been growing and selling rice for 20 years, earning about 4500 PHP per month She also owns a cow that helps in tilling the land.

Janet has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to earn more and be able to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Babina

texts.en:
Babina is 51 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Babina is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise. She has been raising livestock for six years and earns additional income by farming rice.

She is working tirelessly towards her dream of expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Bebiegean

texts.en: Bebiegean, a 20-year-old married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a retail shop that sells boiled duck eggs or balot for five years.  A new member of HSPFI, Bebiegean is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy duck eggs or balot to sell, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy duck eggs or balot to sell.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Florita is providing jeepney services and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline used for the services.

Florita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Florita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 41 years old. She is a married woman with two children aged 20 and 14 years old. She and her husband are both farmers. According to Jenny, she has been growing rice and corn crops for 17 years. She earns about 7,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Jenny is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and herbicides. She hopes to be able to have her own farming equipment. She also hopes for her children to finish their studies and find jobs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Marichu is peddling viands like fried chickens & pancit bihons. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands for peddling.

Marichu is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marichu hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make viands to sell

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 45 years old and married with three children.

Clemencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Clemencia has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for 17 years and also earns income from food sales.

Clemencia aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur with a used clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell. Elvira has been in this business for five years. Elvira earns additional income from fattening pigs.

Elvira has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Isagani

texts.en:
Isagani is 36 years old, married and has four children. For five years he has farmed and harvested rice and corn.

Isagani is a new member of HSPFI. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for his rice and corn fields. In the future Isagani hopes to improve his business.

The photograph above is of Isagani, his wife and one of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice and corn fields.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom, 42 year old, cleans a restaurant for $4 a day. In the past she sold pillows and mats in another province, but she changed her job to work in this restaurant, a better job than the other.

Sokhom is a single mother with two children. One is working in a factory making $3 per day and the other is a veterinary practitioner making $5 a day. Every month Sokhom has to spend $75 on food, $5 electricity, $40 on transportation and $40 on other expenses.

Sokhom is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy veterinarian medications for her son so he might treat animals in the village. In the future, Sokhom wants to send her son to study veterinary medicine further so that he can have a good career.

loans.use: to buy veterinarian medications for her son to use in his practice.

loans.name: Soa's Group
loans.use: to buy bamboo and materials to make more brooms.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a 32-year-old widow. For four years she has sold fruit such as mangoes and apples.

Annabelle is a new member of HSPFI. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more fruit to sell. In the future Annabelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 38 years old, married and has three children. For the past four years she has had a shop where she sells snacks, beverages and canned goods.

Teresita is a new member of HSPFI. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more snacks, beverages and canned goods to sell. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Sheenalyn

texts.en:
Sheenalyn lives and works in Ilagan in Isabela Province. She is an active and hardworking wife.

For four years Sheenalyn has sold food and daily-use products such as sweets, drinks, sugar, etc. from her own grocery store. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more food items such as drinks, snack foods, milk, coffee and soap in order to increase the assortment of goods in her store and so expand her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snack foods, milk, coffee and soap to sell.

loans.name: Robiyahon's Group

texts.en:
Robiyahon is the leader of this group. She is 55 years old, and unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised two sons. The first son works in Russia and the second son studies at university.

In order to earn a livelihood, Robiyahon sells perfumes. She started this activity with an initial investment of 5,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) and now her monthly profit is about 25,000 soms. Robiyahon’s younger son helps her in running the business. She applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for expanding the business. She wants to purchase more perfumes in order to increase the commodity turnover. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team: Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more perfume to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Sylvia has a food shop that sells banana cue (deep-fried bananas with caramelized sugar) and fried bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.
Sylvia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Sylvia hopes to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks to sell.

loans.name: Lo

texts.en:
Mrs. Lo, 44, is a married woman. She has no children. 

She intends to use the loan to buy feed concentrate to fatten pigs. She has several pigs and intends to feed them concentrate to fatten them up more quickly. She wants her animals to reach the ideal weight to sell them in the local and nearby markets. 

She wants to earn higher profits for her family and her parents’ well-being, and to grow her pig-raising project. This is her first loan. She has had no previous loans from the state banks either. Hattha Kaksekar Ltd. offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate. She is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase feed.

loans.name: Diane Krystl

texts.en:
At the young age of 29, Diane had already been blessed with two children, ages 10 and 8 years old; she is sending both to primary school. Mark (Diane's spouse) works as a local farmer. 

To add to the family's income, Diane raises hogs and sells them to the butcher in their village. She usually earns 1,500 Philippines pesos (P) with each hog. Profits are used for the daily needs of the family and to pay school fees and allowances for the children.

Diane is now requesting a loan of P9,000 to buy feed, medicines and vitamins for the hog to ensure good nutrition.

In the future, she would like to generate more income to continuously educate her children. According to her, education is the only legacy they could pass on to their children.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vitamins for the hog to ensure good nutrition.

loans.name: Dennelle Mheygan

texts.en:
Dennelle Mheygan is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Dennelle Mheygan has a retail shop that sells cashew apples and pineapples. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Phillipines peso (PHP) to buy cashew apples to sell.

Dennelle Mheygan is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Dennelle Mheygan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cashew apples to sell.

loans.name: Flordelyn

texts.en:
Flordelyn is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Flordelyn has a retail shop that sells dried fish. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more dried fish to sell.

Flordelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Flordelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
At her age of 50, Jesusa still works hard to provide sustenance for her family. She has five children and two of them are already married. The rest are attending school. To generate income, Jesusa wakes up early in the morning to buy sacks of rice and sell it in the market. Each month, she earns about PHP 3,000 doing this activity.  Profits earned are used for the family's daily consumption and to pay school fees. 

She would like to increase her earnings. That is why she needs additional capital to buy sacks of rice, sugar and salt to sell in the market.

With the help of this loan, Jesusa hopes for the improvement of her sales and to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar and salt to sell in the market.

loans.name: Tashir

texts.ru:
Ташир очень хорошая и порядочная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Её муж является трудовой мигрантом в России, и она сама зарабатывает денег на ежедневные расходы. Более 15 лет она занимается  торговлей и у неё хороший опыт. Она продает детские обуви на улице на открытом месте и там неудобно для торговли. Ташир намерена, построит магазинчик для удобной торговли и нуждается в поддержку.  Она хотела бы получит кредит в размере 2600$ США на открытие и постройки торговой точки.

 More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Tashir is a good and decent woman. She is married and is a loving mother of three children. Her husband is a working migrant in Russia and she makes money herself for everyday expenses. She has been in the retail business for more than fifteen years and she has a good experience. She sells children's shoes on the street in the open space and it's not very convenient for business. Tashir plans to build a small store for convenient business and needs support. She wants to receive a loan in the amount of $2,600USD to build and open a vendor space.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to build a store and expand business

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
Farming is the one business in which it is very hard to earn the income to support a family to be as rich as others. But Mrs. Chay and her husband try against the odds to feed all their children every day so that none die and they have a good standard of living. 

Both of them have been farmers since 2005. They can earn about $5 per day. They have two children to support. To raise their family, Mrs. Chay and her husband would like a loan from Kiva to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhun, 34, is a married woman with two children. 

She intends to use the loan to buy feed concentrate to fatten her pigs. She has several pigs and intends to feed thE. concentrate to fatten thE. more quickly. She wants her animals to reach the ideal weight to sell thE. in the local and nearby markets. 

She wants to earn higher profits for her family and her parents’ wellbeing and to grow her pig-raising project. This is her first loan. She has had no previous loans from state banks. Hattha Kaksekar Ltd. offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate. She would like to request the funds to purchase pig feed. Mrs. Chhun is in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is married with three children. She sells food items. Her grocery store is located in their community, which is why there are always many customers who come to buy groceries. She is a hard worker and works long days to make sure that her family has everything it needs. Genelyn has been running this business for six years. Her monthly profit is PHP 2,500.

Genelyn's business is the only source of income for her family. She realizes this responsibility and is doing her best to meet the needs of her family. 

Today she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more food items. Genelyn is hoping that from the increased profit from her business, she can expand her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snack food, spices and bread

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as cultivators. One of them is Mrs. Hin, age 52, who has been working in this sector since 1979.

Currently, Hin and her husband grow rice on their own farmland which they inherited from their grandparents. From this business, she can generate an income of around US$2 per day. 

This humble couple has four children. One of her children is married and lives in a separate house. Her daughter works as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh where she gets a low salary every month. 

The other two children are school-age. The family planted rice two months ago but it is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer and crop disease. Because of this, Hin and her husband are requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizer and insecticide to develop their business. 

She says the income will help her to improve her family's living standards. She is very thankful to all the lenders who help her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide to develop her business.

loans.name: Mary Junia

texts.en:
Mary Junia is 46 years old and lives in a rural area of Ilagan with her four grown-up children. She describes herself as being cheerful, cooperative, and likes to be friendly.

For three years, she has been making charcoal and selling it in the town market. She is doing very well with her business.

Mary Junia asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 and plans on using the loan to buy more wood and other raw materials needed to make charcoal. This loan will help her make more sales and allow her to have a better quality of life with her kids. Her desire is to watch her children grow healthy and watch her business grow.

loans.use: to buy wood and fuel for making charcoal

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda was born in 1959. She is married with six children who are going to school. Her husband is a farmer. Mrs. Erlinda raises pigs. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about P 2,000. 

Erlinda would like to borrow P 5,000 to buy feed and pigs. She has learned how to manage her business. She hopes to have more pigs in her farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for her business.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Farming is the one business in which it is very hard to earn the income to support a family. But Mrs. Horn and her husband try against the odds every day  to feed their children so that none die and they have a good standard of living. 

Both of them have been farmers since 1999. Horn is also a mixed-goods seller in her house. She can earn about $2 per day. This couple has four children. They are all enrolled in school. 

Mrs. Horn and her husband would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials. She hopes that she will send all of her children to study at high levels, as some other families do. She is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity it provides her. She has taken the photo with her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 33 years old and lives in Gatas, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte. She has a general store and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 24,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Marichu joined PMPC this year, 2011. In the future, Marichu hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

location.town: Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Gulai's Group

texts.en:
Gulai is a member of this group. She is 44 and married to a miller, whose monthly salary is 3000 soms per month. Together with her husband she is bringing up five sons; her three younger sons study at school and the other two have already graduated. 

A long time ago Gulai received cattle as an inheritance from her parents and since that time she has been breeding cattle to make additional money. Selling dairy products and reselling cattle after fattening, she earns about 5000 soms per month. Gulai applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future she wants to see all her sons get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Jocelyn Llanos Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and lives in Clarin. She is married with six children. She has a dress shop where she sells different styles of fashionable dresses. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more stock for her dress shop.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for three years.  

Jocelyn is the leader of a 3-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her dress shop.

loans.name: Lias

texts.en:
Mrs. Lias is a married woman with three children. One of her kids is married and lives in a separate house. The other two work in a café. Both of them earn a low salary every month.

Currently, she is a housewife so she does not earn any income. She depends on her husband and her children. Her husband is a security guard in a company where he earns a low salary every month. He works hard to support his family. 

To upgrade her family's living standards, Lias would like to request the funds from Kiva to repair her broken house. She is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity it provides her.

loans.use: to repair her broken house.

loans.name: Dilshoda

texts.ru:
Дилшода занимается купля продажей детской одежды. Более 4 года она занимается этим бизнесом. Дилшода мать одиночка и она сама обеспечивают свою семью. Её сын учится в среднем школе, и она хочет, чтобы её сын  учился в престижную школу и в хороших учебных заведениях, так как такие школы стоит дорого, и она не может, учит своего сына в таких школах. Давайте поможем Дилшоде чтоб сбылась её мечта. Она запрашивает кредит в размере 1000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента детской одежды с целью расширение бизнеса. Дилшода очень надеется в вашу поддержку.

texts.en:
Dilshoda is in the business of buying and selling children's clothing. She has been in this business for more than four years. Dilshoda is a single mother and supports the family alone. Her son goes to secondary school and she wants for her son to go to a better school, but such schools cost a lot and she is not able to afford it. Let's help Dilshoda make her dream come true. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000USD to buy a new variety of children's clothing with the purpose of expanding her business. Dilshoda very much hopes to receive your support.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: to purchase a new variety of children's clothing

loans.name: Marites Group

texts.en:
Marites is married with two children. Marites is 33 years old and lives in Clarin. She has a general store in order to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 4000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional stock for her general store.

Marites just joined PMPC this year. 

Marites is the leader of a 4-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is married with one child. Ester is 55 years old and lives in Ozamiz City.

Ester sells fashion jewelry to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 25,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase more beads for her fashion jewelry sales business.

Ester has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase more beads for her fashion jewelry sales business

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is 44 years old. She has two children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. They have earned an income to support the family by operating a store in front of their house selling pets, birds and cages. She has been running her store since 2004.

She requires a loan to purchase foodstuffs and different cages and related things to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes that will permit her to earn more income and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs, cages and related things for birds and pets.

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa, 50, is a hard-working woman who sells clothes to various customers. She’s worked for many years selling clothes to support her family. She has merchandise like pants, blouses and shirts. 

She has several dreams for her business so she wants to continue to develop it. Mrs. Sa has four children. Two of them are married and live in separate houses. Two of them are in school. She has many hopes for her work because it helps her support her children.

To help enable her family to live in as good a situation as rich families, Sa would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy clothing for resale, like pants, shirts and blouses. She is very grateful to all lenders for supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Angelina has a retail shop that sells hypo or cleansing agent per liter. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy raw materials for making hypo or cleansing agent.

Angelina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Angelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making hypo or cleansing agent

loans.name: Macario

texts.en:
Macario is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. He has a food shop that sells snacks like rice & banana cakes. He has had this business for one year. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Macario is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Macario hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.  She grows a vegetable garden and sells eggplants & string beans. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizers for the vegetables.

Leonarda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Leonarda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetables.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 59 years old, married and has two children who are in school. She has been raising pigs for five years. She was previously selling cosmetics to earn a living. Through her hardship and patience she has learned how to manage her business. This has helped her to retain her business for five years.

She hopes to have more pigs in her farm in the future. She has requested P 15,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future she hopes to have better living condition for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods & snacks. She  is also engaged in buying & selling shelled corn. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for the store.

Helen is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for the store.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. She has a retail shop that sells fish such as sardines, mackerel & milk fish. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Fe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa has been in active farming for 4 years producing and selling milk and eggs which she sells to the local markets in her hometown of Eldoret in North Rift, Kenya. She is married with one child, aged 9. She runs a retail shop for household goods and cereals.

She has made a loan request amounting to 90,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her construct a dairy unit and start a poultry farm by buying poultry birds. She says the two businesses will help her in paying for the education of her child and payment of the loan. She is optimistic that with time she will be able to make supplies of over 10 trays of eggs in a day.

Melisa laments the high costs for management of animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Marlyn has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell. She is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Annie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks. She is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Annie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Janiffer

texts.en:
Janiffer is a proud mother of two, aged 12 and 10, and has been in mixed farming for five years in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya. Her farm produces eggs, tea and milk.

Jannifer has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for a total of 30,000 KES to help her buy more poultry birds and enjoy the economies of scale. She says the income will help her in educating her children, and also help expand her dairy farming by acquiring better breeds for the dairy business.

She say diseases are the greatest challenge in a farming business.

loans.use: To pay for more poultry birds.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman with three children. Her husband works as a laborer in their community. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of foods.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling pig meat, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Aida dreams of purchasing a tricycle to transport the pig meat in the future.

With the PHP 17,000 she wants to purchase pigs and feed to fatten them for resale.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Jasmin has a retail shop that sells clothing like blouses and t-shirts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy t-shirts, blouses and underwear to sell.

Jasmin is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jasmin hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children.
 
Helen has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages and noodles. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Helen is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Elma has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy snacks and beverages to sell.

Elma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ednah

texts.en:
Ednah is married with one child, aged 12 years. She has been active in farming for the last seven years in her home area of Litein, South Rift, Kenya, producing and selling tea, eggs and milk to the local market. She fully relies on farming for her family upkeep.

Ednah has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. She hopes the added income will help her in paying for her children's education. She says she is also focused on constructing a dairy unit for her animals as well as improving the quality of animals she rears to improve her income.

Ednah  says insufficient dairy feeds is the main undoing in dairy farming. However, she remains glad about Juhudi Kilimo’s loan services.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix lives in the Philippines. He is is 30 years old and married with 1 child. 
Felix has a shop that sells snacks, beverages, ice, ice water & ice candies. He has had this business for 2 years.  He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Felix is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Felix hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks for his store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and married with two children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut wine and vinegar.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and married with five children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a tobacco business in the Philippines and requests a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of tobacco for resale.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF. She has been running her business for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Josephine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 48 years old, married and has two children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by raising pigs and selling fish. She is applying for a loan for PHP 20,000 NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn lives in the Philippines. She is is 21 years old and single with 1 child. 
Jovelyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, breads & detergent. She has been running this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks for sale at her store.
Jovelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jovelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond  lives in the Philippines.  He is 34 years old and married with 2 children. 
Raymond has a shop that sells snacks, noodles, detergents & beverages. He has been running this business for 4 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Raymond is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Raymond hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for his store.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is 30 years old and married, with 3 children.  She earns a living by making ice cream in the Philippines. Lucille is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.  Lucille has been making ice cream for 3 years and also earns additional income from a vulcanizing shop, pig fattening and retail selling of gasoline.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and send her children in college.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.ru:
Абдували добросовестный и честный человек. Он женат и отец 2 детей.   Более 12 лет Абдували занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он сеет картошку каждый сезон, затем продает их в местном рынке. Кроме этого он занимается скотоводством.  Абдували хочет расширить свой бизнес и увеличить свой оборотный капитал. Прибыль, который он планирует, получит, он хочет, женит своего сына, и сыграть свадьбу. Абдували запрашивает кредит в размере 2100$ США для покупки скота и горюче смазочные материалы. Он надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Abduvali is an honest and conscientious man. He's married and the father of two children.  He has been farming for more than twelve years.  He plants potatoes every season and then sells them at local markets. He also raises cattle. He would like to expand his business and increase his working capital. He wants to use the profits so he can marry off his son and have a wedding.  Abduvali is seeking a loan for 2100USD to buy cattle and fuel.  He hopes the loans will support him.

loans.use: to buy cattle and fuel.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 31 years old and married, with 7 children. With 4 children in school, Luisa works very hard to provide for them. 

She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like sardines, groceries, etc.  Luisa has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, milk, curls, etc. 

In the future Luisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Rodita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the buying and selling of fermented shrimps. Rodita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for fishing, like bamboo and fishing thread for her fishing business.

Rodita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for fishing, like bamboo and fishing thread

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.en:
Gilberto lives in the Philippines. He is married and is 34 years old.
Gilberto  has a shop that sells pigs & chicken. He also makes and sells wood charcoal. He has been in this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for pigs & chicken.
Gilberto  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gilberto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs & chicken

loans.name: Susi

texts.en:
Susi is 48 years old and married, with 2 children.  She earns a living buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. 

Susi is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise and sell.  Susi has been buying and selling livestock for 20 years and also earns additional income from a networking business (Avon products) and farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Nop

texts.en:
Nop, 56, lives in Prey Chor district of Kompong Charm Province, Cambodia. She lives with Leng, 61, shown in the picture, and their five children. Nop cares for her family and provides a good education for her children. She works hard in the fields, planting rice, corn and bananas on her own land. She’s been in this farming business for 16 years.

During harvest, her children help her and she hires day workers to harvest and transport the crops. The crops are transported a certain distance, where they are picked up by motorized vehicles for further transportation. She feels very committed to her work because thanks to her daily effort, she sees her farming business developing and making a good profit.

She says certain months while farming, the population of insects is very high and they damage the crops. She requests a loan from Kiva to purchase natural fungicides and sacks of manure to fertilize her lands and make them productive. This is his 4th loan, and and a small one to reach her objectives, so she is naturally predisposed to repay it punctually.

loans.use: to purchase natural fungicides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 56 years old and married with 5 children. With 1 child in school, Teodora works very hard to provide for them.

Teodora is an ambulant vendor of tobacco in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Teodora has been in this business for 23 years.

In the future, Teodora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of fruits to sell in her business. Trinidad has been in this business for 10 years.  She earns additional income from raising pigs and rice retailing.

Trinidad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fruits to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace  lives in the Philippines.  She is 23 years old married with 1 child.   Her husband provides motorela or motorcycle services.
Grace has a retail shop that sells snacks like rice & pancakes.   She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.
Grace is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Cheruiyot  is a resident and farmer in Litein South Rift Kenya.   He is married with one child, aged 6 years.  He currently employs two farmhands on his farm that produces tea and milk.

Cheruiyot has made a fourth loan request of 70,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase a dairy cow. He says the dairy business will enable him to venture into other businesses and make his family financially more stable and secure.

Cheruiyot is glad Juhudi Kilimo is helping farmers out of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ba

texts.en:
Ba lives in An Ninh village.  She is 52 years old and has two grown children.  She is a farmer, she grows rice and also raises pigs. 

She has a monthly income of about 3.500.000 Vietnamdong(VND).  She has participated in SEDA since 2008.  In the last cycle, she borrowed 8.288.000 VND to raise pigs and repaid this loan punctually.  In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Rasul

texts.ru:
Расул честный и добросовестный человек.  Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей.   Расул занимается производством лепёшек. С детство он был знаком с этим бизнесом, его отец занимался и он помогал. Более 19 лет уже он занимается этим бизнесом, и он набрал достаточный опыт, чтобы расширить этот бизнес.  Только его жена помогает ему в данном бизнесе. Дети у него еще маленькие. Получая прибыли, он мечтает, устроит своих детей в лучшую школу и университетах, чтобы его дети выросли образованными и честными людьми.  Расул финансируется в Имон Интернэшнл более 28 циклов и у него положительный кредитный досье. Расул запрашивает кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки муки и уголь с целью расширение бизнеса. Заранее благодарить Кива и Имон за поддержку.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Rasul is a conscientious and honest man.  He's married and has three children. He makes flatbreads for a living. He's been associated with that business since he was a child.  It's what his father did and he helped out.  He's been had his business for more than nineteen years and he has amassed enough experience to expand it.  He has only his wife to assist him; his kids are still small.  Once he has some returns he dreams of sending his kids to a better school and to college so they can grow up educated and honest people. Razul has done more than twenty-eight loan cycles with IMON International and he's got a good credit record.  He is requesting a loan of 3000USD to buy flour and coal in order to expand his business.  He wants to thank Kiva an IMON in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy flour and coal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy  maize and cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Or

texts.en: Mrs. Or learned farming from her grandparents and has spent the last three years raising crops. She is now married and has three school-aged children. Her husband frequently works in the field with her, and they have been very successful as farmers. The couple is able to plant two crops a year, one in the rainy seaS. and the other in the dry seaS.. She is applying for this loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, a pump and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, a pump and seeds.

loans.name: Phong

texts.en: Mrs. Phong has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she had learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has three school-aged kids. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for her crop. However, Phong doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm, so, she is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting. Mrs. Phong very much hopes to receive your support soon.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Porn

texts.en: Mrs. Porn has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has one school-aged kid. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual activity which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for her crop. However, Porn doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm, so she is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting. Mrs. Porn is very grateful to all lenders that support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock like socks, sweaters, trousers, skirts, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts, crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is a resident of Litein. He is 23 years old and has been in farming for the last two years producing and selling tea, eggs and milk to the local markets. He currently employs two farmhands on his farm.

Oscar has made a first loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 52,000 KES to help him purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the cow will help him improve his production and expand his farming business with the savings he makes out of the income.
