Oscar, though, laments about the animal diseases' costs as well as that of animal feeds. However, he appreciates Juhudi Kilimo’s loan services.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Damazo

texts.en:
Damazo is a 50-year-old married man with six children living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to be able to educate his children to higher institutions of learning.

Damazo has been in the produce business for 20 years and with the proceeds, he has been able to build a house and pay school fees for his children. He has challenges of price fluctuation and his dream is to supply the western region of the country. Damazo needs the loan facility to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Mrs. Min is a 46-year-old widow with three children who lives in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and to hire a domestic laborer to plow the rest of her farmland so she can plant crops.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Thủy is a 55-year-old woman living in a town of  Yên Phong district - Bắc Ninh province.  She is married and has four adult children.  To make a living, Thủy owns & operates a specialized retail store.  The main source of income for the business come from selling liquor such as beer & wine in the local community.  Thủy has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Thủy joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thủy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,288,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Thủy is now requesting a new loan of 9,184,000 VND which will be used to enlarge her shop with the hope to have more space  for laying new products.  This will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Thủy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to improve housing condition for more space to lay new products

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident and farmer in Litein in South Rift, Kenya. His farm produces tea and milk which he sells on the local market. He has been in farming for the last four years and currently employs one farmhand. He is married with three children aged between 5 and 1 year old.

Peter has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional dairy cow will help him in paying for the education of his children as well as allowing him to invest the rest of the income in a new farming venture to spread his farming risks.

Peter notes animal diseases and feed are the greatest challenges in farming due to their high cost.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase summer clothing and school uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Resurrecion

texts.en: Resurrecion is married and has four children. He is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. Resurrecion is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living. He has been doing this for 30 years. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for his corn. Resurrection has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for corn

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is married with one child aged one and half years and lives with his family in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya. He has been farming for the last 4 years producing and selling tea and milk to the local market.

Gilbert is requesting a 41,600 KES loan with Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this will improve his family livelihood and he hopes he will also generate enough income to put up a modern dairy unit for the animals.

Gilbert, like many farmers, notes that the fluctuation in milk prices and also animal diseases are the major risks in the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Elena's Group

texts.en:
Elena, 48, is the treasurer of this group. She resides in the small town of Tokmok and has four daughters, one of whom is financially dependent on her. Elena’s family is a great example of a typical local family. She sells fruit in the market in the daytime and also delivers homemade milk products to her neighbors. Elena’s husband is a construction worker and is happy that Elena’s business has been successful, since it’s the main source of family income. The products which Elena retails vary with the season. Currently she sells raspberries and apples. The main achievement of the family, according to Elena, is the purchase of an apartment. She’s been in this business for five years. The purpose of Elena’s loan is to purchase a dairy cow, in order to increase the amount of milk products she can sell. 

          --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 30 year old married lady with three children living in her own house in Fort Portal ,Uganda. She takes care of the family with the help of her husband who is a veterinary doctor. Jane has been selling agricultural products such as pestcides for six years, but her major constraint has been lack of capital to supply the vast market. Jane needs the loan to buy farm supplies like pestcides for resale.

loans.use: To buy  farm supplies like pesticides for resale.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlita is 56 years old and lives in Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor, Philippines.  She is married with six children.

Merlita is a pillow case maker and earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan amount of PHP 3,000. To purchase cloth for pillow case making.

Merlita is a newly recognized member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative since July 2011.  In the future, Merlita hopes to sustain her project and help her family.

loans.use: To purchase  cloth for making pillow cases

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a hardworking man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His cherished dream is to build commercial houses because he believes they bring higher returns. He has been operating a shop for two years and business is profitable despite the high cost  of rent and the ever raising prices due to the current inflation rate. Moses needs the loan to buy sugar, salt, soap and rice for resale. His dream is to own a wholesale shop and also to build his own business premises.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, soap and rice bags for resale.

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en: Angelyn is 30 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married and has two children. To earn a living, Angelyn has a business selling snacks. She earns about 2,000 PHP each month doing this work. Angelyn has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase ingredients for her business. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 60-year-old widowed man with five children. He lives in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his younger children to the university level. He owns a pub; he has been in this business for four years. His major challenge is limited funds to meet the demand. His desire is to own a modern bar. David needs this loan to buy crates of beer and local gin for resale.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer and local gin for resale.

loans.name: Giang

texts.en:
Giang is a 31-year-old woman living in Yên Phong District, Bắc Ninh Province. She is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Giang owns and operates a restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Giang has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from this activity.

In 2008, Giang joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Giang has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,288,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. Giang is now requesting a new loan of 9,184,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be her fifth loan from SEDA. Giang plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya. She has been in farming for the last 10 years producing mainly milk, coffee, eggs and tea which she sells to the local market. She is married with 2 children, ages 11 and 1. Nancy is employed as an accounts clerk and gets additional income which supplements her farming income.

Nancy has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase artificial insemination equipment for her farm. Nancy says the machine will enable her to generate income by rendering the service to other farmers as well as getting the services at a lower costs. 

Nancy notes that farmers in the area are facing challenges due to poor markets and lack of enough water for irrigation.

loans.use: to purchase artificial insemination equipment for her farm

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.ru:
Tunzala rodilas v 1988 qodu. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Tunzala yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 
Ona uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya skotovodstva. Etobu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami.
texts.en:
Tunzala was born in 1988. She is married and has two children. Tunzala is an Internally Displaced Person from the town of Fuzuli currently living in the Fuzuli Region with her family.

She has been in animal farming for two years already, raising cattle. At present she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cows and develop her business further. She learned this line of work from her mother.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is 31 years old and lives in Ozamis City. She is married with one child. Mildred has a t-shirt printing business and earns approximately 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 35,000 PHP to purchase printing materials to be used for her t-shirt printing business. Mildred has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase printing materials to be used for her t-shirt printing business

loans.name: Zaverio

texts.en: Zaverio is a 58-year-old, married man with 8 children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a dream of educating his children up to higher levels. Zaverio owns a tailoring shop and he specifically deals in school uniforms. He has been in business for 15 years and the major challenge faced now is price fluctuations that result in high operational costs. His dream is to acquire a contract of supplying school uniforms in about 50 schools. Zaverio needs the loan to buy school uniforms for resale.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms for resale

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en: Ma. Liza is 41 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is married with three children. Ma. Liza works in the fish industry and sells and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan for additional capital. Ma. Liza has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Ma. Liza hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to obtain additional capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water tank and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Ilimkan

texts.en:
Ilimkan, 60, is a member of this group. She is married and is a proud mother of seven children, the youngest of whom is a college applicant. The main source of income for the family is cattle breeding. For almost 16 years Ilimkan has been buying young calves, taking care of them, and reselling them after they reach a certain age. She is considered to be the founder of this kind of business in her village, Taldy Suu. Therefore, all her neighbors address her when they need useful advice in the techniques of cattle breeding. The business was started with an initial capital of 16,000 soms and generates about 3,000 soms monthly. Ilimkan hopes to give her youngest son access to a high quality education and help him pay the tuition. Therefore, she plans to increase her efforts in running her business. The purpose of the loan is to purchase two calves for further breeding and reselling. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 35-year-old married man with three children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children and have a self-sustaining business. For five years he has been in the agricultural sector, specialised in growing maize. He started with four acres of land but now he has twenty acres of land all covered with maize. His major challenge has been price fluctuations for maize products and his dream is to own a maize milling machine. Joseph needs this loan to clear land for growing maize.

loans.use: to clear land for farming.

loans.name: Benkadi Minanan  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI MINANAN 1 sont des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 7 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont essentiellement le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, NOUMOUDJO, la première assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour  et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou (le principal marché hebdomadaire de la contrée), après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI MINANAN 1 comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000F CFA environs à la fin de la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of group Benkadi Minanan 1 are married women who are on average 40 years old with seven children. They live in polygamous families in Kafla, one of the villages of the rural township of Banco in Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (Mali's second administrative region).
They are collaborating with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. They mainly cultivate rice and groundnuts. They are on their first collaboration with the organization.
With this first loan, Noumoudjo – the first woman sitting from the right – plans on buying agricultural intrants and small equipment as well as pay for plowing and weeding expenses to maintain about 1.5 acre of rice and groundnuts.
After the harvest, productions are sold locally at the village market as well as in markets in Banco and N’Golobougou, the main weekly market in the area, to a clientele composed of men and women. The women from group Benkadi Minanan 1 are counting on making an average profit of about 75,000 FCFA at the end of the cycle.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 43 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, has five children and has made a living for the last five years by selling fish. She is applying for a loan for PHP 3,000 to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for the last two years, and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en: Beatrice is a 32-year-old married woman with four children living in her own home in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to construct a commercial house and educate her children up to university. She a vendor of fresh foods and has been in this business for six years. Her constraint is lack of refrigerating facilities since most of her goods are perishables, and her dream is to buy a fridge and also to purchase at least 10 crates of tomatoes per month. Beatrice needs the loan to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Minanan 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe BENKADI MINANAN 2 est constitué de six femmes mariées ayant en  moyenne 53 ans, 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles élargies  à Kafla, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative  de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes du groupe collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
SARAN, la deuxième personne assise à droite, espère acheter avec son prêt les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs. SARAN envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85 000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
Group Benkadi Minanan 2 is composed of six married women who are on average 53 years old with six children. Most of them live in traditional extended families in Kafla, one of the villages of the rural township of Banco in Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (Mali's second administrative region).
The women of this group are collaborating with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The species they cultivate include rice and groundnuts. They are on their first collaboration with the organization.
Saran, the second person sitting from the right, is hoping to buy agricultural intrants and light agricultural equipment with her loan, as well as pay for plowing and weeding expenses to maintain about 2 acres of rice and groundnuts.
After the harvest, productions are sold locally at the village market as well as in markets in Banco and N’Golobougou, to a clientele composed of consumers and retailers. Saran is planning on an average profit of about 85,000 FCFA at the end of the cycle.

loans.use: to play for plowing, agricultural intrants, weeding and light agricultural equipment.

loans.name: Povi Ernestina

texts.fr:
Povi est une femme âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée å un géomètre topographe. Elle a 02 enfants.
 Povi travaille comme revendeuse d’alimentation générale (riz, sucre, huile végétale) depuis 2006. Elle vend à domicile. 
Elle achète les produits dans les marchés périphériques et au Grand Marché. 
Povi a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentations générales et des mèches.
texts.en:
Povi is a woman of 32. She is married to a topographer and has two children. 

Povi has been working at selling groceries (rice, sugar, vegetable oil, etc.) since 2006. She sells them out of her home. She buys the products she sells in suburban markets and at the Grand Marché.

Povi has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy grocery products and hair extensions.

loans.use: to buy grocery products for resale.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married with two children. Violeta is 22 years old and lives in Palomoc,Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Violeta sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks business.

Violeta has been a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Violeta hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks business.

loans.name: Moussiliyou

texts.fr:
Moussiliyou est un homme âgé de 39 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 04 enfants. 
Moussiliyou travaille comme revendeur des matériaux électriques depuis 1999. Il vend à ses clients au quartier Bé. Il achète les produits à Lomé. 
Moussiliyou a requis son troisième  cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des matériaux électriques.
texts.en:
Moussiliyou, 39, is married to a small-scale retailer and has four children. 

Moussiliyou has been working at selling electrical goods since 1999. He sells to clients in the Bé neighborhood. He buys his products in Lomé. 

Moussiliyou has requested his third loan from WAGES in order to purchase electrical supplies for resale.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.ru: Sabina yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas jivet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Sabina 35 let. Ona seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota. Ona uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en: Sabina A. is an internationally displaced person, she has moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with her family. Sabina is 35 years old, married and has 2 children. Currently she would like to borrow 2000 AZN in order to purchase a cow to increase the size of her herd. Sabin has been breeding and raising cattle for the last 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Shairkul's Group

texts.en:
Shairkul, 38, is treasurer of this group. She is married and has four children. Shairkul’s husband is a security officer in a learning center. Being inspired by Kyrgyz traditional style of sewing and successful designers, who made their business ideas come true, Shairkul dared to get involved in the sewing and textile industry. Five years ago, she bought her first sewing machine, some fabric and other sewing supplies for a total sum of 8,000 soms. Just like every newcomer in business, she was afraid of risk and lack of experience. She was amazed at how her works were accepted among her fellows and potential customers, and soon became widely known in her town of Tokmok as one of the best seamstresses and designers. Shairkul applied for a loan in order to buy one more sewing machine, because she plans to broaden her team. Of course, as any other designer, Shairkul dreams of opening her own fashion house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married with five children. Rosalinda is 45 years old and lives in Tangub City. Rosalinda sells bananas to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to purchase bananas for her banana-selling business.

Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase bananas for her banana-selling business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old, married with five children, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

Her dream is to educate her children and also to set up an income-generating activity that is sustainable for the family. She sells new clothes and has been in this business for four years. The major challenge faced is high cost of the clothes that leads to low profits, and her dream is to set up another outlet in town. Grace needs the loan to buy new trousers and skirts to sell.

loans.use: to buy new trousers and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Pagmadulam

texts.en:
Mrs. Pagmadulam is 33, unmarried and lives with her brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 1999, she has been working as a hairdresser. In 2005, she could start own business in this field and opened her barbershop called “Usukh”. She hired two hairdressers in her salon and renders a manicure service to the clients. Pagmadulam is one of the hard-working women and her daily job continues between 9:00 am-10:00 pm everyday. Recently, she has been planning to expand her business by improving her equipment or making a repair to her workplace. But she needs financial support to do it. It’s very important for her business and life.

Therefore, she is taking a loan to purchase some new equipment and to renew her barbershop.

loans.use: to purchase some new equipment to renew her barbershop.

loans.name: Akuélé

texts.fr:
Akuélé est une femme  âgée de 57 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a 01 enfant.
Akuélé travaille comme revendeuse d’Atiéké et viande de bœuf depuis 1997. Elle vend à domicile à ses clients. Elle achète les produits au Burkina-Faso et en Cote d’Ivoire. 
Akuélé a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter de la viande de bœuf et des manioc pour  préparer du Atsiéké.
texts.en:
Akuélé, 57, is a widow with one child. 

Akuélé has been selling "Atiéké" and beef since 1997. She sells out of her home to her customers. She buys her products in Burkina-Faso and Cote d’Ivoire. 

Akuélé has requested her second loan from WAGES to buy beef and manioc in order to prepare "Atiéké".

loans.use: to buy beef and "Atiéké" (a traditional manioc dish).

loans.name: Gulsara's Group

texts.en:
Gulsara, 49, is leader of this group. She has been working in art for 20 years of her life. Her hard work was repaid when she was promoted as a director of the museum where she worked for the most part of her career. While she invested all her abilities and skills in art, Gulsara’s husband was an experienced herdsman, who resold the best cattle in the town. Soon his income allowed him to broaden the household by purchasing more and more livestock. Currently, cattle breeding generates 3,000 soms per month. Gulsara says cattle needs extremely careful treatment including good temperature, food and water. She considers clover the best option. It’s useful for livestock and can be stored for a long time. The purpose of Gulsara’s loan is to buy clover for livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase clover.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is married with two children. Marieta is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Marieta is raising a pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to purchase more pigs to sell.

Marieta has been a member of PMPC for two months. In the future, Marieta hopes to have good living conditions and to make her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to sell.

loans.name: Năm

texts.en:
Năm is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong district - Băc Ninh province. She is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Năm owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs and spices in the local community. Năm has been engaged in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Năm joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Năm has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,288,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Năm is now requesting a new loan of 9,184,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. Năm plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the food business.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr:
Ayoko est une femme agée de 29ans. Elle est mariée å un employé à la pharmacie. Elle a 02 enfants.  
Ayoko travaille comme revendeuse de cartes de rechages depuis 2008. Elle est aidée par 02 personnes et vend à ses clients. Elle achète les produits à Tokoin Ramco. 
Ayoko a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharges.
texts.en:
Ayoko is a 29 year old woman. She is married to a pharmacy employee. She has 02 children.
Ayoko has worked as a top-up card retailer since 2008.She is assisted by 02 people and she sells to her  customers. She buys her merchandise at Tokoin Ramco.
Ayoko has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase top-up cards.

loans.use: Purchase top-up cards

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.ru:
Ярослав не женат. Он живет в Ужгороде. Там он предоставляет услуги по ремонту обуви. У него есть своя клиентская база и хорошее рабочее место. Эти услуги Ярослав предоставляет всего год, но он уже успел приобрести неплохой опыт работы. Его доход составляет 6 500 гривен в месяц. 

Ярославу необходима сумма в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести материалы и инструменты для работы. Он планирует и дальше развивать свой бизнес и с дохода улучшать свои условия проживания.   
Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Yaroslav L. is single and lives in Uzhgorod, where he runs a shoe repair business. He has a good client base and a convenient location for his store. Yaroslav has been repairing shoes for only a year, but he has managed to become very accomplished in the trade. His monthly earnings are 6500 griven. 

Yaroslav would like to borrow 15000 griven in order to purchase more materials and tools for his shoe repair business. He is planning to  further expand his business and use the income to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials for work

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin believed that patience and hard work in farming would enable him reach his goals someday. He is a 54-year-old father of five and a farmer for almost 35 years now, managing a 1.5 hectare rice field in their village. 

From farming he usually earns an average net income of PHP 30,000 every harvest season (wet and dry seasons). He wants to improve his production to increase his income so he can satisfy the needs of his family and also to somehow find way of renovating their house where they could live comfortably. 

He is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay the labor cost for the uprooting and transplanting of the rice crop. He hopes to continue to make improvements on his way of farming for a better yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay the labor cost for the uprooting and transplanting of the rice crop.

loans.name: Kokou Séyram

texts.fr:
Kokou Seyram est  un homme âgée de 27 ans. Il est célibataire.
Kokou Seyram travaille comme revendeur d’habits(chemises, costumes et pantalon Jeans) depuis 2009. Il vend à ses nombreux clients dans le quartier Bé. Il achète les produits chez les grossistes qui achétent en CHINE. 
Kokou Seyram a requis son premeir  cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des chemises, des pantalons et des jeans.
texts.en:
Kokou Seyram is a 27 year old man. He is unmarried.
Kokou Seyram has been working as a clothing retailer (shirts, suits and jeans) since 2009.He sells to his numerous customers in the Bé neighbourhood. He buys his stock from   wholesalers who buy in China.
Kokou Seyram has requested his first loan from Wages in order to purchase shirts, trousers, and jeans.

loans.use: Purchase clothes.

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en:
Zamira, 39, is the leader of this group. Together with her husband, who works in a brick producing plant, she brings up three young kids. Currently she works in a field, for which she is paid 1,500 soms per workday. Zamira also owns a small piece of land, 2.8 hectares of her own, where she planted clover. She’s been cultivating the land, planting various agricultural products every season. The land was bought twelve years ago for 10,000 soms. 

Now Zamira is happy to earn 15,000 soms per month. The purpose of Zamira’s loan is to purchase tools and fuel necessary for field work. She is confident in her group mates, who are responsible and motivated entrepreneurs, and who can repay the loan on time with no violations. 

          --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and tools which are needed for field work.

loans.name: Benkadi Minanan 3 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI MINANAN 3 est un regroupement de six femmes toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
FATOUMATA AMADOU, qui est la deuxième femme au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter avec son prêt,  les semences, engrais, herbicides, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. FATOUMATA AMADOU espère réaliser un bénéfice de 90 000F CFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
Benkadi Minanan 3 is a collective of six women, who are all married in traditional families in Kafla, one of the villages of the rural township of Banco in Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (Mali's second administrative region). They are on average 46 years old with three children.
They are collaborating with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The species they cultivate include rice and groundnuts. They are on their first collaboration with the organization.
Fatoumata Amadou, who is the woman in the middle of the row of sitting women, is planning on buying with her loan seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and light equipment as well as paying for plowing and weeding expenses to maintain about 1.5 acre of groundnuts.
After the harvest, productions are sold locally in the village market as well as in markets in Banco and N’Golobougou, to a clientele composed of men and women. Fatoumata Amadou is hoping to make a profit of about 90,000 FCFA at the end of the cycle.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and light equipment.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр женат, у него есть сын-подросток Максим. Александр торгует мужской сезонной одеждой: тенниски, футболки, майки и т.д. на одном из местных рынков города Мелитополь. У Александра всегда большой выбор товара и приемлемые цены, доступные среднестатистическому покупателю. Александр начал этот бизнес еще 9 лет назад. Тогда направление в бизнесе помогли выбрать родные. На данный момент у него товара на 30 000 гривен, а прибыль составляет около 6 000 гривен в месяц. 

Александр планирует использовать кредит от КИВА на сумму 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить мужскую одежду к осеннему сезону и пополнить свой ассортимент. Александр давно мечтает сделать полноценный и качественный ремонт в своем доме. Поэтому, получив дополнительную прибыль от продаж, он хотел бы сделать ремонт в собственном доме. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Aleksandr is married and has a teenage son named Maxim. Aleksandr sells men's clothes: polo shirts, t-shirts, dress shirts etc. at the local market in the city of Melitopol. He prides himself on the large selection and low prices he is able to offer at his store, which makes his clothes affordable for the middle class consumer. Aleksandr has been working in this business for the last 9 years. He started to sell clothes after encouragement from his relatives. He has currently 30 000 griven worth of inventory and the income form his business is 6000 griven per month. 

Aleksandr is planning to use the 15 000 griven credit from KIVA to purchase men's clothing for the fall season and expand his inventory. Aleksandr has always been dreaming to do quality large scale repairs in his apartment and he is planning to use the additional income from the clothing sales to finance his dream.

loans.use: to purchase men's clothing for the coming fall season and to expand his inventory

loans.name: Enkhtur

texts.en:
Enkhtur is 42 and divorced. He lives alone in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a good driver and has been running a taxi business for 11 years.  He owns a house and a small-sized piece of land. 

He wants to install a low pressure furnace in his house.  If he can do it, his house will become warmer and more comfortable to live in. So he is taking a loan to cover the new furnace payment.

loans.use: To cover the new furnace payment of his house.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is 50 years old and lives in Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no children. To earn a living, Andres has a business of selling crabs. He earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

He has a requested loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more crabs for his crab-selling business. Andres has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, he would like to have a big income from his crab business.

loans.use: To purchase more crabs for his crab-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wrapping paper,flowers and books.

loans.name: Alamdar

texts.ru: Alamdar jenat no ne imeyet detey. On rodilsya v 1975 qodu. Alamdar yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i mamoy. Alamdar skotovodstvu nauchilsya u svoyego dyadi kotoriy toje razvodil korov. Alamdar uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i rozvodit korov. SEychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestvo skota dla razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Alamdar is married, but does not have children. He was born in 1975. Alamdar is an internally displaced person, he was relocated from the town of Fuzili and now lives in the Fuzili region together with his wife and mother. Alamdar learned about animal husbandry from his uncle who also bred cows. Alamdar has been doing animal husbandry and breeding cows for seven years already. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to increase the headcount of cattle and to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is married with eight children. Carmelita is 54 years old and lives in Mangidkid, Plaridel. She sells a variety of food to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. 

She has requested PHP 20,000 to repair their house, including the purchase of materials and payment for labor. Carmelita has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, she hopes to build a new concrete house.

loans.use: For house repair, materials and labor.

loans.name: Yevgeniy

texts.ru:
Евгений женат. У него есть сын Глеб, ему 10 лет. Он занимается реализацией нижнего белья, чулочно-носочных изделий и трикотажа на местном рынке города Мелитополя. Евгений занимается этим бизнесом уже 12 лет и, причем, достаточно продуктивно. У него есть свой реализатор. В товаре у него уже 50 000 гривен, а чистая прибыль составляет 7 000 гривен в месяц.  

Евгению нужен кредит в 20 000 гривен, чтобы приобрести сезонный товар, а именно закупить нижнее белье по оптовым ценам для последующей продажи на центральном рынке, где он торгует. Евгений хотел бы расширить свой бизнес и, по возможности, открыть еще одну точку реализации. Более того, кроме торговли на рынке, Евгений еще подрабатывает таксистом в свободное время, желая обеспечить свою семью всем необходимым и зарабатывать достаточно для этого.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Yevgeniy is married. He has a son named Gleb, he is ten years old. Yevgeniy sells underwear, socks, stockings and hosiery on the local market of the town of Melitopol. He has been in this business for almost twelve years and actually very productively. He has his own sales person. His inventory is now worth 50,000 hrivnas and clean profit is 7,000 hrivnas a month.

Yevgeniy needs a loan for 20,000 hrivnas to buy seasonal merchandise namely underwear at a wholesale price for further resale on the central market where he sells. Yevgeniy wants to expand his business and if possible to open another vendor location. Furthermore, besides selling on the market Yevgeniy also works part time as a taxi driver in his spare time because he wants to provide his family with all the necessary things and make enough money to do so.

loans.use: to buy underwear at wholesale price for further resale on the central market

loans.name: Affiwa

texts.fr:
Affiwa est une femme  âgée de 55ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 03 enfants. 
Affiwa travaille comme revendeuse de tissus coupons depuis 2005. Elle vend à ses  clients  au Grand Marché. Elle achète les produits  au Port de Lomé. 
Affiwa a requis son troisieme cycle de prêt à WAGES afin de renforcer son activité par l’achat des tissus.
texts.en:
Affiwa is 55 years old. She is married to a driver and has 3 children. 

Affiwa has been selling fabric remnants since 2005. She buys her products at the port in Lomé and sells to customers at the Grand Market.  She has requested a third loan from WAGES in order to increase her activity by buying more fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Apal's Group

texts.en:
Apal, 28, is the treasurer of this group. She resides in the town of Tokmok with her husband and a four-year-old child. Apal’s husband is employed in a local plant, while she is a nurse in a nearby hospital. Apal has pursued this sphere, because she always knew how important health is and wanted to help make changes in people’s lives. However, after the birth of her child, she realized this job couldn’t earn enough to provide for her child's living expenses. So, in cooperation with her husband, she decided to try cattle breeding. And she wasn’t mistaken. Soon Apal bought her first calves for 5 000 soms, fattened and resold them at a good deal. Now she applied for a loan from Kiva to buy some more livestock for further breeding and reselling. If she succeeds, Apal would like to start a dairy business too. 

           --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Djidiankola  Bougoula  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DJIDIANKOLA BOUGOULA  I sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et  en moyenne 6  enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  MINATA, la  troisième debout, c'est-à-dire debout au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 1 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de  100.000 F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group DJIDIANKOLA BOUGOULA I are married women who average 41 years of age and six children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Kafla, a village of the Rural Commune of Banco, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the off-season. The crops grown include rice and peanuts. The group members are on their first collaboration with the institution.

With this loan, MINATA, who is the third one standing, that is, in the middle of the photo, intends to buy farm inputs and assorted supplies and equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding to maintain about one hectare of rice and peanuts. 

After the harvests, the produce is sold locally at the village market and at the markets of Banco and N’Golobougou. The customer base is composed of women and men. MINATA plans on making a profit of 100,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and assorted supplies and equipment

loans.name: Etsé

texts.fr:
Etsé est  un homme âgée de 37 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 02 enfants.  
Etsé travaille comme revendeur de friperie et carte de recharge il ya 1an. Il vend de facon ambulante. 
Il achète les produits au Grand Marché et à Centrale Communication. 
Etsé a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de rechages et des habits.
texts.en:
Etsé is a 37-year old man. His wife is a vendor. He has two children.

Etsé has been working selling used clothing and phone cards for one year. He works as a street vendor. He buys his goods at the Big Market and  from the “Centrale Communication”  office. Etsé is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase phone cards and clothing.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and phone cards

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 28 years old and married with a child living in his own permanent house in Hoima, Uganda. The responsibility to develop the young family rests solely on him and his desire is to start up an income generating activity for his wife. He has been running a produce business for two years and faces a challenge of price fluctuations. Despite this, he longs to own a food store as the demand is overwhelming. Charles needs a loan to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans & groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en: Mr. Erdenebat is 50 years old.. He is a taxi driver in the city of Ulaanbaatar. He has a son and daughter. He has been running a taxi service since 2002 and his daily income is not enough for his life. In this year, his son Khishigbaatar is going to marry and will be living separately. So his parents want to give him a wedding gift like a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent. He will use it as a house. It’s a very important to start a new family life. Therefore, Erdenebat is taking a loan to purchase one new ger for his son’s wedding.

loans.use: To purchase one new ger for his son’s wedding gift.

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 44 years old and lives in Bontod, Larena, Siquijor.  She is widowed with 3 children. Jeana has pig raising business and earns approximately PHP 15,000 for every two months doing this type of work.  

She has requested a loan amounting to 25,000 pesos to purchase feeds and medicines for her pigs.  She has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 11 months.

Jeana hopes to make a big amount of deposit with Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Djidiankola Bougoula Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe DJIDIANKOLA BOUGOULA II sont des femmes mariées âgées en moyennes de 39 ans et en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, AÏDA, debout au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de  40.000 F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The five members of the group DJIDIANKOLA BOUGOULA II are married women who average 39 years of age and five children each. The women live in polygamous families in Kafla, a village of the Rural Commune of Banco, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the off-season. The crops grown include rice and peanuts. The group members are on their first collaboration with the institution.

With this loan, AÏDA, who is standing in the middle of the photo, intends to buy farm inputs and assorted supplies and equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding to maintain about 0.5 hectare of rice and peanuts.

After the harvests, the produce is sold locally at the village market and at the markets of Banco and N’Golobougou. The customer base is composed of women and men. AÏDA plans on making a profit of 40,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and assorted supplies and equipment

loans.name: Alymkan's Group

texts.en:
Alymkan, 50, is the treasurer of this group. She resides with her husband and two sons in Tyup, a northern lake town. The business story of this entrepreneur started seven years ago; however, she’s been a part of the farming community for quite a long period of time. Both older and younger generations of Alymkan’s family used to be respected farmers, but Alymkan was the first to turn the family activity into a successful business.

Every fall she sells all the crops she gathered, and throughout the rest of the year she sells food and agricultural products at the market. Alymkan’s achievements include the construction of a family house and the purchase of an automobile. Throughout these seven years, the business yields up to 10,000 soms per month. The start up capital is 50,000 soms. 

Alymkan plans to continue work at the retail food market until the fall season, when she’ll be able to sell her own crops. Therefore, she would like to make a wholesale purchase of garlic and currants for future retail sale. Her wish for the nearest future is to get enough revenue in order to organize a wedding ceremony for her older son. 


         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase garlic and currants for resale.

loans.name: San

texts.en: We know that farming is the one business in which it is very hard to earn enough income to support a family and be as rich as others. But Mrs. San and her husband make an effort every day to feed their children so that none die, and they have a good living standard. Both of them have been farmers since 2008. They have four children, all enrolled in school. To create a family that lives in prosperity and is as modern as others, Mrs. Horn and her husband would like to requests a loan from Kiva in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials. She hopes that she will send all of her children to study at high levels. She is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity it provides her.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loans.name: Gulu

texts.ru: Gulu ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione. Ona uje 11 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric. SEychas ona nujdayetsy v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuric dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva dlya prodaji. Gulu 54 qoda.
texts.en: Gulu is not married and does not have children. She is 54 years old. She is an internally displaced person, has been relocated from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region. She has been bird farming and breeding chickens for eleven years now. At this time she needs 2000 AZN to buy chickens to increase their headcount for resale.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr:
Adjoa est une femme  âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée å un contrôleur. Elle n’a pas d’enfants 
Adjoa travaille comme revendeuse de yaourts, de jus et du cake qu’elle fait elle même depuis 2006. 
Elle sert ses clients à domicile. Elle achète (citron, bissap, sucre arome, lait  à Lomé plus précisément au Grand Marché. Elle travaille seule.
 Adjoa a requis son troisième cycle de  crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter du citron, du bissap, du yaourt, du sucre.
texts.en: Adjoa is a 32-year-old woman who is married to a comptroller. She has no children. She works as a retailer of yoghurt, juices, and cake which she has been making herself since 2006. She serves her customers out of her home. She purchases lemons, hibiscus flowers, sugar, flavorings, and milk in Lomé, at the Grand Market, to be exact. She works alone. Adjoa has requested her third loan cycle from WAGES to buy some lemons, hibiscus flowers, yoghurt, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy sugar, lemons, and flavoring

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is 37 years old and married with 3 children. He lives in his own permanent house in Hoima, Uganda. Dan's dream is to have an income generating business with a profit of 100,000 UGX per week. 

He is a farmer and has been in practice for seventeen years now. With the profits he has been able to buy a car and also pay school fees for his children. He faces the challenge of price fluctuations. His dream is to own at least 100 acres of land for farming. 

Dan needs the loan facility to harvest soybeans and pineapples, and also to plow for the next season.

loans.use: To harvest soybeans and pineapples and to plow for the next season.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kobenkoun Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe KOBENKOUN IV sont toutes mariées, ont  une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans es familles polygames à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, FANTA, la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.000 CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group KOBENKOUN IV are all married, and they average 31 years of age and five children each. The women live in polygamous families in Kafla, a village of the Rural Commune of Banco, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the off-season. The crops grown include rice and peanuts. The group members are on their first collaboration with the institution.

With this loan, FANTA, who is the second person sitting from the left in the photo, intends to buy farm inputs and assorted supplies and equipment and to pay for plowing to maintain about 0.5 hectare of rice and peanuts.

After the harvests, the produce is sold locally at the village market and at the markets of Banco and N’Golobougou. The customer base is composed of women and men. FANTA plans on making an average profit of 65,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and assorted supplies and equipment

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama est une femme  âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée å un frigoriste. Elle a 02 enfants.  
Ama travaille comme revendeuse de biscuits et bonbons depuis 2005. Elle vend à ses clients au marché d’ADAWLATO Elle achète les produits à LOME. Elle travaille seule.
Ama a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des biscuits et des bonbons.
texts.en: Ama is 26 years old and the mother of two children. She is married to a refrigeration engineer. She has been a retailer of cookies and candies since 2005. She buys her products in Lomé and sells them to her customers at the market in Adawlato. She works alone. Ama came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy cookies and candies.

loans.use: to buy cookies and candies.

loans.name: Mashura

texts.ru:
Машура очень аккуратная и трудолюбивая девушка.  Она занимается купля продажей женской одежды и около 4 лет она в этом бизнесе. Машура хотела после окончание школы поступит в ВУЗ, но ей этого не удалось.  У нее не было возможность и достаточного капитала, чтобы поступать в ВУЗ, поэтому она начала заниматься в этом бизнесе. В дальнейшем её мечта поступить в ВУЗ и стать образованным человеком.  Машура хотела бы получит кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента женской одежды с целью расширения бизнеса и получения прибыли. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Mashura is a very neat and industrious girl. She has been working buying and selling women's clothes for about four years. Mashura wanted to go to college, but was unable to.  She did not have enough money to enroll in college, so she started this business. In the future, her dream is to go to college and become an educated person. Mashura would like to receive a loan of $3,000 to buy a greater variety of women's clothing in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children, one attends school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For the past three years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her greatest challenge is seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has four children, all of them school-ag and unemployed. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual activity in which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for her crop but she doesn’t have enough equity yet to use on her farm. So, Sok is looking for a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting. Mrs. Sok is very grateful to all lenders that support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Kobenkoun V Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres qui composent le groupe KOBENKOUN V sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, SITAN, la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of KOBENKOUN V are married women. They are on average 48 years old and have an average of 6 children each. They live in polygamous families in Kafla, one of the villages in the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative district of Mali.

They are working with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they grow are, among others, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. With the loan, Sitan, 2nd from the right, standing, plans to buy inputs, small equipment and to pay for plowing costs in order to maintain about 0.5 hectare of rice and groundnuts. After the harvest, the crops are sold at at the local market in the village and at the Banco and N'Golobougou markets to customers who are both men and women.

Sitan expects to make an average profit of 60,000 CFA francs at the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, weedkiller and small equipment.

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en:
Mr. Zoljargal, 34 and an IT engineer, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Currently he is starting a new business of potato chip making and selling in cooperation with his brother. His brother has a good experience in this business. They need to have a Grace Marks mini-van for product distribution to shops or stores. Car price is between USD4500-5500 on an average. So they need financial support to buy it. 

Starting a new business is very important to improve his family's quality of life. Zoljargal is taking out a loan to aggregate the car payment for his new business.

loans.use: To aggregate the car payment for his new business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with three children; two attend school while one is too young for school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a fruit-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She also sells vegetables, her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fruit for resale.

loans.name: Kodjo Tonton

texts.fr:
Kodjo  est un homme âgé de 45 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 02 enfants. 
Kodjo  travaille comme revendeur des chaussures, des ordinateurs des quincailleries depuis 2004. Il vend à ses clients à HEDZRANAWOE. Il achète les produits à Lomé. 
Kodjo  a requis son troisième cycle de prêt crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures femmes, des ordinateurs, des quincailleries.
texts.en: Kodjo is 45 years old and the father of two children. He is married to a retailer. He has been selling shoes, computers and hardware since 2004. He buys his products in Lomé and sells them to his customers in Hedzranawoè. Kodjo came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for his third loan to buy women's shoes, computers and hardware.

loans.use: to buy hardware and shoes.

loans.name: 10 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa operates a food stall selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Hoa is 44 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 10 Đông Vệ solidarity group. Hoa lives with her two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In future, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Kobenkoun Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe KOBENKOUN VI sont des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 32 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et  vivent dans des familles polygames à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  M’PENECOURA, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55.000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the KOBENKOUN VI solidarity group are married women who average 32 years of age and four children each. They live in polygamous families in Kafla, a village in the rural town of Banco in the Dioïla prefecture, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali).

They have partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. Their crops include rice and groundnuts. This is their first time collaborating with the MFI.

With this loan, M'PENECOURA, standing first from the left, plans to purchase inputs and small farming equipment, and pay for the plowing and weeding required to maintain about 0.5 hectares of rice and groundnuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold at the local market and the markets of Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele consisting of both men and women. She expects to earn an average profit of about 55,000 FCFA per season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicide and small equipment, and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a "mahamri" (dumplings) selling business, selling from home to local residents. She faces a major challenge of fluctuation in prices of commodities. Her major dream is to be able to expand her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality, especially in her business. She dreams of expanding her clothes business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Javkhlantugs

texts.en:
Mr. Javkhlantugs is 33 years old and lives with his mother and daughter (3) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a taxi business since 2006. His wife works and lives in Korea and she makes phone calls to her family occasionally.  

Recently, Javkhlantugs's car is becoming old and dangerous to use for taxi service. It’s absolutely related to his or his clients' vitality. So he has a real need to change his car for a better one immediately. Therefore he is taking  a loan to aggregate the payment of new car and continue his taxi business.

loans.use: To aggregate the payment of new car and continue his taxi business.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo lives in Uganda. She is widowed with five children and three of her children go to school. She has no additional family members to support. She has a business of selling local gin and brew. She sells her products on a wholesale basis. She has been in business for the last seven years. 

Teo works seven days a week. Teo's goal and aspirations are to educate her children and build her own bar.
