She has requested a loan of 800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin and brew. Her major business challenges are defaulters and thieves. She lives in  a rented   house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses are rent, food, medication and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all go to school. She has no additional family members to support. 

Saidat  is a tailor. She sells her clothes on a wholesale basis in a shop. She has been in business for many  years. Saidat works seven days a week. She has no other additional source of income. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials. Her major challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her aspiration is to build her own shop where her customers can find her to buy clothes. She lives in  a rented  house and has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include power, food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials.

loans.name: Zacheus

texts.en:
Zacheus has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years.  He is 34 years old, married to Eunice, and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Zacheus hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Heremakono I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe HEREMAKONO I sont de femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 44 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Nogonlon, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, FATOUMATA, la deuxième assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0, 75 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the HEREMAKONO I group are married women who have an average age of 44 and on average five children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Nogonlon, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this first loan, FATOUMATA, seated second from the right, intends to buy farm inputs and small equipment, and pay the fees for plowing and weeding to maintain 0.75 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

The crops are sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. Fatoumata expects to make an average profit of 70,000 F CFA at the end of the crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, farm inputs and small equipment.

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Mrs. Try is a 43-year-old farmer who lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Charm Province. Try is married to Sophorn, age 50. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have four children: two of the children are garment factory workers in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. and the other two children are school-aged. In view of the rainy season and as  she lacks money for doing farming, Try has decided to request a loan from Kiva. Try will use these funds to buy seeds, fertilizer and other materials. She said that she is very grateful to all lenders for supporting her business in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated an open-air food business, selling to local residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; during peak season the demand is higher. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat, and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of its loan products.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat, and charcoal.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a divorced woman with one child who already graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality. During the rainy season, the availability of charcoal is low compared to demand. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Parkimaso

texts.en:
Parkimaso, 46 years old, is married with four children. He has been a mixed farmer for fifteen years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client. This is his third loan with which he has planned to purchase farm inputs, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. He intends to use the return from the loan to plough back into farming and part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Heremakono Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe HEREMAKONO II sont de femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Nogonlon, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, SALIMATA, la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the HEREMAKONO II group are married women who have an average age of 37, three children, and live in polygamous families in Nogonlon, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this first loan, SALIMATA, standing second from the left, intends to buy farm inputs and small equipment and pay for plowing and weeding to maintain 0.25 hectares of peanuts. 

The crops are sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. Salimata expects to make an average profit of 20,000 F CFA at the end of the crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has five children. They are all enrolled in  school. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. 

The coming rainfall is good for her crop. However, Chan doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So Chan is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting. Mrs. Chan is very grateful to all lenders that support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Heremakono Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe HEREMAKONO III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nogonlon, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, FANTA, la deuxième debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55 000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the HEREMAKONO III group are married women who have an average age of 27 and on average three children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Nogonlon, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this first loan, FANTA, standing second from the right, intends to buy farm inputs and small equipment, and pay the fees for plowing and weeding to maintain 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

The crops are sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. Fanta expects to make an average profit of 55,000 F CFA at the end of the crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: Seak

texts.en:
Mrs. Seak has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has four children. They are all enrolled in  school. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. 

Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for her crop. However, Seak doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So Seak is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting. Mrs. Seak is very grateful to all lenders that support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for farming business.

loans.name: Heremakono  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe HEREMAKONO IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Nogonlon, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, AWA, la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80 000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the “Heremakono IV” group are all married women averaging 31 years of age with three children. They live mainly in polygamous families in Nogonlon, a village in the rural community of Banco, Doila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the 2nd administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their activities at the beginning of the winter season. They cultivate rice and peanuts [ground nuts], among others. They are on their first collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan, Awa, the first person standing on the right, plans to purchase farm inputs [such as fertilizers] and small tools as well as pay the costs of labor and weeding to maintain 0.5 ha [about 1.25 acres] of rice. 

After harvesting, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 80,000 West African francs at the end of the agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of labor, seeds, fertilizers, herbicide, weeding and small tools

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in  Uganda .She is widowed with eight children and one child goes to school. She rears poultry to sell retail. She has been in business for the last ten years. She sells her chicken from home. 

Margaret works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed and also to complete another chicken house. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and also to have 3000 laying birds. 

Margaret lives in her own house with her family and has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food, power and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Heremakono V Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe HEREMAKONO V sont  toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent  toutes dans des familles polygames à Nogonlon, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MAMINE, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65 000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The seven women of the HEREMAKONO V group are all married with an average age of 30 and on average three children. They all live in polygamous families in Nogonlon, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this first loan, MAMINE, standing first on the left, intends to buy farm inputs and small equipment, and pay the fees for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

The crops are sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. Mamine expects to make an average profit of 65,000 F CFA at the end of the crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment.

loans.name: Ulanbek's Group

texts.en:
Ulanbek, 23, is a member of this group. He is single and works as an inspector in a local military institution. When Ulan has free time from work he tries to find new ways to earn additional income. Two years ago, following his father’s advice, he bought livestock for 3000 soms. Since then he almost doubled the size of his herd and receives 3000 soms per month. 

Now Ulan says he’s quite experienced in livestock breeding and can avoid many mistakes that he has made in the past. Thanks to his friend’s advice he found out about the Kiva project, which provides loans through MFI “Mol Bulak Finance”. With no hesitation Ulan gathered a group and applied for a loan in order to buy some more livestock. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Bolorkhorloo

texts.en:
Bolorkhorloo is a young hard-working woman who lives with her husband and children in the outer 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both of her children, aged 3 and 5, attend local kindergarten while her husband works as a tractor-trailer driver at a local company. 

After working as a saleswoman for five years, she decided to start her own business in an indoor market called Tumen Plaza. She mostly sells women’s clothing imported from Beijing, China. As the market is located in a very busy shopping area, her business makes outstanding revenue. 

Bolorkhorloo is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to import more clothes for the upcoming season since the new school year is starting which is a high shopping season. She is a responsible client of our institute who repaid her previous loans successfully and on time. Bolor is working hard to improve her family’s living standards so her children can enjoy a safe and good quality of life as they grow.

loans.use: to import more clothes for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Gulbika

texts.ru: Gulbika zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Yey 57 let. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenenc iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim mujem i dochkoy. Ona uje 14 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov, seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Gulbika is married with three children.  She is 57 years old.  She  is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her husband and daughter.  She has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for fourteen years.  Now she needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle to increase her milk production.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Kahunda

texts.en:
Kahunda is a married woman with five children; four attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Bayarsaikhan, age 41, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She operates a clothing retail stall at a local market and has made great progress in one year and half. 

She has fifteen years of experience in the clothing retail business as she used to operate a retail stall at the largest outdoor market of Mongolia, Narantuul until 2007. Bayarsaikhan started her current business after working in Korea for three years. She usually sells clothes imported from Beijing or Ereen, a border city in China.

She has children aged 18 and 13 who attend local schools and a 22-year-old son who works as a machinist at a local company. Her husband operates a small business in the town as well. 

Bayarsaikhan is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase more clothes for the upcoming season. She is a responsible and very neat person who intent on improving her family’s living standards and helping her children to become highly educated people in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary  lives in  Uganda. She is married with three children and all go to school. Mary has a drug shop. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for over 10 years. 

Mary works seven days a week. She generates additional income through poultry farming. Her major business challenges are transportation and defaulters. Her aspiration is to build her own clinic and also to own a fully stocked drug shop. 

Mary has requested a loan of 2,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more  boxes of drugs, beds, and dressing tables. Mary lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly  expenses are  rent for the clinic, school fees, and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of drugs, beds, dressing tables and pay rent for her business.

loans.name: Assion

texts.fr:
Assion est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée  å un contrôleur. Elle n’a pas d’  enfants. 
Assion  travaille comme coiffeuse –esthéticienne  depuis 2007. Elle exerce son activité dans son salon. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Assion  a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches et des produits de soins d’esthétique. Elle veut pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. 
Dans les prochaines années, Assion  voudrait avoir un 2° atelier de coiffure esthétique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Assion is 29 years old and has no children. She is married to a controller. She has been a hairdresser and beautician since 2007 and works in her own salon. She buys her products in Lomé. Assion came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy hair extensions and beauty care products. She wants to be able to provide for her family.

In a few years Assion wants to open a second salon for cosmetic hairdressing. She says that she expects to improve the living standard of her family thanks to her higher income.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Зулфия умная и честная женщина.  Она замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Зулфия занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, такие как картошка, морковь, и фрукты. Кроме этого занимается скотоводством. Зулфия хочет, чтобы её дети выросли в хороших условиях семьи и стали образованными и культурными людьми. Зулфия хотела бы получит кредит в размере 2000$ США для покупки крупного рогатого скота, которое позволяет ей расширить свой бизнес и получить желаемой прибыли. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Zulfiya is an intelligent and honest woman. She is married and a loving mother to three children. Zulfiya grows crops such as potatoes, carrots, and fruit. In addition, she works in animal husbandry. Zulfiya wants her children to grow up in a good family situation and to become educated and cultured people. Zulfiya would like to receive a loan for $2,000 to buy cattle, which would allow her to expand her business and make a profit.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Tserenchimeg

texts.en:
Tserenchimeg, age 37, runs a clothing retail business at a local market in Ulaanbaatar. She has three years of work experience in the hospitality industry; however, she decided to start her own business in 2005 and has made much progress since then. She usually sells women’s clothing imported from China, and this loan will help her to increase her product variety.

She and her husband have two small children, ages three and four. The family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband works at MCS Properties Co., Ltd., so her father babysits their children during the day.

Tserenchimeg is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to import more clothes for fall, which is a very high shopping season. She is planning to expand her business by increasing her product variety, which she is confident will help her business’s sales to increase.

loans.use: to import more clothes for the fall shopping season

loans.name: Kobenkoun I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe KOBENKOUN I sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont essentiellement le riz, le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, NIEDIE , la première assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000F CFA environs  en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the KOBENKOUN I group are married women who have an average age of 39 and on average five children. They mostly live in traditional families in Kafla, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are essentially rice, millet, and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this first loan, NIEDIE, seated, first on the right, intends to buy farm inputs and small equipment, and pay the fees for plowing and weeding to maintain 0.5 hectares of rice. 

The crops are sold at the village market, the Banco market and the N’Golobougou market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. Niedie expects to make an average profit of 60,000 F CFA at the end of the crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima has operated a clothes selling business for the past six years, selling from home and at the market to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

She and her husband have four children: three attend school and one has graduated. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. The greatest monthly expenses for the family are food and school fees.

With the Kshs 100,000 loan, she wants to purchase a motorcycle to start a boda boda (motorcycle transportation) business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to start a boda boda (motorcycle transportation) business

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Ami est une femme  âgée de 37ans. Elle est mariée å un maçon. Elle a 06 enfants. 
Ami travaille comme revendeuse de céréales (mais, mil, sorgho) depuis 1994. Elle vend à toutes personnes à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Kpalimé et au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Ami a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales.
texts.en: Ami is 37 years old and the mother of six children. She is married to a bricklayer. She has been a retailer of cereals (corn, millet, sorghum) since 1994. She buys her products in Kpalimé and at the great market in Lomé. She sells to individual customers out of her home. Ami came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her third loan to buy cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Kobenkoun Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOBENKOUN II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, DJENEBOU, la personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.000F CFA en en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the KOBENKOUN II group are married women who have an average age of 35 and on average six children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Kafla, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this first loan, DJENEBOU, in the middle of the standing row, intends to buy farm inputs and small equipment, and pay the fees for plowing and weeding to maintain 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts.

The crops are sold at the village market, at the Banco market, and at the N’Golobougou market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. Djenebou expects to make an average profit of 65,000 F CFA at the end of the crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: Nassim

texts.en:
Nassim runs a natural juice making business, selling to her neighbors and passers-by. She has been engaged in her business for the past year. She faces the major challenge of water rationing, which leads to an inadequate supply of water for her customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Nassim and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. The family's greatest monthly expense is school fees.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to pay for water installation so that she can start another business of selling water. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay for water installation so that she can start another business of selling water

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en:
Purevjav, age 25, operates a cell-phone and cell-phone parts sales business out of a rented stall in the local trade center in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He started his business in 2008 and has made much progress with his endeavor. 

Purevjav lives with his wife and their two-year-old baby daughter in Ulaanbaatar. He graduated from the Agricultural University of Mongolia in 2007, with a Bachelor's degree in Plant Quarantine Inspection. His wife works as a broker dealer at Asian Pacific Securities Co., Ltd., so Purevjav's younger sister babysits their daughter during the day. Purevjav is a young man who is striving to make a great success in his life and live happily with his family.

He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan in order to purchase more mobile phones and spare parts. His intention is to increase sales and increase his working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more mobile phones and spare parts

loans.name: Kobenkoun Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes qui constituent le groupe KOBENKOUN III sont mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, WOROKIA, la deuxième assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45 000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten women that make up the KOBENKOUN III group are all married, with an average age of 40 and an average of five children each. They live, for the most part, in polygamous families in Kafla, one of the villages in the rural commune of Banco in Dioïla prefecture of Mali's second administrative region, Koulikoro. 

They are working together with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better organize their activities ahead of the rainy season. Crops grown include rice and peanuts, among others. This is their first collaboration with the institution. With this loan, Worokia, the woman seated second from the right, plans to purchase fertilizer, seed, and light equipment as well as to pay labor and weeding costs for maintaining around .5 hectares of rice. 

The products are sold on site at the village market, and at the markets of Banco and N'Golobougou, whose customers consist of both men and women after the harvest. She intends to make an average profit of 45,000 CFA by the end of the season.

loans.use: to cover costs for labor, tillage, seed, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and light equipment

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty owns and operates a retail shop. She has been engaged in her business for the last six years. She sells her products from a rented space on a retail basis. Betty works seven days a week. She gains additional income from offering rental houses. 

Betty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 from MCDT SACCO in order to buy more jerycans of cooking oil, bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and bags of maize flour. Her goals and aspirations are to own a wholesale shop and also to provide her children with an education up to university level. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. 

Betty and her husband have four children, all enrolled in school. She also takes care of one additional family member. They own their own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Their primary monthly expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more jerycans of cooking oil, bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and bags of maize flour

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.ru: Eldaniz yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenenc iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. On ne jenat i ne iemyet detey. Eldaniz 23 qoda. On uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Eldaniz is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his parents.  He is single and has no children.  Eldaniz is 23 years old.  He has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for two years.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle to increase his herd so that he can sell them.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan, age 30, is a beekeeper. He has 30 bee-hives with live bee colonies. He gathers honey twice a year and sells it locally. Ruslan also grows tangerines on one-third hectares of land and sells them locally. Along with the above-mentioned business endeavors, he has a milk cow and sells cheese to local dairy product retailers. 

Ruslan is from the village of Sakhalvasho on the coast of Georgia. He is unmarried and lives with his parents. Both of the parents have health problems and receive pensions from the government. 

Ruslan plans to initiate a tourist business with the funds from the requested loan. He lives on the seaside, which is a famous tourist zone in the country. Ruslan will renovate the rooms on the second floor of his house and rent them out to tourists. This new business initiative will significantly increase the income of the family and allow them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the rooms on the second floor of his house and rent them out to tourists

loans.name: Meggy

texts.en:
Meggy operates a vegetable stall business. She has been engaged in her business for the past two years, selling her wares from a shop to her neighbors and passers-by. Her major challenge is seasonality in the business. Meggy dreams of expanding her business in the future.
 
Meggy is a single woman with one child who attends school. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to start a potato selling business by purchasing sacks of potatoes to offer for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to start a potato selling business by purchasing sacks of potatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli, age 60, is from the village of Erge in the Adjara region. She runs the family's agricultural business, assisted by her sons. They grow citrus fruits and various other fruits on 1.5 hectares of family-owned land. They also grow greens. They harvested their produce and sell it at the local open market. 
 
Nanuli and her husband Otar have two sons, ages 24 and 26. Otar has health problems and receives a pension from the government. 

Nanuli has requested this loan in order to purchase a milk cow. She will produce cheese and sell it at the same market where she sells her fruits and greens. Initiating a dairy business will increase the income of the family. Nanuli intends to provide better care for the family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy "pagnes" (pieces of highly decorative West African fabric)

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past one year, she has operated a beauty salon. Her potential customers are the local residents. She faces a major challenge of fluctuation in commodities. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase hair chemicals, weaves, braids, shampoo and conditioner. She decided to Join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair chemicals, weaves, braids, shampoo and conditioner.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye est un homme marié de 29 et père de 2 enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle élargie à Hérémakono Nord, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Abdoulaye est un enseignant  qui en plus de cette fonction, excelle dans les activités génératrices de revenus. Depuis maintenant plus de 6 ans, il fait de l’achat et de la vente des céréales. Il appris cette activité auprès d’un de ses amis enseignants. 
Afin  d’augmenter sa capacité financière, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et est à sa première expérience avec l’institution.
 Il compte utiliser ce premier prêt pour acheter, 1 tonne de maïs, 1 tonne de petit mil et 10 sacs de riz.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages  environnants auprès des paysans producteurs.  Il effectue sa vente au grand marché de Bougouni et une partie est vendue à la maison, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA, qui servira à rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is a 29-year old married man, who is father to two children. He lives with his wife and children in an extended traditional family in Hérémakono Nord, a district of the town of Bougouni (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region).

Abdoulaye is a teacher, who as well as having a teaching job, excels in other income generating activities. For more than six years he has been buying and selling cereals and he learnt this business from one of his teaching colleagues.

In order to boost his financial capacity he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and is on his first loan from the institution. He is planning to use this first loan to buy a ton of corn, a ton of pearl millet and ten sacks of rice. He gets his supplies in Bougouni and in the surrounding villages from the peasants that are are growing the cereals. He sells his produce at the large market in Bougouni and part of it is sold at his home to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers. 

With this loan he is expecting to make a monthly profit of 75,000FCFA, which will be used to repay his loan and provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 31 years old and married to Jerop.

He has a call center that is used to transact money on phones locally known as "MPESA". He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to buy airtime and printer paper to add to his stock.

Andrew hopes to expand his business and open up a cyber cafe. He also plans to buy land and build a family house.

loans.use: To buy airtime and printer paper to add to his stock.

loans.name: Tumu

texts.en:
Tumu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For over 10 years, she has operated a cosmetics business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells handbags and clothes, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation and price fluctuation of commodities in her business. 

With the KSHS 80,000, she wants to start a cereals business. She will purchase sacks of beans, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, maize flour and wheat flour to start a cereals business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a single woman with five children, two boys and three girls. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of purchasing a plot to establish her own house in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of onions, ginger and green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of onions, ginger and green vegetables.

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru:
Тохир женатый мужчина и он зарабатывает на жизнь куплей продажи продуктов питания в собственном магазине. Тохир занимается этим бизнесом уже 8 лет. Ему нравится заниматься этим видом бизнеса. Его низкие цены, большой ассортимент товаров, и высокий уровень обслуживания клиентов позволяет ему увеличить свою клиентуру. У Тохира много постоянных клиентов, которые часто делают покупку у него в магазине. Тохир просит займ в размере $2000 США для расширения ассортимента своих продаваемых товаров. Он надеется, что данный займ позволить ему увеличить свои продажи и сделать дополнительный доход  и таким образом улучшить уровень жизни.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Tohir is a married man who makes his living buying and selling food in his own shop. Tohir has been in business for eight years. He likes this work. His low prices, wide product range, and excellent customer service allows him to attract new customers. Tohir has many regular customers who often shop at his store. Tohir is asking for a loan of $2,000 to increase the variety of his inventory.  He hopes that this loan will allow him to increase his sales and make additional income and therefore improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy food and increase the variety of goods available in his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle with the goal of expanding his business

loans.name: Mahmadkhuja

texts.ru:
Махмадхужа целеустремленный и честный человек.   Он любящий муж и отец 2 детей. Махмадхужа занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур более 4 лет и у него богатый опыт по данному бизнесу. Весной он сеет семена картошки, лука и морковь, а затем продает их, когда они вырастут. Его жена, дети и невестка помогает ему на переработки земли, и они дружно вместе работают.  Махмадхужа хотел бы получит кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки семена, минеральных удобрений и горюче смазочные материалы. Он заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за их поддержку и поощрение.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Mahmadkhuja is a goal-oriented and honest person. He is a loving husband and the father of two children. Mahmadkhuja has been growing produce for over four years, and has a lot of experience in this area. In the spring he plants potatoes, onions and carrots, and later harvest and sells them. His wife, children and daughter-in-law help him work the land. They work well as a team. Mahmadkhuja would like to obtain a loan of $3000 to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers as well as fuel and engine oil. He thanks all lenders in advance for their support and encouragement. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.
