Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and engine oil

loans.name: Lucian

texts.en:
Lucian is a married woman with one girl who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity bills and water bills. 

For the past five years, she has operated a water-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she operates a tailoring business, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other tailoring operators in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing her own retail shop in the future.

With the KSHS 80,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and expand her water-selling stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and expand her water-selling stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock to start a store to sell general items such as clothes, electronics, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase coop, fodder and medicines, etc. for a new pountry farm

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 35-year-old man. He is married and has four sons and four daughters. He lives in Ya'bad village near Jenin city in Palestine. Amer is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets a decent salary. Amer and his wife work in the project they have, which is farming in greenhouses, but this project is suffering from the lack of supplies that are necessary. Amer wants to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN, because the decent salary he gets isn't enough to pay in cash.

When Amer gets FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase all necessary supplies and use them to improve his project and increase the productivity of his greenhouse agriculture. Amer is photographed inside the greenhouse.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his grreenhouses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beauty and hair products for the summer season.

loans.name: Salaheddin

texts.en: Salaheddin is a 24-year-old young man. He is married and lives in Ramallah city located in Palestine. Salaheddin has an internet cafe and he wants to increase the number of computers because of the increasing numbers of visitors using the current computers. Salaheddin has an amount of money that isn't enough to pay for the computers, so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Salaheddin takes the FATEN loan that is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to increase the number of computers and more customers will visit the internet cafe to enjoy the service. In this way, Salaheddin will improve his income and have better work and life conditions. Salaheddin is photographed in his internet cafe.

loans.use: To purchase more computers for his internet cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a new vehicle repair kit

loans.name: Otgon

texts.en:
Otgon is 39 years old and lives with her mother, husband, and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house in the outer district of the city. Her older daughter attends primary school. Her younger daughter is 3 years old and stays at home with Otgon's mother.

She started a retail clothing business in 1996, selling handmade custom jackets. Since 2000, she has been selling clothing imported from China, as well as her handmade clothes. Her business is located in a rented stall in Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. Since she started her business, she has expanded so that she is now operating two stalls at the market, also selling underclothing, hats, etc. Otgon is now running her business with 5,700,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) of working capital and planning to expand her business by establishing her own tailoring boutique.

She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for the fall/autumn season. She is an accomplished entrepreneur who is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for the fall/autumn season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her secondary business.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling shoes for four years. She started her business with 1,500,000 UGX of capital earned from farm products. Now her working capital is 4,000,000 UGX. Her vision is to diversify her business by also selling clothes and educating children. Jolly intends to use this loan to buy shoes to resell.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional school uniforms.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
Назокат умная, добросовестная и целеустремленная  женщина.  Она разведенная женщина и сама одна кормит своих детей.   Она хочет, чтобы её дети выросли в хороших условиях жизни и не почувствовали бедности. По этой цели она начала заниматься купля продажей детской одежды более 3 лет. Назокат хотела бы получит кредит в размере 2000$ США для покупки новой детской одежды для расширения бизнеса. Она заранее благодарит Кива и Кива кредиторы за их поддержку и милосердия. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Nazokat is a smart, honest and goal-oriented woman.  She is divorced and is supporting her children on her own.  She wants her children to grow up in good conditions and not know poverty.  This is why she became involved in buying and selling children's clothing over three years ago.  Nazokat wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of new children's clothing in order to expand her business.  She is grateful to Kiva and Kiva creditors for their support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 30-year-old, hardworking man that owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after his parents and siblings, and his goal is to make sure that the young ones in his family are educated.

He has been selling sodas and beers for seven years. With the income he generates from this business, he has been able to support his family and to build a house. His business challenges are high transportation costs and price fluctuations. Despite these challenges, he dreams of having a wholesale depot. George is seeking this loan to buy sodas and beers for re-sale purposes.

loans.use: To purchase additional sodas and beers.

loans.name: Juvenaray

texts.en:
Juvenaray is a farmer in the Nkubu area of central Kenya, where he has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years. His farm produces bananas and milk, which he sells at the local market. Juvenaray says that poor infrastructure and low market prices for his farm's produce are his greatest business challenges.

Juvenaray is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his banana plantation. Specifically, he would like to employ additional farmhands to till the farm and to weed once the crops start maturing. He says this enable him to have greater output, which will in turn allow him to improve his family's living standards and his children's education.

loans.use: To expand his farming operations by employing additional farmhands.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old and married to Moses. They are blessed with two children aged seven years old and two years old. She has been selling tomatoes for the last year, making a profit of KES 16,820. She has been loaned KES 50,000, which she plans to use to buy more stock of tomatoes to sell.

With the anticipated profit, she would like to improve the living standard of her family. In the near future, she hopes to expand her business and therefore, improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 34-year-old married man. He runs an electronics shop. His business has been in operation for the last six years and it has been a success. This is his first loan from KADET to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase solar panels and batteries for his business. 

The anticipated profit will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful sole proprietor.

loans.use: to purchase solar panels and batteries

loans.name: Rongai

texts.en:
Rongai is a 46-year-old married mother of four children. She raises chickens. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She has been a KADET client and this is her third loan to finance her business. 

With this loan, she plans to purchase more chicks for her business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to venture into the transport business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks

loans.name: Bayandelger

texts.en:
Bayandelger is a 29-year-old man who operates a clothing-retail stall at a local market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Aside from his business at the market, he works as an excavator specialist at Hera Investment Co., Ltd, a company that supplies heavy machinery and equipment.

As Bayandelger is often called out of town, his wife runs the business. They sell women’s clothing imported from Beijing, China. Bayandelger is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase more clothing for this fall.

Bayandelger has been saving earnings from the business with the intention of moving into an apartment in the future and improving his and his wife's standard of living. He repaid his previous loan from Transcapital Company Ltd. successfully and on time and hopes to use this opportunity to develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for fall

loans.name: Budumbuli Women's Group

texts.en:
Aisha is 32 years old and a happily married mother of four. She participated in apprentice tailoring training before she conceived the idea of starting her own tailoring enterprise. She sews and sells most of the clothes she makes and plies her business in Jinja. She was previously engaged in small-scale farming.

Aisha has had her business for 6 years now, and her weekly sales revenue is to the tune of 120,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX). She intends to use her Kiva loan to purchase an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
Dorina is a married woman with six children, three boys and three girls. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for electricity, water, and clothing.

For the past eight years, Dorina has operated a poultry business, selling from her home to restaurant operators and her neighbors. She faces two major challenges: seasonality and competition from other poultry operators. She dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the loan she has requested of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase chicken feed and poultry medicine and expand her chicken house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed and poultry medicine and expand her chicken house.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 53-year-old single mother who runs a cafe. Her business has been in operation for the last ten years. She has been a KADET client before--this is her second loan to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase potatoes, onions, tomatoes, rice, and flour. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand her business further. Janet's dream is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: purchase potatoes, onions, tomatoes, rice, and flour

loans.name: Fenton

texts.en:
Fenton is 32 years old and married. He is a motorcycle operator and also owns a fuel business. Both businesses have been in operation for one year. This is his second loan from KADET to finance his businesses.

Fenton plans to use the loan to purchase more fuel for his fuel business. The anticipated profit will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful sole proprietor.

loans.use: purchase more fuel for his fuel business

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Uganda. She is single with 4 children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Hadjah has a business selling clothes (African attire). She has been in business for the last 15 years and works 6 days a week. She sells her products at the market and to neighbors. She has requested  for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more pieces of African attire.

Hadjah’s aspirations are to educate her children up to university, to start importing African attire from the Democratic Republic of the Congo, and to build rental houses. She lives in a rented house and has access to piped water and electricity. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the ever-increasing price of clothes, which affects her sales. Her monthly expenses include rent, food, and electricity.

loans.use: to buy more pieces of clothing (African attire)

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in Uganda. She is single with 3 children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She sells bananas and has been in business for the last 10 years. She sells her bananas at the market and works seven days a week.

Irene has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas and set up a better stall for her products. Aside from her banana business, Irene generates additional income as a part-time teacher at a nearby school. The main business challenges she faces are transportation and seasonality.

Irene lives in a rented house and has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas and to set up a better stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more products such as beans, peas, and coffee for resale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 58-year-old single mother of eight children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Ever since she separated from her husband 20 years ago, she has been solely taking care of her family.  She is glad to have educated her children and now the last-born is in senior four. She earns a living from sewing sweaters, a business she has been doing for seven years now and her dream is to have at least three outlets in town. Margret needs the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 42 years old and married to Ziporah. He has been operating his rental houses business for the past 11 months, making a monthly profit of KES 20,000. He has been loaned KES 12,000, which he plans to use to renovate the rental houses.

With the anticipated profits, he plans to buy another plot and built more rental houses. In the near future, he hopes to own more than five flats.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 32-year-old married man with four children living in his permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He earns his living from rental houses and a retail shop he has operated for seven years. The major hardship faced is the constant price increases of products, thus affecting customers' demand power and his desire is to own a wholesale shop. William needs the loan to buy salt, rice and sugar for resale.

loans.use: To buy salt, rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a hardworking and hopeful 29-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children, one of whom is in school. For the last eight months, he has been selling omena (small dried fish) so as to make ends meet. He makes extra shillings by selling firewood and cereals. Previously, he was employed. He wants, in the next five years, to have expanded his business and employ other people. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a refrigerator to store omena (small dried fish).

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Zaverio

texts.en: Zaverio is 67 years old and is married with five children. He lives in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to build a permanent house for his family and educate his children. For fifteen years, he has been growing onions amidst the challenges of price fluctuations. He seeks to diversify his business to grow sweet potatoes so as to target the school and prison markets. Zaverio needs the loan to grow sweet potatoes.

loans.use: To clear land to grow sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is a hardworking 27-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with one-year-old twins. She has been selling electronics and phone accessories for the last three years to make a living. She wants in the next five years to have several branches in the city centre and for her business to be successful and self-sustaining. Her dream is to be a well-established business lady. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy phones and accessories. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to learn business management skills.

loans.use: To buy phones and accessories

loans.name: Massiel Narobia

texts.es: Massiel Narobia tiene 27 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa nueva. hace mas de 6 años que tiene este negocio, ella vende de contado y al credito. sus compras las realiza en managua en donde le resulta mucho mas favorable la compra de sus productos. la mayoria de sus clientes lo que mas le solicitan es pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes. ella siempre ha sido muy responsable con su actividad economica ya que siempre esta pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. es por eso que solicita este credito para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en: Massiel Narobia is 27 years old and earns her living by selling new clothes.  She has been in this business for more than six years.  Massiel sells for cash and on credit.  Her purchases are made in Managua, where the prices are more favorable when she buys her products.  The majority of her customers often request trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, and suits.  Massiel has always been very responsible with her financial activity and is always aware of what her customers request.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, and suits.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a determined businessman who was born in 1966. He is married and blessed with three children who are going to school. Since the year 1996, he has been running a general shop to meet the needs of his family. He wants in the next five years to diversify into other businesses. His dream is to own a supermarket. He is requesting a loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 45 years old and married with five children living in their own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to set up an income-generating activity to ably look after his family. He has been working in a tea factory for 10 years and in order to complement his salary, he became an outgrower. He started with an acre of tea but he now has 10 acres and his dream is to become an independent tea grower with the ability to supply other tea companies. Wilson needs the loan to pay the tea pluckers.

loans.use: To pay the tea pluckers.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is a hardworking and determined 34-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two school-going children aged seven and five years old. He has been operating a garage for the last nine years to provide for his family. He wants in the next five years to have expanded his business. He is requesting for a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy spare parts for repairing vehicles that come to his garage. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now financially literate.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair vehicles that come to his garage

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: La señora Alejandra se de dedica a  la venta de leche al por mayor a la empresa PIL y su esposo la ayuda con trabajos de agricultura. El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada, para así poder aumentar la cantidad de leche a ser vendida y mejorar sus ingresos. La familia vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Laja del departamento de La Paz; Alejandra es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2009 y presenta un historial de pagos excelente.
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandra sells milk in bulk to the PIL dairy plant. Her husband helps with the farm work. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a dairy cow of improved breed. This will help her increase the amount of milk that she can sell and improve her income. Her family lives in their own home in the town of Laja in the Department of La Paz. Alejandra is married and has five children.

She has been a client of IMPRO since 2009 and presents an excellent payment history.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is a hardworking 34-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with a three-year-old child who is going to school. To make ends meet, he has been operating a pharmacy. He wants in the next five years to be financially stable and his business stabilized. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy medicine. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now financially literate.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Batkhurel

texts.en:
Batkhurel is a 37-year-old married man and a father of four children. His family lives in a small house in the outer district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a driving instructor at a driving school, while his wife, Tamriin-Tsetseg, works as a business adviser at a local company. 

Their sons, aged 10, 12, and 17, attend public schools while the youngest 2-year-old daughter stays home with her grandmother. 

Batkhurel has decided to extend his small house by two square meters. With the intention of making his house bigger, he is requesting a 2,700,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to buy the necessary construction materials to finish the housing project.

Batkhurel wants to live with his family in a comfortable and safe house, where his children can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials needed for a house extension project.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in Uganda. She is single and has seven children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her brother's children).  Florence has a business selling cereals. She has been in this business for four years and she works seven days out of every week. Florence sells her products in a shop at retail and at wholesale. Florence has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of beans, groundnuts and maize. She generates additional income through her retail shop. The main business challenge(s) for Florence include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to sell at wholesale only. Florence lives in a home that she own. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans, groundnuts and maize

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a determined businessman who was born in 1970. He is married and blessed with three children who are going to school. Since the year 2000, he has been operating a welding shop to make a living. He wants in the next five years to open up several outlets of his business and to invest in other businesses. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy metal.

loans.use: To buy metal

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Catherine has a business selling yellow bananas (Cavendish).  She has been in this business for five years and she works six days out of every week. Catherine sells her products from home at retail and wholesale. Catherine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through houses for rent. The main business challenge(s) for Catherine include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing tomatoes and to own a delivery van. Catherine lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria es productora lechera; su producto lo vende directamente a la  empresa industrializadora  de leche PIL. Victoria   también se dedica al cultivo de la tierra y su esposo ayuda con  trabajos de agricultura a otras familias del pueblo donde viven. El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de una vaca lechera; así podra aumentar la capacidad de producción y por ende sus ingresos. Victoria y su esposo viven en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Laja del  departamento de La Paz y tienen tres hijos. Esta es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y por el carácter social del mismo se lo canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria is a milk producer. Her product is sold directly to the PIL dairy plant. Victoria also cultivates her land. Her husband performs farm work for other families in the town where they live. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a dairy cow. This will increase her production capacity and eventually her income. Victoria and her husband live in their own home in the town of Laja in the Department of La Paz. They have three children.

This is the first time she has obtained a loan from IMPRO. Her character references qualify her to receive the funds through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, maize flour, spices and sugar

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos es empleado en el Hospital La Merced de la ciudad de La Paz encargado de cotizaciones. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá mucho para acceder a información médica a través del Internet en su casa. Juan Carlos vive en  alquiler en una casa  la misma que queda ubicada en la zona de San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero  y no tiene hijos. Juan Carlos es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2009 y nunca ha fallado en sus pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Carlos is employed at La Merced Hospital in the city of La Paz. He is in charge of pricing. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a computer, which will help greatly with accessing medical information over the Internet at home. Juan Carlos lives in a rental home in the District of San Pedro in the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children.

Juan Carlos has been a client of IMPRO since 2009 and has never failed in submitting his monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy a computer so that he can work from home.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jeniffer is an aggressive and determined business lady who was born in 1965. She is married and blessed with four children. Since 2008, she has been operating a green grocery store to make a living. She wants in the next five years to have expanded her business and to invest into other businesses. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy vegetables. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making finances available to her.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a focused and trustworthy 26-year-old businessman. He is married. For the last two years, he has been making a living by operating a computer bureau. He makes an extra shilling by repairing mobile phones and offering telephone services. He wants in the next five years to have several outlets and his dream is to own a communications company.

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a photocopy machine and a scanner. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for training him on business management skills.

loans.use: To buy a photocopy machine and a scanner

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo es chofer de taxi y trabaja independiente; su esposa es cocinera. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cemento, estuco y pago  de jornales a los trabajadores, pues intenta refaccionar tres habitaciones en su casa. Ricardo vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona El Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado  y tiene seis hijos. Es la segunda vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA. Ricardo tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno.
texts.en:
Sr. Ricardo is a taxi driver and works independently.  His wife is a cook.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy cement and stucco, and to pay workers to remodel three rooms in his house.  Ricardo lives in his own home in the District of El Tejar in the city of La Paz.  He is married and has six children.  

This is the second time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO, but the first time through Kiva.  Ricardo has a very good payment history.

loans.use: to buy materials and to pay workers to remodel three rooms in his house.

loans.name: Maria Encarnacion

texts.es:
María Encarnación nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú), tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad donD. nació y donD. desarrolla sus actividades económicas.  Ella se dedica a la venta D. carne en el centro comercial el Molino II.  Ella antes vendía D. forma ambulatoria en la Avenida del Ejército pero por buena gestión D. las autoridades ahora ella tiene un puesto D. venta en el Molino II. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad María Encarnación requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo carne D. cerdo, cordero y otro tipo D. carne. Su sueño D. María Encarnación es comprarse un carro para hacerlo trabajar.

El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
María Encarnación was born in the city of Cusco, Peru. She is 50 years old, married, and has four children. María currently lives in Cusco, where she has developed her business activities. She sells meat at El Molino II central market. Previously she sold as a street vendor along “Avenida del Ejército”. As a result of the good rapport she has with the authorities, María now has a vending stall at El Molino II. She has already been in business for 25 years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. María Encarnación is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as pork, lamb, and other types of meat. Her dream is to buy a car that she can use for work.

The Communal Bank “El Molinito II” meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco in Peru. This city is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy pork, lamb, and other types of meat.

loans.name: Johana De Jesus

texts.es: Johanna De Jesus tiene su negocioq que es ofrecer el servicio de nintendos. hace mas de 6 años que tiene esta actividad, la ubicacion de su local es frente al paque en donde llegan una gran parte de niños, que son quienes mas visitan su negocio. ella es una joven muy resposanble pues tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo de 18,14 y 9 años respectivamente. el credito que solicita es para la compra de cables, consolas, discos y nuevos juegos.
texts.en: Johanna De Jesús’s business is providing Nintendo games services.  She’s been in business over 6 years.  Her business is located across from the park where a great number of children come to play; they are the ones that most visit her business.  She is a very responsible young woman because she has three minors who are 18, 14 and 9 years of age in her care.  The loan she’s requesting is to buy cables, consoles, discs and new games.

loans.use: to buy cables, consoles, discs and new games.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine lives in Uganda. She is single with four children and all of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Justine has a wholesale shop at the market. She sells her products on a wholesale basis only. She has been in business for the last five years. Justine works seven days a week. Her major challenge is transportation and the increasing prices of commodities, which affects customer turnout. Her aspiration is to own a fully stocked shop and to educate her children up to university. She has requested for a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, a bag of rice and bars of soap. Justine lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses are food, paying utility bills, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives in Uganda. She is single with four children who all go to school. Mary has a bananas stall. She sells on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. Mary works seven days a week. Her major challenge is seasonality and defaulters. She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Besides this food business, Mary generates additional income by selling local gin. Her aspirations are to build rental houses and to start going to farmers for her bananas. Mary lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dry cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shirts, ties and blouses

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 42-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal town. He lives in his own semi-permanent house together with his children. His dream is to build a permanent house that can accommodate his whole family. He has been in the transportation business for four years now and he says he has so far encountered no big challenges and his dream is to own at least five motorcycles. John needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for business purposes.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for business purposes.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Félix es empleado en la empresa Ema Verde en el cargo de  mecánico. El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de galpón en su casa, donde pueda atender clientes particulares que tienen problemas con sus vehículos. Así tendrá la posibilidad de comenzar un negocio propio y mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona 8 de Diciembre en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado  y tiene cinco hijos. Es la segunda vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Félix is employed at Ema Verde as a Mechanic.  The loan he’s requesting is to build a shed at home where he can take care of private customers with car problems.  This way he’ll have the possibility of starting a business of his own to improve his income.  He lives in his own house located in La Paz’s 8 de Diciembre zone.  He’s married and has five children.  This is his second IMPRO loan and also the second time with KIVA.

loans.use: to build a shed at home to tend to private customers with car problems.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize and millet flour for resale.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah lives in Uganda. She is single with three children who all go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member (an orphan). Hadjah sells cassava chips, chapatti, samosas and pancakes .She has been in business for the last six years. Hadjah sells her products to the market. She works seven days a week. Hadjah has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of cooking oil for frying cassava chips, baking flour for chapatti and cowpeas. The main business challenge is the change in seasonality and the ever-increasing price of commodities in Uganda. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children and to set up a retail shop. Hadjah lives in a rented house and has access to piped water and electricity. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, baking flour and cowpeas

loans.name: Elviz Rafael

texts.es:
Elviz de 20 años, vive con su familia en casa de sus padres, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Reque que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Elviz desde hace un año se dedica a la comercialización de animales de corral (vacas, ovejas y aves de corral), los cría en los corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para compra de animales como alimento balanceado, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará su calidad de vida.  Elviz con trabajo y esmero a logrado sacar adelante poco a poco a su familia, algo que le da mucha alegria para seguir superandose.
texts.en:
Elviz is 20 years old. He lives with his family in his parents' house, which has only electrical service. It is located in the rural part of the district of Reque, which belongs to the province of Chiclayo.  It is an area characterized by farming and ranching activity. 

For the past year, Elviz has worked selling farm animals (cows, sheep and domestic birds). He raises them in pens which he maintains behind his house. He feeds them balanced animal feed, grains and natural grasses. Once they have completed their growth, he sells them to customers in the various markets of the area, and with the income he can cover his family obligations. 

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 Peruvian new soles, to buy animals as well as balanced feed. Once he fattens the animals he will sell them to his customers. With the earnings he obtains, he will pay off the loan granted to him and will also improve his quality of life. With hard work and effort, Elviz has been able to help his family get ahead little by little, and it gives him much joy to continue improving his life.

loans.use: to buy farm animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the exotic plant magnon kisseni, perfumes, and calebasses

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 31 years old and married with two children in school.  He runs a laundry business to earn a living.  He has been engaged in the business for five years and has employed one person.  Previously, he used to sell newspapers for a living.  

Through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in business management.  He hopes to expand his business in the future.  He needs 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dry-cleaning machine.

loans.use: To buy a dry-cleaning machine

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio requires a loan to buy diverse inventory, such as shoes and secondhand appliances. He sells them mostly in his house and by walking (specially the shoes). He has been running his business for two years. Antonio lives in the Hato Mayor region of the Dominican Republic, located in the eastern part of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture.

Antonio has taken out four loans with field partner Esperanza International over the past two years. All of the loans have been paid back in full. He has used these loans to diversify the products that he sells. He is very excited about taking out this loan so that he can continue to grow his business.

Antonio says that his favorite thing is to do business and his most important challenge is to establish his business. He hopes to have solvency to solve any needs in the coming future. He has two children who live with their mother. They have been living separate for a long time. Even he said it is not a problem to provide for everything his children need.

loans.use: to buy shoes and secondhand appliances.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida de 52 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Nelida desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtiene buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado, para seguir engoradando a sus ovejas para venderlas, con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Nelida es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos se superen y  mejorar económicamente para brindarle los estudios necesarios.
texts.en:
Nelida is 52, and lives with her husband and children in their own house.  The house, which lacks basic services, is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, in Cajamarca department. This area is characterized by farming, livestock-raising, and tourism. 

Nelida has raised and sold sheep for many years. Her corral is in back of her house, a large and suitable area.  She provides them with balanced feed, and natural grazing.  Once they attain their optimal growth, she sells them in the different markets in the area. In this way, she obtains good profits to meet her daily household expenses.  

She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed, in order to continue fattening her sheep for sale. With the income she gets, she can pay off her loan, and improve her family's quality of life.

Nelida is a hard-working and responsible woman.  All she wants is for her children to succeed in life, and to improve her finances so that she can offer them the necessary education.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her animals.
